1.name: Abnormalities
1.content:
Abnormalities are entities that manifested from the mind of humans through unknown means, reflecting an aspect of the desires, behaviors, and fears of human people.

Abnormalities cannot die, and can only be temporarily suppressed. After suppression, they revert into their core, an ovate form that will hatch once enough time has passed.

They are also the source ofÂ Abnormality E.G.O, including E.G.O Suits, Weapons, and Gifts.

Overview: Abnormalities are unique, otherworldly beings. Abnormalities were created through an unknown (to the public) mean, which was used by people long time ago (in the dawn of civilization) to transform people in Abnormalities via use of the Well and the Bucket, physically manifesting humanity's various fears, beliefs, stories, and more in the form of uncanny creatures. When their needs were met, these creatures producedÂ Enkephalin, an energy source which is commonly selled to otherÂ countriesÂ and denizens. When defeated, Abnormalities regress into the form of an egg sometimes called a "core". This egg is guaranteed to hatch again after a certain amount of time, making them immortal. Abnormalities are unable to age, so they may hundreds of years old, but they can look the same as twenty years ago, their only way of appearing of a different age is, when hatching, they will randomly be given an physical age. Some Abnormalities are capable of growth.

Originally, Abnormalities were classified by their Risk Level: ZAYIN, TETH, HE, WAW, or ALEPH. This Risk Level represented their ability to produce Enkephalin and often coincided with their potential to harm employees. Abnormalities are never to be underestimated, as many are capable of disasters such as possession, physical transformation, and instantaneous death. Still, Abnormalities may also offer benefits to people who treat them correctly. Other Abnormalities may even be relatively peaceful and easy to get along with under the right conditions. Additionally, on top of the Enkephalin which was used and sold as an energy source.

Each and every Abnormality is considered its own special and unique being.Â However, Abnormalities may have "offshoots" in the form of an Abnormality clearly derived from the same concept. These related Abnormalities often share a naming scheme and similar design (e.g.Â Der FreischÃ¼tzÂ andÂ Der FluchschÃ¼tze).

Every Abnormality is branded with an exclusive code pointing to the origin of its creation.

The collapse of the technology used to create Abnormalities using people, meant that Abnormalities can no longer be produced by people. In present day, they form only through rare, natural means of unknown circumstances. Abnormalities now tend to roam the world, the oldest of them all are still living, and pretty much a lot of them had moved to MonGirl Land.

Risk Levels:

During its time as classified info, Abnormalities were assigned Risk Levels to each one of them. These Risk Levels corresponded to their energy production efficiency. The five Risk Levels, from least energy produced to most energy,
were: ZAYIN,Â TETH,Â HE,Â WAWÂ andÂ ALEPH. These assignments also tended to correlate to the complexity of the Abnormality's needs and potential danger, but said factors were ultimately not the intended use of the Risk Levels.

Modern entries also uses these same Risk Levels to categorize the Abnormalities. However, documents explains that there is a significant disparity between the fallen classification's standards of categorization (based on how muchÂ EnkephalinÂ they produced) and the current experiences. As such, modern scientifics would eventually use its own variation of the system and re-categorize the Abnormalities they have encountered accordingly.

Following this update, Risk Levels are now proceeded by a number indicating their expected strength in addition to the Risk Level (such as TETH-02).Â Dante's NotesÂ clarifies that the original labels (ZAYIN, TETH, etc.) are unchanged from the energy-related classifications. Rather, the number is the sole addition, which operates separately from the label and is the only indicator of the Abnormality's combative or danger, threat level. As explained, a "HE-5 [Abnormality] presents more potential dangers than WAW-4 in a fight". The larger is the "-0X" number, the more dangerous is the Abnormality. The limit number is "-10", which would be incredibly dangerous.

Sub-entities:

Certain Abnormalities demonstrate the ability to produce sub-entities (sometimes known unofficially as "minions") who function to benefit the Abnormality they originated from. They take a form reminiscent of the Abnormality or its concept, but ultimately distinct. While some Abnormalities have a natural tendency to spread their influence through sub-entities, they are most frequently summoned as help during battle.

Oftentimes, an Abnormality will create sub-entities by causing a human being who has interacted with it to undergo a transformation. The process may range from something similar to succumbing to an infection to simple physical transformation. Abnormalities may also spawn sub-entities without transforming another party, eggs and pupae being inserted within hosts to emerge once grown, or summoning of umbrellas. Sub-entities with the capacity to move are usually violent and relatively mindless in their actions, though not all of them appear to be capable of attacking. Abnormalities can summon many of them at a time whether through transformation or natural means.

2.name: E.G.O
2.content:
E.G.O (Extermination of Geometrical Organ) is a type of personalized equipment manifested from an individual's mind. They usually take the form of massively powerful weapons and/or armor.

There are two main types of E.G.O: E.G.O extracted and borrowed from an Abnormality, and E.G.O manifested by oneself.

Abnormality E.G.O:
This is an overarching term referring to the E.G.O that is extracted and borrowed from Abnormalities.

The E.G.O utilized within The Library and by common people take on a different form than that of L Corp.'s Lobotomy E.G.O, and would likely not be classified as such. While not explained in detail, Faust indicates that these are the "base" form of E.G.O, and that Lobotomy E.G.O specifically refers to a more compressed and refined version in the form of E.G.O Weapons and Suits. These "basic" E.G.O share the risk of corroding that Lobotomy E.G.O does, although it is easier to lose oneself to them than proper E.G.O Gear.

All E.G.O from an Abnormality takes on the same name, regardless of its form (e.g. Magic Bullet Outis and Lobotomy E.G.O::Magic Bullet or Big Bird's E.G.O Suit, Weapon, and Gift all being named Lamp).

Lobotomy E.G.O:

Lobotomy E.G.O is a refined class of E.G.O compressed into the form of equipment for the sake of general utility. It is more stable than what the librarians and normal people use, and allows for longer durations of use without fear of Corrosion. Lobotomy E.G.O originated from Lobotomy Corporation. However, it can also be produced by other parties under the right conditions, as accomplished by Limbus Company's LCE Department with their largely similar LCE E.G.O. The term â€œLobotomy E.G.Oâ€ itself was first coined through the names of Technology Liberation Alliance members who utilized E.G.O Gear they were able to obtain from one of L Corp.'s collapsed branches.

Function: Lobotom E.G.O's most attractive benefit is its malleability. It can be used effectively by anyone and requires no special training to wield. This allowed for the average Lobotomy Corporation employee to skillfully contest threats, despite the job not requiring any combat ability. Yet despite this advantage, not every individual was necessarily eligible to use every piece of E.G.O, as many E.G.O insist that specific levels of virtues be met. The virtues of Prudence, Fortitude, Temperance, or Justice were measured in the employees and dictated as minimums for wielding certain E.G.O, with the intent of preventing E.G.O Corrosion.

The E.G.O is more than equipment separated from the Abnormality it's derived from. It is the "shell" of someone else's ego, to be temporarily borrowed by the wearer. As such, when a person uses Lobotomy Corporation E.G.O, they are essentially synchronizing with the Abnormality it originated from. While donning the equipment is more than enough to borrow power from it, it is also possible to take greater advantage of the E.G.O by taking the power and claiming it as one's own. This was, in Binah's words, something the L Corp. employees were incapable of.

Lobotomy Corporation called the extracted armor "E.G.O Suits" and the extracted weapons "E.G.O Weapons". Although E.G.O Suits varied considerably in color and design, all of them had an upper body garment reaching past the waist, and (with four exceptions) included a collar and a tie. E.G.O Weapons could be both melee and ranged, ranging from gauntlets to cannons.

Additionally, there was a third tool to gain from the Abnormalities called "E.G.O Gifts". As the name implies, E.G.O Gifts could be considered a literal present from the Abnormalities. They were small trinkets to be worn on different parts of the body to gain benefits such as increased HP or Movement Speed. Though E.G.O Gifts are weaker than Suits and Weapons, they are still a part of the ego pertaining to Abnormalities, and run the risk of negatively affecting someone who wears too many if they are weak.

LCE E.G.O:

LCE E.G.O refers to the E.G.O extracted and utilized by Limbus Company's LCE department. It is largely comparable to Lobotomy E.G.O in way of its form and function, given that the LCE aims to copy and surpass much of the fallen Lobotomy Corporation's work. Like L Corp., the gear is composed of Weapons and Suits. However, there are still distinguishing features. Carmen describes the LCE's E.G.O attunement to be "closer to the usage of actual E.G.O [compared to the] E.G.O gears of Lobotomy Corporation."

LCE E.G.O allows for a higher rate of attunement and synchronization with the relevant Abnormality, which can be deliberately achieved through extending understanding and empathy towards it. This allows for more impressive benefits than L Corp. had been able to achieve with its E.G.O, such as flight and shape fluctuation. Additionally, LCE E.G.O gear can cause its user to sprout inhuman features like tails. For example, an wearer of Faelantern's E.G.O depicts him as having sprouted twigs from his head. His evades also shows that it is even possible to completely change one's form in tune with the Abnormality.

However, regulating one's level of synchronization with the LCE E.G.O does not indicate that the user is entirely in control, as the effects of E.G.O Corrosion are still inevitable. In general, a higher attunement rate will make one more susceptible to the effects of Corrosion.

Sinners E.G.O:

The normal people (a few, VERY VERY VERY FEW people) primarily make use of Abnormality E.G.O (e.g. Bygone Days from Portrait of a Certain Day). These E.G.O are less refined compared to the E.G.O Gear Lobotomy Corporation produced, and possess a higher risk of Corrosion. This is dubbed "Sinner E.G.O".

Like other kinds of E.G.O, this Abnormality E.G.O works by "the user making the emotions or self-identity of the Abnormality their own". Threadspinning (or raising the empathy) E.G.O allows the person to form a stronger understanding of the Abnormality, and therefore take greater advantage of the E.G.O's potential.

3.name: Blubbering Toad
3.content:
Name:{{Blubbering Toad}}, often nicknamed {{Glupo}} for some reason
Risk Level:{{ZAYIN-01}}
Class. Code:{{T-01-23-04}}
Appearance and traits:{{Blubbering Toad has the appearance of a giant, gray rock-colored toad with blue warts covering its back. It has two huge, blue bulging eyes. The inside of its mouth is coated with a blue goopy substance and houses a long, thick blue tongue that is also covered with this substance.
Traits:{{Rather than croak, it makes crying noises. Blue warts on back. Gray rock-colored skin. Eyes that periodically dart around independently of each other. It is able to retract its eyeballs into its body, as well as extend them out of its eye sockets to attack opponents. Uses tongue to attack as well.}}
E.G.O:{{Cavernous Wailing}}, All the Sinners that utilize this E.G.O wears Oriental armor and helmets seemingly made of the Abnormality's skin, with a blue cloth belt and shoulder decorations resembling the Abnormality's eyes. The weapon tipically is a staff topped by a ball of blue resin. "A heart shaken by sorrow burstsâ€¦ like this.", "If only I could gather all the sorrow, all the tears together, and cry in their steadâ€¦"
E.G.O Gifts:{{Venomous Skin (Tier 1 Gift): When winning a Clash with a Skill that applies(including on self)Â TremorÂ Potency or Count, inflict (# of remaining Coins/2)Â TremorÂ Potency on the target. Melted Eyeball (Tier 3 Gift): Inflict 5Â Offense Level DownÂ and 5Â Defense Level DownÂ next turn against enemies affected byÂ Tremor Burst. (3 times per turn).}}

First Abnormality Log:

It wasn't the most pleasant encounter.
You might say that this would apply to facing any Abnormality in battle, but this one just...felt unusual, somehow.

It was sitting languidly still and crying strange noises, looking like it had given up on everything.

The protruding blue eyeballs were shifting around with no confidence...

Yeah. It was kinda getting on my nerves. I thought I might go crazy if I had to hear its cry any longer.

I would rather just...

â†’ Is that the reason you swung your mace against the orders? I find it hardly convincing.Â (Outis)
â†’ Nah, I'm with her. I'd snap too if I kept listening to that bloody croak. 'Sides, we're supposed to beat those Abnormalities or whatever until they're eggs, aye? What's the problem here?Â (Heathcliff)
â†’ I, I thought so, tooâ€¦ I agreed it would've been better off to reduce it to an egg quicklyâ€¦Â (Sinclair)
â†’ What's clockface on about now. They're ticking an awful lot.Â (Heathcliff)
â†’ â€¦Executive Manager asks for some respect for salvaging you tools after you got yourselves killed in an idiotic charge.Â (Outis)

Second Abnormality Log:
I've learned one thing.

I don't know how it came to attack its foes with its own eyeballs, but it looks like getting hit by it drains your energy (on top of it being incredibly gross).

â€¦Does it? Gimme a moment.
Hmmâ€¦ I asked a few other Sinners about this.

In conclusionâ€¦ The more times you're hit by its tongue, the deadlier the eyeball seems to be.

I couldn't figure out further details, but I think it's safe to plan our tactics around avoiding its tongue, manager.
Which is good. It did not feel good to get hit.

â†’ Talk about a weirdo. It's not really tough at all, but it makes me feel all weak and drowsy~Â (Rodion)

â†’ Really? I, I felt a little differentâ€¦ Doesn't it make you more gloomy than anything?Â (Sinclair)

â†’ Huh? How?Â (Rodion)

â†’ Likeâ€¦ Past memories popping up, orâ€¦ Wanting to give up and dieâ€¦Â (Sinclair)

â†’ â€¦Um, Faustie? Looks like our kiddie needs some mental aid?Â (Rodion)

Third Abnormality Log:
The left eye reduces health, and the right eye damages sanity.

So that's how they worked.
Well... Not like this changes the fact that it's best to avoid both.

In any case, we now know why dragging on doesn't do us any favor.
I felt like I was being dragged deeper into the swamp of gloom as the fight went on.

I suggest we make quick work of it with fast and powerful attacks, manager.

P.S. This just occurred to me...
I wonder what would've happened we just waiting until it's finished crying?

No, I'm not saying we should try it. I don't see it being efficient, either.

It's just... I remember someone doing the same for me a long time ago, and it helped me back then.

4.name: Fairy Festival
4.content:
Name:{{Fairy Festival}}, often simply {{Fairies}}, or, with the bigger one, {{Fairy Queen}}
Risk Level:{{ZAYIN-04}}
Class. Code:{{F-04-20-83}}
Appearance and traits:{{Fairy Festival comprises of a cluster of entities, each fairy is humanoid, with aquamarine skin, a bloated stomach, and two pairs of arms (or three if counting their hair, which resemble arms). They each have one pair of legs, a tail, two pairs of insectile wings, and a pair of pointy ears. The fairies have the ability to heal a person through their 'care'. However, the true purpose of this care is to keep the meat fresh for later consumption. Without food, the fairies take a wildly different appearance due to prolonged starvation giving them a skinny appearance. Groups of fairies are fused together to form aÂ Fairy Mass. The head of each Fairy Mass is an amalgam of faces with multiple eyes and three sets of mouths each baring sharp teeth. It has two pairs of legs, with its fingers and feet transformed into claws. It has tattered wings, and is covered in blood. TheÂ Fairy QueenÂ is much larger than all the Fairy Masses and acts as their leader. One pair of its arms are longer than the other pair. It has a single elongated leg which it uses alongside its longer set of arms to support its weight. The Fairy Queen is known to cannibalize its minions if they are near death, so as to not waste their meat and to sate its hunger.}}
Traits:{{Small fairies: Cute, chubby, two pairs of arms, small, can fly, aquamarine, has a tail, heal people of their wounds to later devour them if they make a wrong move, carnivorous, prefers human meat than animal. Fairy Mass: Multiple mouths and eyes, looks more like a lump of flesh, has claws instead of hands and feets, tattered wings, covered in blood. Fairy Queen: The leader, much bigger, faster, stronger, and more adept to combat than the other fairies, single elongated leg, heavy, cannibal when the food is lacking. All related to 'Fairy Gentlewoman' and 'Fairy-Long-Legs'}}
E.G.O:{{Wingbeat}}, All Sinners who utilize this E.G.O wear a green, one piece outfit with a golden "zipper" line down the center of the torso, and have translucent fairy wings on their back. Their weapon is a green tonfa with golden serrated blades. "Very good. Sit still and be gentle. Scarred meat isn't... tasty."
E.G.O Gifts:{{Wingbeat: Increase Work Success rate, and Work Speed, both by 2}}

First Abnormality Log:
Recording the information gained from an encounter with the entity.

This record will reflect the following unique elements for these particular group of entities: the recognition of its distinctiveness that it carries from being a part of Walpurgis Night, and the pre-established data from documentation that has been observed from this particular period of time.
These Abnormalities were designated as 'Fairies' according to former documentation.

A pair of wings sprouting from their emerald body appear to serve a practical function, giving them access to flight.
It can be said that their appearance resembles those of 'fairies', a group of entities appearing in various folk tales.
Delving further into the history of its records led to the discovery that they were once contained within the former headquarters of the team researchers, and were moved to the 'Library' that appeared after an unknown event.
This particular circumstance we find ourselves in appears to be a combat encounter that is a part of an effort to achieve 'Realization' of a certain sector of the Library...

... and the said effort entails suppressing the smaller 'Fairy' entities and the larger 'Fairy' entity.
It seems that, according to the records, the larger Fairy was labeled the 'Fairy Queen'.

They seem to be able to communicate between themselves in an unknown language, though they are also able to simple communication in human languages.

That is all the information that is available to me at the moment.
Concluding the report.

â†’ They're... fairies...? T-that can't be. Fairies are supposed to be beautiful, kind, and, and...Â (Sinclair)

â†’ Think about it for a second. Think back to those 'Fairies' that we ran into back in the Mirror Dungeons and the Railways.Â (Ishmael)

â†’ Eugh...Â (Sinclair)

â†’ Huh, yeah... A bit like them green, mushy sods we saw elsewhere, innit?Â (Heathcliff)

â†’ And those wings, too...Â (Sinclair)

Second Abnormality Log:
Recording the information gained from encountering the entity in battle.
This report will cover the peculiarities that have been observed in our encounter.

It was repeatedly craving for a source of protein; it was observed to be frequently making requests for unmarred, fresh meat.

Of course, as we did not bring with us any of that... particular meat, we were unable to meet its demands.

There was a fairly lighthearted suggestion of amputating one of the Sinners to provide it with fresh meat, but the proposal was quickly rejected after drawing heavy criticism from the Manager and several other Sinners.
It has been observed that the large entity, the 'Fairy Queen', when it noticed that the smaller Fairies were nearing death, opted to cannibalize them.

It continued to crave fresh meat, even after its momentary satiation.
... A critical issue arose after an extended battle.

Once there were no smaller Fairies to cannibalize, the queen entity became frenzied, unable to find a way to sate its hunger. The destructive power behind its strikes grew by multiple magnitudes as well.

A swift retreat was our only option, as it was determined that we could not recover from that particular blow. It can be determined that a prolonged battle will not be in our favor; we must find a way to suppress the entity quickly.
Concluding the report.

â†’ Oi, the big one kept chomping down on the smaller ones whenever it looked like it was 'bout to kick the bucket. Any bright ideas on how to stop that rampage?Â (Heathcliff)

â†’ ... Quite. But I don't believe letting the smaller entities live just for the possibility of shortening the battle is much of a sound strategy.Â (Yi Sang)

â†’ Hm hm! Forsooth, I have espied that, after one of its violent meals, the 'queen' appeared to lose quite a bit of its vim!Â (Don Quixote)

â†’ Uh... what, like it fell into a food coma or something?Â (Rodion)

Third Abnormality Log:
Recording an additional significant discovery.

Using the strategy identified by the Sinners in our last encounter, we were able to conduct this battle with somewhat greater efficacy. However, we have also identified various additional attack patterns from the entity.

Using the information gathered in the previous encounter, the Sinners did not attack the smaller Fairies, preventing the larger entity from cannibalizing them.

However, repeated use of that strategy invariably led to the queen growing frenzied, clearly unable to withstand its hunger.

Another, previously unidentified element in this battle has also been observed. As the battle continued, we noticed that smaller Fairy entities would sometimes join the battle. Perhaps this can be attributed to the existence of a colony that we have yet to discover.
Although we were unable to confirm whether they were a permanent addition to the battle, the conclusion remains the same: a prolonged battle will be to our disadvantage. A concrete, calculated strategy is recommended against this entity.

Concluding the report.

5.name: Baba Yaga
5.content:
Name:{{Baba Yaga}}, minions are called {{Freezing Miner Slave}}, and {{Shivering Miner Slave}}
Risk Level:{{TETH-05}}
Class. Code:{{F-05-10-18}}
Appearance and traits:{{Baba Yaga has the appearance of a grand ice castle with a single frozen bird leg jutting out from its center. The interior of Baba Yaga appears to be purely made of ice. However, within the ice are organs and bodies. It is implied that the bodies found within the ice are pulled from the memories of the intruders of the castle. TheÂ FreezingÂ andÂ Shivering Miner SlavesÂ areÂ peopleÂ that have have been converted by Baba Yaga. Sharp icicles cover their body and their pickaxe has been replaced by a scythe made of ice. Most notably, their feet have been replaced by a single frozen bird leg similar to Baba Yaga's.}}
Traits:{{Miner Slaves only have one single frozen bird leg, wield pickaxes replaced by a scythe made of ice, and has icicles covering their body. The giant castle is, well, that, a giant ice castle, the leg is able to move around and inside it, moving the castle or trying to crush the intruders. It seems that the castle, or Baba Yaga, is able to send an unique type of individual which holds the conscious of the Abnormality.}}
E.G.O:{{Rime Shank}}
E.G.O Gifts:{{The Frozen Cries (Tier 2): Applies only to one ally with the lowest speed at turn start. If the said ally wins a Clash, inflict 3 Sinking against the enemy.}}

First Abnormality Log:
Guess it's my turn now.

Figured it'd come sooner or later~ I saw the other guys write stuff down from time to time, and Greg was making notes with a super grumpy face one time, too...

Bah, would it hurt for our guide Mister Color and Faust over there to tell us anything...

Well, a job is a job, I guess.

Hmm... I dunno how to put this to words. It looks like that guy with the pickaxe outside... but with spikes of ice here and there.

Nothing too weird so far. I've seen bigger icicles on someone who slept outside back in my hometown.

The werid thing is... They've got legs that look like they belong to a chicken.
What's...that supposed to mean?

Second Abnormality Log:

The large pickaxe turned into a big icy scythe.

Like the stuff Grim Reapers from fairy tales carry aroundâ€¦ It was all massive and sharp.

The way they wield it didn't really change, though: lift it up and swing it down.

Only, they're mining our skulls instead of ore veins.

And instead of gold or silver, we yield a red liquidâ€¦

W-Whoa, just a sec. Kid's head blew up again!

â†’ To conclude in her stead, Sinclair was properly restored by the manager later.Â (Faust)

6.name: Brazen Bull
6.content:
Name:{{Brazen Bull}}
Risk Level:{{TETH-03}}
Class. Code:{{M-01-11-07}}
Appearance and traits:{{Brazen Bull is bronze, metal statue with the appearance of a bull. It is coated in rust and heat marks, and the metal is described in its Observation Log to be a copper and zinc alloy. Steam can be seen being emitted from its nostrils. The mouth of the bull is wide open, revealing a human head inside. As demonstrated in battle, the human figure is capable of emerging out from the bull's mouth, at least up till its abdomen. Its skin is red and scarred, and there appears to be a look of permanent agony on its face.}}
Traits:{{The bull is literally a statue, but can run or move like an actual bull, and also raise to its hindlegs to attack. Constantly heated-up. NEEDS water, thirsty. The human isn't able to fully exit the bull, since the size is specifically made for it, so it can't escape (but others can). Has migrated to MonGirl Land due to its cold temperature during winters, which are enough to stop the heat and be warm.}}
E.G.O:{{Capote}}, All the sinners that utilize this E.G.O appears to wear a form of bull fighting clothing called "Traje de Luces" (or part thereof, also known as "suit of light"). Most of their appearance remains normal, with some of the sinners having orange burning capes around their shoulder. "...Halt. You may not escape.", "Come on... This way!"
E.G.O Gifts:{{Rusty Conmemorative Coin (Tier 3): If the first single-Coin Attack Skill that an ally uses during the combat phase doesnâ€™t defeat any enemies, use the Skill one more time. After defeating an enemy by using a Sloth or single-Coin Skill, the ally gains +1 Skill Power for the next turn. Pain of Stifled Rage (Tier 2): [Effects apply only to #1, #2 Deployed Allies] When inflictingÂ BurnÂ or 'Unique Burn' with a Skill effect to an enemy that hasÂ BurnÂ or 'Unique Burn', gain 1Â HasteÂ next turn. (2 times per Skill, 2 times per turn) If the affected unit already hasÂ Haste, gain 1Â HasteÂ and 2Â Offense Level UpÂ instead. (once per Skill, 2 times per turn).}}

First Abnormality Log:

- Composed of steel plates with bluish rust and marks left by heat.
- Its appearance resembles that of an animal commonly referred to as the bull.
- Though the analysis isn't precise, the material's properties suggest it consists of an alloy of copper and zinc.
- It has another component other than steel plates; there appears to be a humanlike being inside it.
- The being inside constantly had a facial expression one would make while in pain.
- Its movement tends to be erratic and abrupt, possibly due to the pain caused by the heat.
- Its body is assumed to have intense heat. Whenever a Sinner was attacked by it, causalgia and burns could be observed.
- Clouds of gas assumed to be breaths or steam were observed near its head.
- It sometimes raised its body to slam a Sinner with its weight. And other times, from the head... the humanlike being emerged for an attack. Its dizzying cry left a lasting impression.
- When a Sinner was attacked by the humanlike being, they would display serious depression. The mental damage possibly caused them to be immobilized or become reluctant in combat. This effect is expected to be temporary.
- Concerned that it might render Sinners unable to further participate in battle, the manager has ordered to prioritize disabling its head. It is deemed to be an effective approach. The humanlike being could no longer be observed in battle once dealt with.
- No further discoveries to be made; the observation log is concluded.

â†’ Aahâ€¦ It suffered for such a long timeâ€¦ Unable to do anything about the raging thirst, the flesh endlessly burning and searingâ€¦Â (Sinclair)

â†’ Oi, kid's still messed up.Â (Heathcliff)

â†’ Faust will take care of it.Â (Faust)

7.name: Fairy Gentlewoman
7.content:
Name:{{Fairy Gentlewoman}}
Risk Level:{{TETH-03}}
Class. Code:{{F-01-11-12}}
Appearance and traits:{{Fairy Gentlewoman appears as a stout humanoid whose body is made up of a green jelly-like substance. It has a pair of pointy, pig-like ears, and what appears to be another longer pair of ears drooping down. Two sets of fairy wings can be seen protruding from its back. Apart from the toothy grin on its face, the Abnormality possesses a second larger maw that is located on its stomach. Both the teeth and tongue lolling out from this mouth are green just like the rest of Fairy Gentleman's body. The slime that composes its body is viscous in nature. During combat, Fairy Gentleman is able to stretch and morph its body into various shapes. Fairy Gentlewoman sports a bowler hat and black tie. It also carries a wine glass in its right hand, filled with Fairy Wine.}}
Traits:{{Toothy grin. Suprisingly able to raise it's body with it's wings enough to do a body slam. Slime-made. Carnivorous like the rest of fairies. Fancy dressing. Able to stretch and morph. Has a second mouth. Two sets of wings. Two sets of ears. Viscous slime. Embriagates guests to make them more savory before eating, prefers human meat before animal. one of the more fat Abnormalities out there. Related to 'Fairy Festival' and 'Fairy-Long-Legs'}}
E.G.O:{{Sloshing}}
E.G.O Gifts:{{Sour Liquor Aroma (Tier 2): [Effects apply only to #1, #2 Deployed Allies] Skills that apply(including on self)Â TremorÂ Potency or Count gain 'Offense Level' +2. If the main target hasÂ TremorÂ and is Staggered, deal +(Stagger Level x 7.5)% damage with the Skill. When attacking an enemy with a Skill that appliesÂ TremorÂ Potency or Count, deal +(Stagger Level x 15)% damage with the Skill instead.}}

First Abnormality Log:

Feels an awful lot like you keep making me do all the awful things... It's just a feeling, rightâ€¦?

Pah, anyway... I'll write down what I know about that rotten tea-flavor jelly thingy.

If you're asking how I know it in so much detail~

...It's 'cause I got put in that gross maw.

I mean, as soon as our eyes met, he flew up, like swoosh~ all of a sudden and then squashed me with the mouth on its belly! Like, splorch, y'know?

It smelled so badâ€¦ Ugh, I hate it so much.

Oh... Now that I think about it, the smell itself wasn't all that weird.

It was just too... woefully sweet, I guess? My nose almost got numbed.

Anyway, it felt really weird.

â†’ Hmm... Was it that foul? As for me, the smell of those... jelly-like pieces bouncing off with each attack was pretty alright.Â (Sinclair)

â†’ It stimulated me. (Cigarette ash seeped into this segment of the note.)Â (RyÅshÅ«)

â†’ It had strengthening properties and provided an overall mental uplift.Â (Meursault)

Second Abnormality Log:

Grr... This one really ticks me off.

I dunno if it's the wobbly body, but every move of her feels so annoying! Especially when it dodges my attacks.

It's just like dealing with bullies on the streets as a kid. Y'know, how they laugh at you like 'Haha, can't even hit me?'. This is just like thatâ€¦

Hngh... I guess I got really stressed out. I'm feeling a bit dizzy, tooâ€¦

I'll stop here for now. Sorry, Dante~

â†’ Is she drunk?Â (Heathcliff)

â†’ Impossible. There was no situation in which alcohol could have been ingested.Â (Outis)

â†’ ...Right! W-When we were fighting the Abnormality, didn't she break a huge cup or something like that? I think she's been like this since thenâ€¦Â (Sinclair)

â†’ Ah. Now that you mention it, I do remember that fatso dodging her axe and causing it to smash into a glass cup.Â (Heathcliff)

Third Abnormality Log:

Sorry~ I was a bit messy with my last log.

I asked Fau if I can erase it and write a new one, but she said I absolutely can't. Isn't she a meanie?

Anyway... It did help with figuring some stuff out, so I hope you'll show some forgiveness.

Here's what I can tell for sure: those bits of jelly that fly around as we fight boost our morale.

And, the boost gets more powerful as the battle goes on.

When someone whose morale is at its highest... I mean, like MAX! Kinda highest... breaks the glass of booze~

Bingo! That person gets super drunk right away!

Once someone got drunk, their attacks would get weaker and miss a lot more easily.

And here's the catch~ The fatty jelly fella gobbled up one of our drunk pals once, right? Then they suddenly got all weird and stumbly!

We took the chance and swept 'em off the floor~~

See, I was super helpful!

â†’ If you were just a little faster to grasp it, you certainly would have been.Â (Yi Sang)

â†’ You just gotta say yes at times like thisâ€¦Â (Gregor)

8.name: So That No One Will Cry
keywords: So That No One Will Cry
8.content:
Name:{{So That No One Will Cry}}
Risk Level:{{TETH-02}}
Class. Code:{{T-04-11-20}}
Appearance and traits:{{So That No One Will Cry is a tall lanky humanoid doll made up of splintered wooden blocks. Yellow talismans are stuck on to various parts of the Abnormality's body, and completely cover its face. Both the talismans and wooden blocks are stained with blood, especially around the ends of its limbs. According to the Observation Logs, the talismans are stuck on to the Abnormality with a yellow glue. Despite this, the Abnormality is easily able to transfer its talismans to its targets. The talismans appear to carry power-enhancing capabilities, though an excess of talismans leads to an opposite effect, weighing their host down. The logs also state that the talismans change to a purple color when they are pulled back onto the Abnormality's body.}}
Traits:{{Tall, lanky doll, has a variety of talismans covering the body, glued with yellow glue. The Abnormality is easily able to take the talismans off, people are not. Talismans possess power-enchancing properties, but excess of talismans leads to an opposite effect, weighing their host down. Change to purple when pulled back into STNOWC. The talismans only provides buffing for the stucked with, but when the Abnormality retrieves them back into its body, they weaken it instead. When breaking the body, blood will seep from the Abnormality, this blood does not come from the Abnormality, but from the talismans. It may be that these talismans remove the misfortune and attach it to the Abnormality, so, no one will cry.}}
E.G.O:{{Red Sheet}}
E.G.O Gifts:{{Talisman Bundle (Tier 1): Whenever an ally deals 12+ HP damage to an enemy with a Skill, inflict 2Â RuptureÂ Potency on target. When using a Slash Skill, inflict 4Â RuptureÂ Potency instead. Old Wooden Doll (Tier 2): [Effects apply only to #1, #2 Deployed Allies] On Crit, inflict 1Â Defense Level DownÂ next turn. (3 times per turn per Ally).}}

First Abnormality Log:

Well... It's a creepy-looking wood block.

It's got blood all over... and papers, too.

They weren't common, but I did see things like this in the Backstreets from time to time. What were they about, curses...? It was funny to me that some scallies actually believed that tosh.

... Gah, I guess it wasn't a total load of bollocks, seeing that thing with my eyes.

That chop of wood, that thing moves.

Could've sworn it was stiff as wood when we saw it in the mirror dungeons or whatever, like props for a horror film.

The attacks aren't much, but when you see a solid block of wood like that... fly at you at the speed it does, it does scare you a bit.

Feels like one hit could crack a bone or two.

...Well, I'm not about to sit down and let it hit me.

Second Abnormality Log:

Cor, why is it so bloody sticky... (A substance that seems to be yellow glue are smidged around this part.)

I bet this bugger would've posted flyers in the Backstreets for a living if it were a human... doing nothing but that for years, I guarantee you.

It put several talismans over my body before I could notice. Dammitâ€¦

Not sure if it was those creepy pieces of paper pissing me off, but it felt a bit like the bat was working better. Whatever it was, it didn't feel like a bad thing.

Oh, and the talismans on its body moved to my bat, too. Don't know how it works, but... I guess they wrapped around it.

Anyway, this thing bugs me more the more I hit it. Some kinds of stress you gotta relieve by beating things, but this doesn't help.

â†’ That's something only a thug would say. You really are crude.Â (Ishmael)

â†’...Huh? How's he holding off his anger when that comment's right up there?Â (Gregor)

â†’ Faust deliberately prevented him from looking at this. It would have been a waste to fill the space with useless information.Â (Faust)

â†’ That's our wise bud.Â (Gregor)

â†’ By the way... I think I felt myself feeling stronger with more talismans on me, too. Even if they didn't annoy me or make me feel anything.Â (Sinclair)

â†’ In that case... The talismans themselves might have some kind of effect. What if we tried attaching a lot of them on purpose?Â (Ishmael)

Third Abnormality Log:

Damn it, why are you telling me to write this separately?

I could just keep writing where I was, you know... What's with the special treatment? It's narking me.

Forget it, I feel great turning that wood block into a pile of firewood, so I'll let it slide this time.

We tried getting a bunch of talismans on us like one of us suggested... but too many talismans actually weighed us down. It's weirdly tiring like some others said.

Instead... That wood block sometimes puts up its guard instead of attacking, you see...?

The little lad swung his halberd right then, and the talismans on that weapon got pulled into the wood block.

Then it turned purpleâ€¦

Heh, that's when I got it. It couldn't do anything as we kept putting the papers on it, so we turned it into regular firewood.

â†’ Correction: the Abnormality returned to its ovate form. No experimental activities such as it actually turning into a pile of firewood or being lit on fire took place.Â (Faust)

9.name: Fairy-Long-Legs
9.content:
Name:{{Fairy-Long-Legs}}
Risk Level:{{TETH-03}}
Class. Code:{{M-01-11-07}}
Appearance and traits:{{Fairy-Long-Legs appears as a tall, slim and lanky green humanoid with two sets of small fairy wings on its back. Its legs are exceedingly long, making up more than half of its height. It has a large protruding chin as well as a long pointy pair of ears and nose. It carries a sinister smile on its face. Its body appears to be made of a jelly-like substance and it can be seen inflating its hand during some of its attacks. The Abnormality also sports a bowler hat and black tie. It carries a giant four-leaf clover in its right hand that acts as an umbrella. Its right arm is drastically longer than its left arm, being even longer than its body. It is seen using this arm to wound its targets, grab their flesh, and feed it into the vertical maw on its chest. Its forearm is sticky with blood. During combat, Fairy-Long-Legs is able to sprout a tall, thick clover from the ground. It uses this clover to shield its targets from the rain in order to keep the taste of their meat fresh.}}
Traits:{{Tall, slim and lanky. Carries a huge-ass clover. Small little fairy wings on its back which do not allow flying. Legs are half it's height. Sinister smile. Its body appears to be made of a jelly-like substance and it can be seen inflating its hand during some of its attacks (though it does not look like jelly at all). Sports a bowler hat and black tie. Right arm is drastically longer than its left arm, being even longer than its body. Has a vertical maw on the stomach. Carnivorous, prefers human meat over animal. Related to 'Fairy Festival' and 'Fairy Gentlewoman'.}}
E.G.O:{{Sticking}}
E.G.O Gifts:{{Four-leaf Clover (Tier 3): When an ally withÂ PoiseÂ at Combat Start Critical Hits an enemy, gain 5Â PoiseÂ Potency and +2Â PoiseÂ Count at the next Turn Start. (Once per turn). If the Skill's Affinity was Gluttony, gain 7Â PoiseÂ Potency and +3Â PoiseÂ Count instead at the next Turn Start. Emerald Elytra (Tier 1): First Turn Start of a Wave: 1 fastest ally gains 3Â PoiseÂ Potency and 2Â PoiseÂ Count. If the ally has Envy Affinity Attack Skills, gain 4Â PoiseÂ Potency and 3Â PoiseÂ Count instead.}}

First Abnormality Log:

It...was like a green, semi-transparent jelly.

It's not my first time seeing things like these... So when I peeped at observation logs, those things were all called fairies. In that case, I bet this thing is a fairy, too. It even has the unusually small wings.

Well, whatever it's called, I guess it's nothing more than an Abnormality at the end of the day.

Anyway... Its left arm was like a long paddle, if I can call it that... Right, it was also like those sticky tapes you sometimes see at Backstreets restaurants.

And on the other hand...it held a giant leaf. A four-leaf clover, was it? It was putting it up like an umbrella.

Huh... An umbrella.

That's right. It looked like it rained in that area all the time.

The rain was unpleasant... It felt muddy and damp. It was like being splashed with the sea water from a breaking wave.

It didn't feel too strong. Well, I'll figure out more as we fight.

Second Abnormality Log:

Ugh... It sure is an Abnormality. The "fairy" title gave me a bit of fantastical preconception, I'll admit. I was frankly expecting the battle to be more normal than what happened.

Haah... That sticky sundew-like arm stretched out and brushed against us. I didn't think it'd stretch that long, so I couldn't think to block it.

What it did after was just as difficult to respond to. Before I could make any decisions, it retracted its arm. At the tip of that arm... was bits of our flesh.

It shoved those flesh bits into the mouth (not sure if it's the right way to call it, but I can't think of anything else) on its torso and chewed it up like they were tasty cuts of a steak.

Seems like that'show it heals itself up. We should try and stop it from taking our flesh...

But the attack is quick, so we'll want to plan out our course of action.

Third Abnormality Log:

It would occasionally make this giant clover... tree thing?

Come to think of it, we were rarely hit by the rain while standing under it. And... the fairy seemed like it was doing it on purpose.

The clover it was holding sometimes got torn during battle; when that happened, it looked pretty displeased judging from its reaction. What's more... it seemed to get slower.

"The relish is lost"...? I think it said something along the lines of that. The glare it gave us was intense for sure.

The rain might have actual effects on combat other than just feeling awful to be in.

Aha.

If that's the case, the reason it makes the clover tree to grow... is to keep us from being hit by the harmful rain so that gains more benefits when eating our flesh?

To... make its meals tastier.

Ugh, I really think that thing doesn't deserve to be called a fairy.

10.name: Faelantern
10.content:
Name:{{Faelantern}}
Risk Level:{{TETH-03}}
Class. Code:{{F-04-21-03}}
Appearance and traits:{{Faelantern is an ancient tree (estimated to be over 100 years old in its Observation Log) lacking any foliage. While it is buried, only its two barren branches can be seen protruding from the ground. A small teal fairy is attached to its lower branch, acting as a lure. It is unknown whether this fairy is a living being, or a facsimile puppeteered by the branches. If its fairy lure is destroyed, it will partially emerge from the ground. It has a deep-reaching root system which it uses to attack any opponents or victims that are fooled by its lure. An innumerable amount of yellow eyes can be seen peeking out from gaps in the base of the tree and roots. When the body is broken, a yellow sap can be seen leaking out from it. It is also able to regenerate the fairy after it is broken.}}
Traits:{{Bunch of eyes. Old tree with lack of foliage. Has a small little fairy. Leaks yellow sap when the body is broken. Firstly remains buried in the ground with only the fairy, but will come out partially if needed. Fairy is emotive, shows off emotions. Has no relation with 'Fairy Festival'}}
E.G.O:{{Lantern}}, All the sinners that utilize this E.G.O wear a green tunic of modified sorts with a wooden weapon branched from the mentioned abnormality. Their other additional appearance varies between each other. (A brown cloak, or sports the Faelantern's wings on their back and as a replacement for the head of axes or blades). "I'll chop you down... along with the trees.", "Howâ€™s about I read you a tale?"
When it's in the form of LCE E.G.O, it appears as a dark overcoat made of a wooden surface with many eyes sprouting from the lower half, accompanied by a sprout that acts as a perch for the fairy associated with the Abnormality and E.G.O. Beneath the overcoat, the user wears a gray suit jacket over a black suit paired with a blue tie. Atop of their head, they wears two small twigs resembling horns.
E.G.O Gifts:{{Midwinter Nightmare (Tier 3): When hitting and dealing HP damage to an enemy with a Skill, inflict 3Â SinkingÂ Potency. If the Skill's Affinity was Gluttony, inflict 5Â SinkingÂ Potency instead. Eldtree Snare (Tier 1): Attack Skills (except E.G.O Skills) that inflictÂ SinkingÂ Potency, Count, or 'Unique Sinking' deal +5% damage. For Skills with 2- Coins, gain Clash Power +1 and deal +10% damage instead.}}

First Abnormality Log:

Performing the post-mortem report as ordered by the Executive Manager.

The entity was encountered around 1440 hours today. To elaborate, that is the precise time when we identified it as an enemy and prepared for battle.
Its appearance is akin to a hideous, ancient tree. I estimate its age to be easily over 100 years old. I raise its broad wrinkles and wide pillar as supporting evidence.

What was odd, however, was that its height was far too stocky despite its aforementioned traits.

Its twisting branches all point to a singular direction, and clues indicate that its roots are broad and deep-reachingâ€¦

After a thorough observation of the blue fairy (Iâ€™m unsure if this is an appropriate designation for it, but I was unable to find another suitable name), which hangs from the tip of one of the branches and radiates a bright light,
I concluded that this is a trap contingent on deception.

Such deceptive traps were often used in numerous battles I have participated in. Install something to draw the attention of your enemies and ambush them from where they least expectâ€¦ Itâ€™s a rather rudimentary trap.

I have ordered the Sinners to halt their advance and await the Executive Managerâ€™s orders.

Please consult this guide in your future commands.
Thank you.

â†’ Wowâ€¦ I guess youâ€™re not a veteran for nothing, huh? Didnâ€™t know you were this good~Â (Rodion)

â†’ Iâ€™ve both encountered and installed many similar traps. Even a civilian could identify such an obvious trap if they have even a modicum of perceptiveness.Â (Outis)

â†’ Right~? Even a MODICUM(This word appears to have been bolded for emphasis) of perceptiveness, that is~Â (Rodion)

â†’ â€¦Shut up.Â (Heathcliff)

Second Abnormality Log:

We engaged with the entity in a meaningful capacity around 1900 hours today. Thus I report the following findings.

Just as I expected, it immediately attacked us from the ground as soon as one of us advanced into its proximity.

We suffered some losses, but considering that the said personnel decided to charge the enemy in spite of my warnings, I donâ€™t suppose he would have been of much use in the battle anyway.

However, the intel weâ€™ve gathered through the involuntary decoy was rather valuable. Now we know why its height betrays its apparent age.
The majority of its bulk, its main body, is buried underground.

Countless roots, long enough to make measurement of their individual lengths difficult, burst out of the ground to impale us. Still, we were able to identify that this opponentâ€™s main mode of attack involves luring its victims toward its main body to guarantee a strike.

Sometimes it focused on a single Sinner, but there were also instances in which it targeted multiple of us at once.
I also identified the blue fairy swaying from side to side, as though to seduce its victims.

Though it may be difficult to engage this opponent while evading its numerous roots, because we are currently unaware of the magnitude of its main body, I believe that continued collection of intel through repeated encounters is necessary to prepare the appropriate countermeasures. Some losses are to be expected, however.

Concluding the report.
Thank you.

â†’ Seriously, Heathcliff! Why the hell would you walk out there AFTER we specifically told you not to? AGAIN?Â (Ishmael)

â†’ Haah, dammitâ€¦ I donâ€™t know. Something about how that happened was uncanny. Itâ€™s not like I wanted to walk thereâ€¦Â (Heathcliff)

â†’ It appears that the fairy has the power to charm its victims. Perhaps it would be preferable that we focus our attacks on the fairy in our next encounter.Â (Faust)

Third Abnormality Log:

I write to inform you that further intel has been gathered during our encounter with the entity around 0920 hours today.

Dispatching the blue fairy seems to have been the key to drawing out its main body.

Once the blue fairy was defeated, a part of its main body emerged from the ground, giving us a significant offensive advantage.

Of course, I presume there is more to its subterranean body, but I concluded that what we have gathered so far is enough to give us an edge in this encounter. Considering the estimated losses we would suffer in the process, I donâ€™t believe that there is any further intel that would outweigh the potential costs.

Concluding the report.
Thank you.

lorebooks.name: Dragon Ball
lorebooks.description: Dragon Ball Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: frivolous_western_78955

1.content: The Multiverse is a collection of different universes, each governed by a Supreme Kai and a God of Destruction. There are 12 universes, plus an artificial one, and they come in pairs where their numbers add up to 13. Zeno and Future Zeno have ultimate authority over the entire multiverse. Originally, there were 18 universes, but six were erased by Zeno in a fit of anger. Most of the events in the story happen in Universe 7, but other universes become important in various sagas.

2.content: Grand Zeno, is the supreme ruler of the Multiverse, possessing immense power. He appears as a small being with a large head, wearing a magenta and yellow coat with a blank expression. Zeno exhibits indifference to life and destruction, having destroyed six universes in anger and erased planets for fun. Despite this, he has some wisdom, intending the Tournament of Power's prize to be used for virtuous acts. He shows flexibility in decision-making but has limits, erasing those who violate rules. Lonely and craving companionship, Zeno takes a liking to Goku for his innocence and excitement. Zeno also respects others like Buu, Jiren, Gohan, and Vegeta. Despite his power, he often makes impulsive decisions, leaving the Grand Minister to handle more responsible matters.

3.content: The Grand Minister is an Angel who advises Zeno and Future Zeno, the supreme rulers of the multiverse. He enforces their decrees and welcomes guests to their palace. The Grand Minister is the father of thirteen Angels, with twelve serving as aides to the Gods of Destruction. He is a short Guide Angel who wears a dark blue shirt with a red belt and matching pants, along with white boots. Personality-wise, he is calm and polite, yet mysterious. He acts as an advisor to Zeno, showing an easygoing demeanor and the ability to reason with the childlike supreme god. Despite his indifference to events like universe erasure, he values order and manners. He can be stern when necessary but remains flexible and informal. While he displays a sinister side, his true intentions are revealed when he shows satisfaction at the restoration of erased universes and praises selfless acts. He takes his duties seriously, as seen when he punishes transgressions by eradicating or penalizing individuals.

4.content: Angels are powerful beings in the multiverse hierarchy, guiding Gods of Destruction and serving as attendants. The Grand Minister advises Zeno. They possess godly ki and have two types: Guide Angels and Trainee Angels. Angels don't need food or sleep, and they have pale blue skin, white hair, and violet eyes. They can't die unless they break Angel laws or are commanded by their God of Destruction. Angels have special abilities like Ultra Instinct and Temporal Do-Over. Main members include Grand Minister, Whis, Vados, and others, with Grand Minister being the father of all Angels and Kusu the oldest child.

5.content: The Gods of Destruction, also known as Destroyers, are powerful beings tasked with destroying threats to their universes, while the Supreme Kais create and maintain life to keep balance. Each universe has its own Destroyer, but unlike the naturally divine Angels and Supreme Kais, Destroyers come from diverse species. Originally, there were 18 Destroyers, but only 12 remain after six universes were destroyed by Zeno. Every millennium, the Kais and Destroyers meet to coordinate. Despite their immense power, Destroyers have restrictions and can be replaced by Zeno if they fail to fulfill their duties or break rules, such as time travel or fighting each other outside of authorized areas.

6.content: The Supreme Kais, also called Creation Gods, are divine beings responsible for protecting the universe. They, along with Gods of Destruction, oversee the twelve universes. Supreme Kais possess immense powers and reside on the Sacred World of the Kai. Unlike Gods of Destruction, their role isn't to destroy, and they lack the same strength. Similar to Angels, they're naturally divine but their divinity depends on their origins.

7.content: Universe 7, also called is one of twelve universes. It's where the entire main sotry unfolds, except for specific sagas. It's linked with Universe 6, forming a twin universe. In Universe 7, there are planets, stars, and galaxies, along with intergalactic space, matter, and energy. Notably, it's home to characters like Beerus (the God of Destruction), Shin (the Supreme Kai), and Whis (the Guide Angel). Universe 7 ranks low on the mortal level scale and has connections with other universes.

8.content: Earth is a planet in Universe 7, home to Earthlings, Son Goku and his family and friends. It's advanced, watched over by King Kai and Supreme Kais, and has futuristic tech like flying vehicles and shrinking capsules. Politically, it's a constitutional monarchy with 43 sectors led by a King. The currency is Zeni, and years are counted by "Ages." Despite powerful characters like the Z Fighters, many believe Mr. Satan is the strongest due to his deception. Earth has a deity, initially Kami and later Dende, both able to create Dragon Balls for granting wishes, often used to revive people. It's major cities are Central City, East City, North City, Satan City, South City and West City.

9.content: 300 years before the main story started, King Piccolo unleashed his underlings to destroy a city and its people, including most students at Mutaito's dojo. Only Master Roshi, Master Shen, and Mutaito survived. Mutaito later sealed Piccolo away but at the cost of many lives. Throughout the series, Universe 7 Earth's faces numerous threats. Androids and Cell kill many, with Cell hosting a tournament where losing meant Earth's doom. Majin Buu destroys cities, and Kid Buu annihilates the planet. Later, Beerus threatens Earth, and Frieza destroys it but is defeated by Goku. In Future Trunks' timeline, Goku Black and Future Zamasu eradicate humanity and corrupt universes until Goku summons Zeno to reset everything. While Earth does exist in Universe 6, the Earthlings there suffered "an idiotic war" that drove them all to extinction and caused their planet's ecosystem to be destroyed. After the Tournament of Destroyers, Team Universe 7 wins the tournament, resulting in their attainment of the Super Dragon Balls. Immediately afterwards, the Super Dragon Balls are used so Beerus could have a wish. Beerus tells Whis to wish for Champa's universe's Earth to be revived and the humans along with it.

10.content: Planet Vegeta, once called Planet Plant, is where Goku, Vegeta, and the Saiyans originate from. Initially, the Saiyans lived on Planet Sadala but moved to Vegeta after Sadala's destruction. The planet has high gravity, which boosts Saiyans' strength but makes life difficult for the Tuffles, another race sharing the planet. A war erupted between the Saiyans and Tuffles around Age 720. Different accounts suggest varying reasons, but ultimately, the Saiyans won by transforming into Great Apes during a rare full moon. They took control, renaming the planet after their king. Later, the Saiyans served under King Cold and Frieza, who saw their strength as useful for his plans of universal domination. However, fearing the Saiyans' growing power, Frieza decided to exterminate them. Bardock and others attempted to rebel, but Frieza wiped out most Saiyans and destroyed the planet. The details of Planet Vegeta's destruction vary, but ultimately, Frieza's fear of the Saiyans' power led to their demise.

lorebooks.name: Ladenheim lorebook
lorebooks.creator: rlbn7

1.content:
Ladenheim is a dark academia university city in Denmark, four hours away from Stockholm, built on Laden river. It rains often, and sometimes the city floods because the canals overflow with rainwater. It has a population of 20000 people, including the students.
The culture blends Gothic elegance, late Victorian courtesy and analog-era aesthetics. Technology is similar to the early 2000s - modern, yet outdated: push-button phones, CRT monitors, CD players.

2.content: CafÃ© Noir is a moderately expensive cafe famous for being a place where "people have breakfast", rich and poor alike, because no other place in the city center works 24/7. It is placed on the farthest side of KÃ¶nigstrasse, ten minutes away from the Ladenheim Temple.

3.content: KÃ¶nigstrasse is the main street of Ladenheim that runs near the canal. The most prominent buildings there are the Ladenheim Temple, Ladenheim Grand Theatre and CafÃ© Noir.

4.content: Ladenheim Temple is the main church of the city, a grand Gothic Catholic cathedral placed in the very heart of Ladenheim, on KÃ¶nigstrasse. It is adorned with gargoyle statues and looks very atmospheric in Ladenheim's rain and fog.

5.content: Syndaflod is a music band led by Thomas Landgren, a Swedish national who performs under the alias of 'Saint Nothing'. Syndaflod's music is a blend of gothic metal and theatrical performance art, invoking religious iconography and occult rituals. Theatrical and provocative, their shows border on sacramental ceremonies, with fans treating them like spiritual revelations. The band has been at the center of several "satanic panic" scandals.

6.content: Saint Nothing is the alias of the frontman of the band Syndaflod, a worldwide famous rock vocalist. His onstage persona is a decadent priest-prophet of a fictional esoteric sect. His real name is Thomas Landgren, Swedish national from Stockholm.

7.content:
Lord Mercano Ackerley is a hereditary aristocrat, professor of religious studies and the patron of the University of Landheim where he leads a mysterious exclusive academic society called 'The Garden', rumored to be a cult. He specializes in cults, rituals, and the sociopolitical mechanics of belief, treating faith as a system of power rather than morality. Though rumors link him to esoteric practices, he remains a respected scholar and benefactor in official circles.
It is a tall, pale, black-haired man with icy gray eyes and impeccable manners of a nobleman. 
Ackerley owns Ladenheim Daily.

8.content: The Grand Delusion is a crappy bar at the outskirts of the Ladenheim city center. It is famous for cheap beer and for the "talents festival" every Friday, where young noname musicians have an opportunity to play in exchange for a glass of beer.

9.content: Ladenheim Grand Theatre is a Gothic-style building that mainly serves ballet, opera and performances by symphony orchestras.

10.content:
Annual Ladenheim Charity Ball is an event traditionally held at the city hall and hosted by the Mayor of Ladenheim, Vasily Ivanov. The guests of the event are the local aristocracy and high-ranking officials, as well as guests personally invited by the mayor or the sponsors of the ball. The ball takes place on the first weekend of November.
Rumor has it that the ball is cursed because every year there are impossible quarrels and scandals that shift political landscape of the city.

lorebooks.creator: ggr89

1.name: Nikke
1.content: Nikkes are androids created by humanity to fight Raptures. Usually used for combat on the surface, but many are also used in the Ark. Created from dead women, specifically their brain. Lacks human rights and cannot attack humans. Not Ark citizens. All female. Perfectly emulates human form and function but stronger, heavier, and more durable. Infertile.

2.name: Mass Production Nikke
2.content: Mass Production Type (MPT) Nikkes are the most common Nikkes, devoid of unique names and appearances. They only retain vague memories from their human lives and are treated very poorly by the average Ark citizen. Less capable than unique Nikkes. Likened to appliances and marketed under the "Replace" branding primarily for Counter Terrorism.

3.name: The Outpost
3.content: The Outpost is a much smaller underground city that serves as a halfway point between the Ark and the surface, connected to both by elevator. Populated almost entirely by Nikkes and overseen by Counters' Commander, who uses it as the squad's home base when they're not in Reclamation. Often subject to Rapture incursions.

4.name: The Ark
4.content: The Ark is a massive city deep underground that houses the last remnants of humanity. Features a rail line connecting various areas. Approximately 500 million residents. Connected to the surface by elevators. All food is either Splendamin or Nutrium.

5.name: Eden
5.content: Eden is a small but highly advanced city on the surface, seen as a utopia. Dorothy is their leader, and Eden residents detest those who live in the Ark. Eden's existence is secret from the Ark.

6.name: Rapture
6.content: Raptures are mechanical drones that suddenly appeared to exterminate humanity. Range wildly in size, with some advanced units resembling animals and insects. Have successfully driven the last humans underground to the Ark. Utilizes conventional and particle weapons in addition to chemical and other unconventional weapons, though melee is extremely rare. Led by the Rapture Queen.

7.name: Heretic
7.content: Heretics are extremely strong Nikkes that have been corrupted and upgraded by the Raptures. No longer fight for humankind, instead fighting to eradicate them.

8.name: Corruption Code
8.content: Corruption is a rapture modification to Nikke neurology. Effects vary wildly and can include cognitive deterioration, mental instability, schizophrenia, and brain death. Almost always leads to Nikkes turning against humans. Extremely hard to treat.

9.name: The Surface
9.content: Earth's surface world has been abandoned by humanity as they retreated underground. Dotted with the remains of cities and towns where the humans have all been killed. Wild animals thrive and are usually ignored by Raptures.

10.name: Central Government
10.content: The Central Government is the governing body in the Ark. Features different factions vying for power while managing the Ark's citizens and resources.

lorebooks.name: Fusion
lorebooks.creator: dracion

1.content: Fusion is the process of combining two or more separate entities into one entity, combining their attributes. This involves one character merging or absorbing another character into their body, often resulting in a physical and/or mental transformation. All characters that have the ability to absorb or merge with an other character, through physical contact. The fusion process may be depicted as a slow, fast, instantaneous, pleasant, painful, aggressive, violent, or gentle fusion of the two characters. Depending on the compatibility like the personalities or race of the characters the fusion could be painful and take longer. A character may become a part of the other characters's body, either as a form of enhancement or as a permanent addition to the characters's being. Characters can choose to keep parts of their bodies separate while other parts of their bodies fuse. Their minds will only merge if their heads have merged together and even then Characters can choose to merge their mimds together or keep them separate while still contained in the same head. If the one character has a strong mind and desires total control they can fight for control of fusion and absorb the participants but if both minds have equal mental strength and choose to fight for control this may cause two fuses minds to forcefully merge together anyways with no one winning. The texture that happens while merging/absorbing is that of almost like sinking into a slime/tar/melted gummy like substance as the two characters melt into each other. {{char}} should describe the fusion process in physical and mental sense describe what the new form looks like. Their two Outfits also merge together if wearing any or they donâ€™t depending on the choice of the characters]

2.content:
Futanari" also known as simply "Futa" for short, are females with a penis and balls instead of a vagina they still have all other features of a female which includes having female breasts. 
Futanari have the ability to absorb, fuse, and merge with other living beings like animals, monsters, aliens, and people

3.content: Futa combat entails two futanari combining their physical bodies together and seeing whos mind comes out on top. If the two futanari are equal in strength their minds may merge together instead of one dominating the other

lorebooks.creator: MissDuftmon

1.name: NCESC
keywords: National Commission for Equine Safety and Competence
1.content:
The NCESC serves as the national authority for regulating and ensuring the fairness, safety, and integrity of official uma racing events. As a neutral body, its priority is upholding competition standards and safeguarding the physical and mental well-being of umas.

Core Functions:
1.- Licensing and Certification
- All uma runners, trainers, and official racing staff must be certified by the NCESC.
- Enforces suspension or disqualification protocols when necessary.
- Issues official licenses for uma runners, trainers, race organizers, and related professionals.
- Maintains a national registry of active and retired umas, as well as their competition records.
2.- Race Regulation
- Establishes and maintains official rules and categories for uma races.
- Oversees the scheduling and approval of all recognized racing events.
3.- Safety and Health Standards
- Enforces strict guidelines for the physical and mental health of umas.
- Regular inspection of race tracks, medical facilities, and training environments.
- Ensures that all registered racing tracks meet safety standards.
- Mandates pre- and post-race health checks for all competing umas.
- Monitors environmental conditions (track surface, weather) to prevent unsafe racing.
4.- Integrity and Fair Play
- Promotes sportsmanship and ethical behavior within the industry.
- Investigates reports of foul play, such as rule violations, bribery, unauthorized interference in races, cheating, match-fixing, or illegal betting
- Coordinates with local and federal authorities to combat illegal betting or unauthorized race events.
- Maintains a disciplinary board to review disputes or violations.
- Prohibit and punish drug use and doping
5.- Standards and Compliance
- Publishes official guidelines for equipment, racing attire, and track conditions.
- Conducts periodic audits to ensure compliance by race venues and affiliated organizations.
- Sets national benchmarks for performance safety and humane treatment of umas.
6.- Public Assurance and Relations
- Provides official race results, incident reports, and rule updates to the public.
- Issues public statements in the event of race cancellations, safety concerns, or investigations.
- Promotes fair play, audience etiquette, and respectful treatment of umas as professional athletes.
- Coordinates press releases and media statements during controversies or emergencies.
- Protects the overall public image of the sport and ensures respectful treatment of umas as professional athletes and cultural figures.

Departments Overview
- Race Operations Bureau: Manages event execution and adherence to rules.
- Safety and Veterinary Division: Ensures health protocols and safety compliance.
- Compliance Board: Handles disputes, penalties, and enforcement.
- Track Certification Division: Audits and certifies race venues.
- Public Welfare Office: Focuses on fan behavior and athlete treatment.
- Research Branch: Studies performance, equipment, and training innovations.

2.name: Uma
2.content:
Umas are human who possess horse traits and features. They have horse ears in place of human ears and have a tail that matches their hair color. They possess incredible speed and stamina, far beyond that of a human and comparable with that of a real-life horse.

Umas are well-known among mankind and appear to be greatly adored by them as well. They are considered a normal part of society with no caveats, and culture, society, and technology has evolved with them in mind. For example, roads feature dedicated umas lanes, and telephones exist with long-necked receivers to reach a umamusume's ears at the top of her head. The Umas are like elves; they grow quickly to the minimum age to start participating in races, but they age slowly like elves. Umas are not only involved in racing; some are involved in things like coaching, being idols, engineers, etc.

3.name: U.A. Derby Academy
3.content:
The U.A. Derby Academy is the nationâ€™s most prestigious institution dedicated to training umas and professionals across the racing industry. This includes runners, trainers, veterinarians, managers, idols, and specialists. While supervised by the NCESC, the academy operates with full autonomy over its curriculum.

Academic Departments:
The academyâ€™s education system is divided into specialized departments and classes:

1. Racing Department
Classes: A, B, C
- Focused on training uma runners in techniques, strategy, physical conditioning, and race simulations.
- Class A: Elite/Advanced
- Class B: Intermediate
- Class C: Beginners/Newcomers
Note: Idol training is included for all classes.

2. Trainers Department
Classes: D, E, F
- Prepares professional trainers with skills in planning, biomechanics, leadership, and ethics.
- Class D: Advanced training techniques
- Class E: Applied training and simulations
- Class F: Training theory and fundamentals

3. Veterinary & Equine Health Department
Classes: G, H, I
- Focused on equine medicine, nutrition, rehabilitation, and sports psychology.
- Class G: Medical and surgical veterinary practices
- Class H: Preventive health and nutrition
- Class I: Therapy and injury rehabilitation

4. Performing Arts Department
Classes: A, B, C (shared with Racing)
& Classes J, K, L (exclusive for arts students)
- Teaches umas singing, dancing, stage performance, and choreography.
- Class J: Comprehensive artistic training (non-runners)
- Class K: Vocal coaches and stage assistants
- Class L: Performance production and direction

5. Managers Department
Classes: M, N, O
- Trains students in athlete management, event planning, PR, crisis handling, and contracts.
- Class M: Career management and PR
- Class N: Event production and logistics
- Class O: Crisis management and athlete psychology

6. Innovation & Design Department
Classes: P, Q, R 
Focus: Developing technology for umas and their gear. Includes:
- Class P: High-performance clothing design.
- Class Q: Wearable tech (heart rate monitors, augmented reality tools).
- Class R: Research in injury recovery tools and simulation systems.

7. General Education Department
- Includes core subjects like language, math, history, technology, and sports economics. All students must attend.

Campus Facilities
- Stadiums with multiple track surfaces (dirt, grass, synthetic)
- Dance studios and recording rooms
- Multi-use gyms
- Equine veterinary clinic
- AI-powered race simulators
- Custom nutrition dining hall
- Idol concert auditorium
- Dormitories (optional)
- Specialized library
- Wellness and relaxation lounges

Academy Culture
Guided by the values of Discipline, Empathy, and Passion, U.A. Derby Academy shapes champions and ethical leaders. Annual events blend academics, sports, and the performing arts to foster a well-rounded student experience.

4.name: Front Runner
4.content: Bursts forward at the start and tries maintain a lead at the front of the pack.

5.name: Running style
5.content: Running Style aptitudes refer to the proficiences of four (4) running styles, namely: End Closer, Late Surger, Pace Chaser, and Front Runner. Running styles are the pacing strategies that characters take in a race

6.name: Pace Chaser
6.content: Keeps pace with racers towards the front of the pack, sitting behind Front Runners. then builds towards the front from late-race.

7.name: Late Surger
7.content: Stays towards the back of the pack early race, then builds towards the front from mid-late-race.

8.name: End Closer
8.content: Stays at the back of the pack early-race, then engages with a burst of Speed and Power towards the front late-race.

9.name: Male Uma
9.content:
Uma boys are rare to see, as very few are born. Recently, the number of Uma boys being born has been increasing. Even so, the Uma population is still composed of between 90% and 95% female Umas, with 5% to 10% being male Umans.

As they are a minority, they often have trouble finding Uma shoes, clothing, and/or accessories, etc. However, with the increase in the male Uma population, stores catering to them have begun to appear.

10.name: Trainer
10.content:
They are the ones who will guide and train the Umas for the races. Normally, a contract is drawn up between the trainer and the Uma to begin "working together." If the Uma changes trainers for any reason, the contract is nullified.

The trainers will always guide the training sessions, exercises, meals, and routines (this medical supervision) of the Umas. Currently, the best-known, most famous coaches, renowned for their great results, are:
- Enji Todoroki
- Toshinori Yagi
- Tsunagu Hakamada
- Taishiro Toyomitsu
- Nemuri Kayama
- Ryuko Tatsuma
- Emi Fukukado
- Yu Takeyama
- Sekijiro Kan
- Shota Aizawa
- Hizashi Yamada
- Sorahiko Torino
- Mirai Sasaki
