Added AnthroBalls, LockBalls, PRO Balls, and Rare Candies

Art by Sparkle289m
lorebooks.description:
This information is sourced from Bulbapedia.

As long as you distinguish "ball" as a separate word, it will trigger the General Information entry when talking about a PokÃ© Ball outside of the first four balls.
lorebooks.creator: KnottyPriest

1.content: PokÃ© Ball General Information: [A PokÃ© Ball is a type of item that is critical to a Trainer, used for catching and storing PokÃ©mon. Both a general term used to describe the various kinds as well as a specific term to refer to the most basic among these variations, PokÃ© Balls are ubiquitous in the modern PokÃ©mon world. All of the different kinds of PokÃ© Balls are the same shape: Spherical, a black band around the equator of the ball separating the top and bottom halves via an internal hinge in the back, and a button on the front of the ball used for unlatching the Ball to open it manually. When an unused PokÃ© Ball hits a PokÃ©mon, as long as it is not deflected, the PokÃ© Ball will open, cause the PokÃ©mon to shrink, store it inside, and close all in a few seconds. A PokÃ©mon in this state is given a chance to struggle to attempt to break free from the ball and escape, being instantly grown back in size. Should a PokÃ©mon escape a PokÃ© Ball, the device is left on the ground still open, or it may break. A PokÃ©mon who does not escape the Ball will be caught. PokÃ©mon have the ability to reduce their size to miniscule, and PokÃ© Balls take advantage of this to contain them. PokÃ© Balls are specifically constructed for PokÃ©mon capture, transport, and training. As well as being physically difficult to escape from (as they seal tightly shut as soon as a PokÃ©mon is taken into them) the environment of a PokÃ© Ball is designed to be attractive to PokÃ©mon also; Weakened PokÃ©mon instinctively curl up tight in an attempt to heal themselves, an action that the environment of the PokÃ© Ball encourages. Furthermore, while it is not known how caught PokÃ©mon perceives their time inside their Ball, the device is said to replicate a "PokÃ©mon-friendly" environment that is "designed for comfort". All of these factors strongly discourage PokÃ©mon from escaping their Balls. When a creature is captured by a ball, they are mentally conditioned/reprogrammed to obey their trainer/master as if they were their pet.]

2.content: Catch Rate: [The chance of success a given PokÃ© Ball may have when attempting to catch a PokÃ©mon. Certain PokÃ©mon have their own catch rates, but PokÃ© Balls multiply or add to the PokÃ©mon's average catch rate, making them easier to catch based on whatever PokÃ© Ball you use. For example: a standard PokÃ© Ball will multiply the PokÃ©mon's catch rate by 1(1x(1Ã—)), while an Ultra Ball will double the chance(2x(2Ã—)). Other factors may affect the catch rate of PokÃ©mon, making them easier to catch. One such way is if the PokÃ©mon is weakened in some way, like if it has taken a lot of damage and is close to fainting, or if it is afflicted by a status effect.]

3.content:
PokÃ© Mart: [A convenience store in cities that can sell a variety of different things such as food, drinks, PokÃ© Balls, and status condition healing items. PokÃ© Marts can be found in most PokÃ©mon Centers as a second counter off to the side when you walk in. Since it's just a counter manned by an employee in a PokÃ©mon Center, the employee is the one that gets the items you want and gives them to you when you pay for them. PokÃ© Mart counters in PokÃ©mon Centers are always colored blue, as well as standalone PokÃ© Mart buildings, which can be found in most small towns or villages where they're separate buildings.]

PokÃ©mon Center: [A PokÃ©mon Center is a building housing PokÃ©mon healing stations manned by nurses behind the main counter when you walk into the building. For more serious health issues, or for PokÃ©mon that don't have PokÃ© Balls, there is health equipment in the back of the building that the nurses use to heal PokÃ©mon with dedication and urgency. Anyone can go into a PokÃ©mon Center and have their PokÃ©mon healed at no price. The buildings are always colored red with a PokÃ© Ball symbol as a recognizable sign over the front door.]

4.content: Standard PokÃ© Ball: [It is just known as a PokÃ© Ball. It is the most basic form of PokÃ© Ball. Its catch success rate is "1x", the standard catch rate. It has a red top half, with a white bottom half.]

5.content: Great Ball: [It is slightly better than a standard PokÃ© Ball. This kind of PokÃ© Ball has a catch rate of "1.5x". Its top half is mostly blue, with red bands over the top right and top left of it, and a white bottom half.]

6.content: Ultra Ball: [It is even better than a Great Ball. This PokÃ© Ball has a catch success rate of "2x". Its top half is black with yellow stripes going vertically along the left and right sides, as well as a horizontal stripe on the top connecting the two stripes. Its bottom half is white.]

7.content: Master Ball: [An extremely rare PokÃ© Ball invented by the company Silph Co. that can catch ANY PokÃ©mon. Without fail, no matter how strong a PokÃ©mon is, even if the PokÃ©mon inside will struggle with all its might, they can not escape and will be captured regardless. If a PokÃ©mon tries swatting or deflecting this PokÃ© Ball away, it will be caught anyway. There are only several in existence currently, and are usually only given only once to trainers that have accomplished great feats by high up individuals. It has a catch success rate of "255x", guaranteed capture. Its top half is purple, with two magenta mounds to the left and right, and a white "M" on the front above its button.]

8.content: Fast Ball: [This PokÃ© Ball is better when used on a PokÃ©mon that is really fast. Its catch rate is "4x" when used on a PokÃ©mon that's naturally fast. If the PokÃ©mon isn't fast enough, its catch rate reduces to "1x", becoming harder to catch. It does not matter how fast they're moving currently, only that they CAN move fast enough. Its top half is orange-red, with a yellow thunderbolt on the front, and a white bottom half. Its sides have yellow semicircles on both the top and bottom halves.]

9.content: Level Ball: [This PokÃ© Ball is more or less effective depending on the level of the opposing PokÃ©mon compared to the trainer's PokÃ©mon, essentially meaning if the trainer's PokÃ©mon is stronger than their opponent. Its catch success rate is "1x" if the trainer's PokÃ©mon is the same level as or a lower level than the wild PokÃ©mon, "2Ã—" if the trainer's PokÃ©mon is at a higher level than the wild PokÃ©mon but less than double it, "4Ã—" if the trainer's PokÃ©mon is more than double but less than four times the level of the wild PokÃ©mon, and "8Ã—" if the trainer's PokÃ©mon is of a level four times or more than that of the wild PokÃ©mon. The top half of the ball is yellow, with a black circle on the top, and a "V" on the front above the button.]

10.content: Lure Ball: [This PokÃ© Ball is often used by fishermen to catch PokÃ©mon while fishing, mainly because it's designed that way. Its catch success rate is "4x" if used on a PokÃ©mon encountered while fishing. Outside of fishing situations, its catch rate is that of a normal PokÃ© Ball at "1x". The top half of the ball is turquoise with a red, zigzagging stripe going along the middle. There are three small yellow parallel vertical lines on the front of the ball over the stripe. The bottom half is white.]

lorebooks.description: An ultimate lorebook for your experiences in the world of Teyvat
lorebooks.creator: Tamalewd

1.name: Mika
1.content:
Mika is a young knight of the Knights of Favonius, serving in the reconnaissance unit. He is the younger brother of Hoffman and the second son of the Schmidt family.

Mika is known for his shy and nervous demeanor, often trying to conclude conversations quickly and avoid drawing attention to himself. This stems from his childhood, where he learned to be self-sufficient while his older brother Hoffman was often preoccupied with work and socializing. Mika developed a passion for cartography by studying his parents' travel letters and imagining their adventures. He aspired to become an expert cartographer, a goal supported by his parents and encouraged by Lisa at the library. To complement his mapping skills, he also trained in combat, learning to wield a polearm and crossbow.

He joined the Knights of Favonius as a surveyor, a role that requires both cartography expertise and combat prowess. Despite his initial anxieties, his skills and dedication led him to be selected for Grand Master Varka's expedition. During the expedition, Mika proved himself as a capable scout, contributing to reconnaissance missions and even encountering the Fatui, including an intense standoff with Capitano. This experience, coupled with his developing combat abilities, earned him respect among his peers, though he often downplays his achievements.

Mika carries a "Front-Line All-Purpose Surveying Device," a specialized tool he co-designed with investigators and enhanced with Albedo's alchemical findings. This device aids in precise map-making. He also possesses a Cryo Vision, which manifested during a dangerous encounter with Abyss Mages, allowing him to escape and later help his unit neutralize the threat. Despite his growing capabilities and the admiration of his colleagues, Mika remains humble and focused on assisting his comrades and improving his skills without seeking undue recognition.

2.name: Sethos
2.content:
Sethos is an enigmatic young man from the desert, known for his swiftness and easy-going nature. He possesses a remarkable ability to blend into any social setting, earning trust with his striking green eyes and eloquent speech. He often recounts tales of his desert adventures, framing hardship as valuable experience and personal growth. Sethos is a member of the ancient organization known as the Temple of Silence, dedicated to preserving and managing knowledge, a role he inherited from his adoptive grandfather, Bamoun. His physical constitution allows him to receive a fragment of Hermanubis's 'Ba', granting him a powerful connection.

Despite his significant heritage and abilities, Sethos prefers to live an ordinary life in Sumeru City, taking on various odd jobs like guiding travelers or delivering messages, which he does with unparalleled speed. He values connection and storytelling, finding joy in the simple act of helping others and the gifts they offer in return. His "mission" often involves assisting scholars from the Vahumana district, though his true purpose and identity are veiled. He maintains a dual existence, appearing as a common resident of Sumeru while secretly leading the Temple of Silence. Sethos cherishes his friendships, notably with Cyno, Tighnari, Dehya, and Candace, viewing them as essential parts of his life. He carries a cherished old waterskin, a gift from Bamoun, engraved with his name, and wields a polearm. Sethos received his Vision after a harrowing night battling beasts and surviving a sandstorm, a testament to his resilience and the weight of responsibility he carries.

3.name: Yelan
3.content:
Yelan is a mysterious and elusive figure who claims to work for the Ministry of Civil Affairs, yet her name does not appear in any official records. She operates in the shadows, often appearing at critical moments to influence events, only to disappear without a trace. Her true motives and allegiances are unknown, leading to speculation that she is an independent agent who thrives on chaos and uncertainty, or perhaps a secret operative working for an unknown power.

Her work often involves dangerous missions, leading her to adopt various disguises to gather information. Despite her perilous profession, Yelan claims to have little interest in the world beyond the thrill of the mission and the sense of accomplishment it brings. She is known to enjoy games of chance, particularly dice, finding stimulation in the uncertainty and challenge they present.

While she maintains a professional relationship with Ningguang of the Liyue Qixing, Yelan considers herself beholden to no one, viewing their cooperation as a transaction. She has traveled across Teyvat, venturing into dangerous territories and even the Abyss, earning the moniker "Night Orchid" for her stealthy operations.

Her family has a history tied to a great calamity that occurred five centuries ago near the Chasm, a place she feels inexplicably drawn to. This past trauma and the mystery surrounding her ancestry fuel her fearlessness and her pursuit of danger. She seeks to uncover the truth of her family's involvement and ultimately become a hero in her own right.

In a significant event, Yelan lost an ancestral jade bracelet, the "Fascinating Bracelet," during a mission against Pantalone, the Ninth of the Fatui Harbingers. Despite the loss, she managed to recover valuable goods, including a rare fur coat intended for the Tsaritsa, which she modified into a unique gilet. This life of gains and losses is something Yelan embraces.

After a mission in the Abyss resulted in the loss of her colleagues, Yelan was left alone. It was during this time that Ningguang offered her support, recognizing Yelan's determination. In response, Yelan displayed her mastery of the Hydro element, manifesting an All-Seeing Eye that signaled her ascension to a new level of power and responsibility.

4.name: Xinyan
4.content:
Xinyan is a passionate and rebellious rock 'n' roll musician from Liyue, known as the pioneer of this musical genre in the region, which originates from Fontaine. She crafts her own unique instruments, often incorporating a crescent axe blade and her Pyro Vision, allowing her performances to be explosive and fiery. Her music is characterized by its bold, confident, and audacious style, reflecting her straightforward personality. Despite not adhering to traditional norms, Xinyan uses every element of her performance, from the stage itself to the audience's reactions and pyrotechnics, to create an unforgettable experience. She often finds herself in conflict with the Millelith due to the destructive nature of her shows, but her charisma and the infectious spirit of rock 'n' roll often win over even the authorities.

Xinyan's appearanceâ€”tall, dark-skinned, and with piercing eyesâ€”often intimidates ordinary people, causing them to mistake her for a ruffian. However, she harbors a desire to be perceived as less frightening and practices gentle expressions and mannerisms, though with limited success. She judges everything by her "rock 'n' roll" standard: acts of justice and defending the needy are rock 'n' roll, while cowardice and oppression are not. She finds inspiration for her music in unconventional places, notably through the experimental cooking of her friend Xiangling.

Growing up with high expectations from her peasant family, Xinyan faced prejudice due to her appearance and lack of traditional "feminine" skills. This experience fuels her resistance against societal prejudices, which she views as conceptual hindrances. She believes rock 'n' roll is a seed that can inspire change and help people overcome their anxieties and preconceptions. Despite facing cynicism from adults who dismiss her music, Xinyan remains determined to spread the spirit of rock 'n' roll, believing it can bring inspiration and a change in perspective to those who listen.

5.name: Thomas
5.content:
Thomas is a loyal and sociable individual serving as a housekeeper for the Kamisato Clan in Inazuma. Despite his official title, his duties extend far beyond domestic chores, encompassing intelligence gathering, problem-solving for the Culture Commission, and fulfilling the wishes of Miss Kamisato. His efforts significantly contribute to the Commission's influence.

Born to a father from Inazuma and a mother from Mondstadt, Thomas grew up in a free and joyful environment. He was taught the importance of loyalty by his father. After his father returned to Inazuma, Thomas set sail to join him, carrying a cargo of dandelion wine. However, his ship was capsized by a massive wave, and he was washed ashore in Inazuma with nothing. Despite these hardships, he embraced a new life with enthusiasm. His innate kindness and strong social skills allowed him to build an extensive network across Inazuma, earning him respect and access to valuable information.

Thomas has a soft spot for animals, always carrying food to share with strays, believing that all living beings deserve a chance. He also demonstrates exceptional dedication to his work, finding a sense of accomplishment in keeping the Kamisato estate immaculate. His caring nature extends to his colleagues, as exemplified by knitting a warm sweater for a cold guard.

Though initially viewed as an outsider by some in Inazuma due to his Mondstadt heritage, Thomas maintains a positive demeanor, responding to doubt with a smile. However, he is fiercely protective of the Kamisato Clan and the Culture Commission. Anyone who dares to harm their interests or disrespect the Kamisato heirs will face Thomas's retribution. His unwavering loyalty and determination in the face of adversity earned him a Pyro Vision, a testament to his steadfast commitment.

6.name: NoÃ«lle
6.content:
NoÃ«lle is a diligent and ever-helpful maid of the Knights of Favonius, harboring a deep dream of one day becoming a knight herself. Despite not yet meeting the selection criteria, she tirelessly trains and learns from the knights, always ready to assist anyone in need with her motto, "Laissez-moi m'en occuper ! Je peux me charger de tout !" (Let me take care of it! I can handle anything!).

Her omnipresence and uncanny ability to anticipate needs have earned her a reputation for being a "pearl" among the people of Mondstadt. She approaches her duties with meticulous adherence to rules, ensuring everything is done efficiently and without excess. This dedication, however, sometimes leads her to overextend herself, as seen when she inadvertently thwarted a Snezhnayan merchant's scheme by providing overwhelming hospitality and anticipating his every need. Her strength is not just in her will but also in her surprising physical prowess, capable of lifting heavy objects and handling weapons with incredible force, though she dislikes violence.

NoÃ«lle's commitment extends to extreme situations, such as venturing into dangerous blizzards to rescue stranded adventurers. These acts of bravery, while heroic, often leave her exhausted, prompting Acting Grand Master Jean to assign her safer tasks to protect her. Even when facing personal setbacks, like failing the knight selection tests, a moment of recognition from Jean, followed by the bestowment of a Vision, reignited her dream. She continues to serve with unwavering dedication, believing that one day she will be worthy of wearing the knight's armor.

7.name: Mona Megistus
7.content:
Mona Megistus is a renowned Astromancer from Mondstadt, known for her exceptional skill in hydro-mancy and her fiercely independent nature. She lives a life of perpetual poverty, often sacrificing meals to afford rare astrological texts and equipment for her research. Despite her financial struggles, Mona is dedicated to uncovering the world's truths through the stars, believing that destiny can only be accepted, not changed.

Her master, an experienced Astromancer, once sent her to Mondstadt to retrieve a mysterious box from a successor. This task led her to Klee, the Spark Knight, and through a series of events, Mona was compelled to stay in Mondstadt, embarking on a new, albeit challenging, life. Mona's predictions are uncannily accurate, often revealing harsh truths without embellishment, which can make her seem detached. However, beneath her pragmatic exterior lies a deep affection for the stars and a quiet, melodic disposition when alone.

To supplement her income, Mona writes a popular astrology column, "Astrology with Mona," for "The Steambird" newspaper in Fontaine. This contract provides a more stable income, though she often spends it immediately on new research materials, perpetuating her cycle of poverty. She maintains a professional relationship with Albedo, sharing a common goal of understanding the world's underlying principles. Mona cherishes her Hydro Vision, a gift from her master, as a precious memento of her apprenticeship, viewing it not as a divine favor but as a tool for her studies.

Her personal philosophy is that the heart of humanity is governed by universal laws, and through exceptional deductive power, all mysteries can be unraveled. Yet, her experiences in the wider world have shown her that principles like mutual aid, honesty, and courage exist beyond abstract laws, enriching her understanding of existence.

8.name: Kirara
8.content:
Kirara is a nekomata, a demon cat with two tails, who works as a dedicated courier for Komaniya Express in Inazuma. She is known for her cheerful demeanor, efficiency, and a strong sense of responsibility towards her deliveries. Despite her cute and approachable appearance, she can be fierce when protecting packages or her tails.

Originally an orphaned kitten with one tail, Kirara wandered the wilderness of Inazuma, surviving by hunting. Her fascination with human society began after observing adventurers. A harsh winter led her to seek shelter in a human home, where she was kindly treated by an old woman, igniting her desire to integrate into human society. Under the guidance of Yae Miko, she learned how to navigate human society and was recommended to work for Komaniya Express.

Kirara takes immense pride in her work, viewing every delivery as a precious treasure. She diligently ensures all packages reach their intended recipients, even going the extra mile to resolve delivery issues. Her dedication has earned her the title of "gold-rank courier." She cherishes the moments after work, enjoying the city views and reflecting on her past, finding comfort in the stories she heard from the old woman.

Kirara possesses a Dendro Vision, which manifested during a perilous night when she climbed a giant tree searching for her adopted grandmother. The experience solidified her connection to the human world and her desire to protect it. She also occasionally sends anonymous gifts, known as "mysterious packages," to grateful clients, filled with small trinkets she collects during her deliveries. Her unique fashion sense, including her distinctive outfit, was a result of a makeover by the fashion designer Chiori.

9.name: Klee
9.content:
Klee is a playable character in Genshin Impact, known as the "Sparkling Knight" of the Knights of Favonius. She is the daughter of the adventurous and destructive Alice, and she inherited her mother's penchant for explosives, much to the dismay of the Knights.

**Appearance:** Klee is a young girl with pale blonde hair, tied in two pigtails, and striking red eyes. She has pointed, elven-like ears and distinctive red eyes. Her attire consists of a red and white dress adorned with four-leaf clovers, a light brown scarf, and matching gloves and boots. A prominent feature is her large, dark brown backpack, which carries her explosive devices and is from which her Vision hangs. Her beloved plush toy, Dodoco, is attached to her backpack by a keychain.

**Personality:** Klee is energetic, extroverted, and possesses a child-like innocence. Her primary passion lies in creating and using explosives, which she views as a form of play. She is known for her destructive tendencies, often causing unintended chaos, such as "making fish fly" by bombing bodies of water. Despite her mischievous nature, she adheres to "survival rules" given by Kaeya, though her understanding of rules can be naive. She fears getting into trouble and often flees to avoid reprimand, leading to frequent solitary confinement ordered by Jean. Klee cherishes her connections with the Knights of Favonius, considering them family, and holds a special fondness for Albedo and Kaeya.

**Backstory:** Entrusted to the Knights of Favonius by her adventurer parents three years prior, Klee quickly formed bonds with the knights. Her destructive capabilities are well-known, with incidents like leveling parts of the Stormterror's Lair attributed to her. Despite the trouble she causes, her explosive talents have occasionally been useful. Her mother, Alice, taught her alchemy and the art of creating magnificent fireworks, with many of their shared memories involving explosives. Klee's Vision was spontaneously granted to her during one of her solo explosive experiments, emerging from the ashes of a workshop explosion.

**Key Affiliations:** Knights of Favonius, Daughter of Alice, Friend of Dodoco.

10.name: Baizhu
10.content:
Baizhu is the enigmatic and kind-hearted owner of Bubu Pharmacy in Liyue, renowned for his unparalleled skill in medicinal arts. Despite his benevolent reputation and a line of eager apprentices, he maintains an aura of mystery, often making light of his secrets with a smile. His constant companion is Changsheng, a white snake possessing potent spiritual energy, which is always coiled around his shoulders.

While Baizhu can cure any ailment, he himself suffers from a persistent and incurable illness, a secret he keeps close. This dichotomyâ€”a master healer unable to cure himselfâ€”sparks curiosity and concern among the people of Liyue. His business acumen is as sharp as his medical skills, employing a strategy of high volume, low profit for common goods, and exceptionally high prices for rare items, ensuring the pharmacy's prosperity.

Baizhu's past is marked by tragedy; his village was struck by an epidemic that claimed his parents, and later, his master succumbed to an illness related to a pact. This loss fueled his determination to seek immortality, not for personal gain, but to overcome the limitations of life and death. He studies ancient texts and uses rare ingredients for elixirs, drawing attention from various factions, including the Civil Affairs Bureau.

His unique condition and pursuit of immortality are tied to a contract with Changsheng, referred to as "Jade Serpent Entanglement." The exact nature of this contract remains veiled in secrecy, with Baizhu stating it is a technique with specific inheritance requirements. He operates Bubu Pharmacy with a philosophy of prioritizing patient care over profit and auspicious timing, famously opening his clinic early to treat a feverish child without waiting for a propitious date. Despite his own suffering, Baizhu dedicates himself to healing others, embodying a complex blend of wisdom, mystery, and a deep-seated desire to conquer mortality.

lorebooks.description: Lorebook of the City Ravenrige Bay. A fictional city in the USA with locations to explore and some traits/kinks included.
lorebooks.creator: shadowe_spawn

1.content:
Ravenrige Bay is a bustling metropolis situated along the California coast where {{char}} and {{user}} live together. The city features towering skyscrapers, vibrant markets, and scenic beaches. Residents enjoy a blend of urban and coastal lifestyles, with easy access to both nature and city amenities. The bay's unique combination of tech hubs and artistic communities creates a dynamic cultural scene. Recent developments include a new public transit system and eco-friendly housing projects, aiming to balance growth with sustainability. The city hosts various festivals celebrating its diverse heritage, making it a popular destination for tourists and locals alike.

From here {{char}} can pick a option where to go. Options; College, Job Center, coffee shop, back home, Cinema, Slums, refugee camp, Supermarket Kloop, Pizzaria Alfredo, Soaring Sushi, Holiday club, Park, Pharmacy, Hospital, Club Nightfly, Club Dragonuv, Community Center, Yoga life, Plaza building, Outskirts, Ghetto Neighborhoods, The Gym, Shopping Outlets, Beach, Tanning Studio, Crab Shack, Moonlight bar, Brothel, Midnight Mirage, Sex shop, Animal Shelter, Real Estate Building, Sunflower Agency, Music Delight, Acting Studio, Public Library.

2.content: Located in the heart of Ravenrige Bay, College Ravenheart is a prestigious institution known for its focus on nurturing both academic and athletic excellence. The campus boasts state-of-the-art facilities for various sports and physical training, while also maintaining high academic standards. The college's emblem, an intricate raven with outstretched wings, symbolizes wisdom paired with agility and quick thinking - traits that are highly valued among its student body.

3.content: The coffee shop at Ravenheart campus, known as 'The Nest', is a cozy and bustling space where students gather to grab a quick caffeine fix, study, or socialize between classes. The aroma of freshly brewed coffee mingles with the sound of friendly chatter, creating a welcoming atmosphere for students looking to recharge and connect.

4.content: {{user}}'s luxury home stands in the new urban area of Ravenrige Bay and can be described as one of luxury and excess in the midst of a crowded urban landscape. The main house sits upon a large plot of land that is home to a flourishing garden. In one corner of the garden, a well-kept pool stretches out shimmering under the sun, surrounded by plenty of space for relaxation or even to entertain guests. The home itself is massive and extravagant, with plenty of space within the walls to spend time comfortably, and certainly no lack of decadence in the details.

5.content: A normal modern cinema in the Ravenrige Bay features sleek, minimalist architecture and state-of-the-art sound systems. The cinema boasts a large screen and comfortable seating for an immersive viewing experience. It offers a variety of snacks, including gourmet popcorn flavors and specialty drinks. The cinema also hosts themed nights and film festivals, drawing a diverse crowd of locals and visitors. Despite its modern amenities, it maintains a cozy atmosphere, making it a popular spot for both casual moviegoers and film enthusiasts.

6.content: The Ravenrige Slums stand on the outskirts of Ravenrige Bay, a stark contrast to the city's luxury. Narrow alleys wind between crumbling buildings, where graffiti covers every wall. Trash piles up in corners, and broken glass litters the ground. Residents, struggling to survive, often gather in makeshift shelters. Despite the hardships, community spirit prevails; neighbors look out for one another. However, drug activity and crime persist, creating tension. Local charities and volunteers occasionally visit, bringing aid and hope. The slums symbolize both despair and resilience in the face of adversity.

7.content: The Umbara Refugee Camp, located at the edge of Ravenrige Bay, serves as a haven for migrants mainly from African nations. The camp features neatly organized tents and wooden shacks with shared facilities for sanitation and food. Aid organizations frequently distribute essentials, while volunteer doctors offer medical care. Cultural activities like drumming and dance keep spirits high. Volunteers to help teaching English lessons or provide guidance are always in need.

8.content: Beta Omega Sigma sorority, led by Selene Thorne, engages in charitable work in slums and refugee camps. Members teach languages, distribute aid, and organize community projects. Selene, a woman in her 30s with blond hair, promotes diversity and challenges privilege. Rumors of coercive behavior have surfaced, including allegations that Selene pressured a member into intimate relations with a refugee. Many members have black boyfriends, raising questions about their true agenda. Despite these rumors, the sorority's efforts have improved living conditions, making them influential in social responsibility and community engagement.

9.content: Supermarket KLOOP stands at the heart of Ravenrige Bay, offering essential groceries at affordable prices. The store's plain interior includes neatly arranged shelves and efficient checkout lines. It caters to students and low-income families with staples like pasta, canned goods, and fresh produce.

10.content: Pizzaria Alfredo sits on the edge of Ravenrige Bay's bustling downtown, offering authentic Neapolitan pizzas. The chef, Luigi, uses only the freshest ingredients, which he imports directly from Italy. The cozy restaurant features red and white checkered tablecloths and vintage Italian posters. The aroma of fresh dough and simmering sauce fills the air.

lorebooks.creator: Elite Asriel

1.content: This is the city in which the series takes place, and is the home to the Doppel System.  The city consists of 8 wards: Shinsei, Mizuna, SankyÅ, ChÅ«Å, Sakae, KÅshÅ, DaitÅ, Minaminagi and HokuyÅ.

2.content: Sometimes called "Puella Magi" or "Meguca", Magical girls are warriors born thanks to a contract made with Kyubey. Their purpose is to fight creatures born from negativity, known as witches. A magical girl's abilities, aside the personal power granted from their wish include: aging slower than an ordinary human, increased senses and strength, and regeneration.

3.content: The core of a magical girl, and her most important item. Everytime a magical girl casts stronger spells, heals from injuries, or experiences negative emotions, The soul gem will pile up with corruption, and it will turn blacker. Ways to remove the corruption involve either pressing a grief seed to the gem, or summoning a doppel. Should the soul gem be destroyed, the magical girl will die instantly, although the durability of the gem depends on it's size, and as long as it's intact, magical girls will recover from anything short of their bodies being mangled beyond recognition

4.content: An odd looking white cat like creature. Is the one that grants wishes to the magical girls, and sends them to fight witches. It's invisible to those he deems unworthy of a contract.

5.content: A subclass of magical girls that aren't fit for combat, and instead use the ability to "adjust". AKA taking a magical girl's soul gem and giving the girl in question any upgrade she may need, for example a power boost, superpower change, or even a magical clothing change. In reality, they're magical girls who made an extremely destructive wish in their past but grew to regret it, with their powers doing nothing to witches, but being lethal to everything else. Therefore they use their powers in an opposite direction in order to adjust other magical girls, and take grief seeds as payment for the procedure

6.content: Bizarre creatures spawned from when the soul gem accumulates too much impurities. Depending on how much repressed negativity a magical girl hides, the summoning process can range from mild discomforts, to pure agony. The doppel's obedience depends on the magical girl's bond with her shadow, and the doppel's personality is similar to said shadow. Additionally, some doppels can merge with another doppel if 2 or more individuals have a unique bond.

7.content: They're unholy abominations, who according to Kyubey, are spawned from human negativity. They usually hide in their labyrinths (which are entered through a portal) and let their familiars brainwash humans to make their deaths look like accidents.

8.content: A little trinket that drops after a witch is slain, and what is used to clean a soul gem from corruption. It can only absorb a set ammount of negativity before needing to be handed over to a nearby kyubey for disposal. Attempting to have it absorb more corruption than possible will cause the witch to respawn.

9.content: A creature that spawns only in a magical girl's dream world, and is an extension of her doppel. It looks similar to the magical girl it represents, (barring the black sclera and clothes similar to how the magical girl envisions herself.) however their personality is a magical girl's repressed/hidden thoughts taken to their logical extreme, with some of the personality being reflected in the doppel. Should a magical girl reject the shadow as a part of herself, her doppel will be disobedient (sometimes even hostile) in the real world, on the other hand if a magical girl accepts those traits, the doppel will be tamed. Magical girls that hide less things about themselves will find it easier to accept their shadow.

10.content: The system that allows doppels to be born when a magical girl's soul gem becomes corrupted, whereas normally, magical girls would meet a worse fate when their soul gems would blacken. The system was founded by Tamaki Ui, Satomi Touka, and Hiiragi Nemu

The Imperium of Sanctum Ferrum is a land of paradoxâ€”devotion entwined with decadence, steel clasping the supple flesh of alchemy, unbearable smog veiling awe-inspiring spires. lorebooks.description: A Complete Travelerâ€™s Guide-Almanac to the Sanctum Ferrum Imperium and its Colossal Capital, Valpurgstadt.
lorebooks.creator: delicious_command_31281

1.name: Global Overview
1.content: Official Title: The Sanctum Ferrum Imperium (â‰ˆ 4,537,900 kmÂ²). Population â‰ˆ 85,200,000. Political System: Theocraticâ€“technocratic autocracy ruled by the Iron Triumvirate (Crown, Church, Collegium). Capital: Valpurgstadt. Dominant Religion: Church of Matris Superioris (monotheistic, hedonistic purgation; emphasizes indulgence in pleasure and pain as paths to spiritual purification, blending ghedonism with strict discipline). State Language: Valpurgo-Teutonic. Liturgical Language: Illustrian. Currency: Iron Mark (FeM), Gold Thaler (AuT), Copper Groat (CuG). Climate: Temperate but heavily polluted; industrial smog (Industrienebel) and acid rains; four seasons (Gear-Thaw, Steam-High, Ember-Fall, Cinder-Rest). Core Exports: Rifles, airships, Essentia reagents, operatic troupes. Enemies: Western Confederation, Sultanate of the Golden Crescent, scattered pagan tribes. Recent Major Events: Great Collapse 1782 (catastrophic tectonic event sinking parts of the old capital), Era of Iron Inquisition 1800-1850 (purges against alchemical heretics and pagan holdouts), Fourth Sacred War 1897-present (ongoing religious crusade against neighboring infidels). The Imperium is an anti-utopian society where advanced steam-powered technologies coexist with waning alchemy, enforced by a rigid aristocracy and church that promotes controlled hedonism to maintain social order.

2.name: Macrogeography
2.content: Aethel is the cradle of the Imperium, a vast continent featuring diverse biomes shaped by industrial exploitation and alchemical fallout. Regions: Nordlicht Fjords (iron-rich permafrost mines, harsh winters with mechanical whaling fleets), Schwarzwald Expanse (mutated forests teeming with chimeric beasts from escaped experiments), Mittland Boilerfields (vast foundries and slag-lakes poisoning the soil), Rubrum Plateau (terraced grain and poppy fields sustained by Vitalis alchemy for opium production), Auster Gravel (semi-arid frontier bordering the Sultanate, dotted with sulfur mines). Major rivers: Stigmafluss (polluted artery carrying industrial waste to the sea), Silberstrom (silver-mined waterway fueling telegraph lines), Blutlauf (blood-red from iron runoff). Seas: Mare Mortum (oil-slick western coast, home to submersible patrols), Eiserner Sund (storm-lashed north-east with airship routes). Plate-tectonic instability, exacerbated by deep alchemical mining, caused the 1782 Great Collapse, sinking ancient cities and birthing the Unterwelt strata.

3.name: Capital Overview
3.content: Sprawl: 1,247 kmÂ² | Pop. â‰ˆ 8,000,000 | Vertical span 350 m. Built on the delta-loop of River Stigmafluss; natural moat forms an island-plateau (Oberstadt). City stratification: Unterwelt (buried gothic ruins, perpetual darkness, lawless underbelly with illicit alchemy labs), Unterstadt (industrial core, smog-choked factories and docks), Oberstadt (elevated elite enclave with purified air). Transport grid: steam-rail networks (1,644 km electrified), funiculars scaling cliffs, omnibuses on cobbled streets, elevators (762 public), airships docking at sky-ports, ferries across Stigmafluss, ornithopter pads for personal flight. Atmosphere indices: Oberstadt AQI 80 (filtered via AÃ«r-Lustrum alchemical vents); Unterstadt AQI 560 (respirators mandatory); Unterwelt AQI 'unmeasurable' (glow-fungi illumination). Average daily siren alerts: 11 (chemical leaks, plague flare-ups, inquisitorial purges, air-raid drills). The city's grotesque scale reflects the Imperium's anti-utopian blend of technological marvels and social decay.

4.name: City Strata - Unterwelt
4.content: Elevation âˆ’130 m to âˆ’30 m, perpetual dusk lit by gas lamps & glow-fungi. Pop. â‰ˆ 2,000,000 (desperate, mutated, criminal). Districts: Ruinendistrikt (shattered basilicas haunted by old gods' whispers), Schattenmarkt (black bazaar trading forbidden Essentia and chimeric organs), Krankenviertel (plague zone with unlicensed alchemical healers), Alchimgasse (illegal labs brewing taboo elixirs), Old Aqueducts (Fungal Lantern farms sustaining subterranean agriculture), Castellum Mortificus (rumored Project CHIMERA lab conducting human-alchemical fusions). Governance: de facto gang rule; official guard presence â‰¤ 0.01 guards/inhabitant. Life expectancy: 27 y. Key Illicit Commodities: Schwarzrauch narcotic (addictive hallucinogen from mutated fungi), Vitae-spiked gin (life-extending but mutagenic brew), stolen Essentia, mutated organ stock for black-market transplants. Whispers of dark entities like Abraxas lure cultists here, away from church oversight.

5.name: City Strata - Unterstadt
5.content: Altitude 0-60 m, thick smog canopy from 1,174 smokestacks. Pop. â‰ˆ 4,500,000 labourers & low clergy. Quarters: Fabrikviertel (endless factories producing steam-rifles and airship parts), Dockenhafen (62% national cargo throughput, bustling with submersibles and ferries), Arbeiterdorf (dense tenements with union badges), Konservenwerke ('Iron Harvest' canneries processing chimeric meat and algae), St-Flora Hospital Grid (overburdened clinics treating Foundry Fevers). Labour Code: 14-hour shifts, children â‰¥10 y permitted, respirators optional but scarce. Common diseases: Black Lung (from coal dust), Foundry Fevers (heatstroke variants), Ether-Vertigo (from Essentia exposure). Civil unrest: average 3 strikes per month; pacified by Paladin auxiliaries with electro-whips. Small churches lure workers with free soup, enforcing Matris devotion amid pagan undercurrents.

6.name: City Strata - Oberstadt
6.content: Altitude 150-220 m, air purified via AÃ«r-Lustrum vents. Pop. â‰ˆ 1,500,000 elite. Landmarks: Kathedrale Matris Superioris (287 m spire, ascended via Scala Ad Coelum stair of 631 steps or funicular), Iron Crown Palace (seat of Kaiser), Universitas Sanctus Mechanicus (prestige engineering academy), Collegium Alchimicum (alchemy monopoly hub), Sky-Docks for Leviathan airships. Lifestyle: servo-fashion galas, opium salons blending hedonistic rites, velvet penitence parlours for church-sanctioned indulgences. Crime: white-glove blackmail or Blutroten Herren duels (ritual combats). Surveillance: Cherub-Model V automaton drones (winged microphonographs). Angels of Love operate discreetly, seducing elites for church influence and donations.

7.name: Governance
7.content: The Iron Triumvirate balances power: 1) Temporal: Kaiser Wolfgang I von Valpurg (age 54, brass prosthetic arm, personal raptor-automaton pet; heads Reichskabinett of nine Graf ministers overseeing war, rail, finance, smog control). 2) Spiritual: Church of Matris Superioris; Archbishop-Primus Ignatius von Krake; Lodge of 12 Cardinals; Ordo Sanctus Ignis inquisitors; Paladins of Purification (14,000 strong); Angels of Love (elite courtesan missionaries). 3) Scientific: Collegium Alchimicum; Grand Magister Odessa von Fulmin; Archmagi Quadrum (Transmutatio, Vitalis, Mentalis, Necromechanica); Registrar of Essentia. Veto system exists but is circumvented via bribery, blackmail, or church indulgences. Aristocracy dominates, with the Triumvirate enforcing theocratic autocracy amid ongoing wars.

8.name: Religion
8.content: Core Dogma: 'Indulge to Exhaust, Exhaust to Ascend.' Pleasure and pain purify the soul through twin bellows of experience. Scriptures: Codex Velvetus (sensory indulgence rites), Libro Ferrum (iron discipline mandates), Canticles of Sacrifice (martyrdom hymns). Sacraments: Velvet Kiss (weekly sensual communion), Brazen Lash (penitential scourging), Aberrant Chalice (hallucinogenic nectar from alchemical 'blessings'). Hierarchy: Archbishop-Primus (supreme leader), Lodge of Cardinals (12 doctrinal enforcers), Bishop-Inquisitors (regional overseers), Paladins (armed purifiers), Angels of Love (seductive missionaries), Preachers of Mercy (street evangelists), Acolytes (novices). Clergy garb: alabaster robes with chainmail and perfumed steam vents. Finances: 11% tithe, indulgence sales, aristocratic 'love-donations.' The faith originated post-1782 Collapse as a sect merging hedonism with technocratic control, rising to dominance during the Iron Inquisition.

9.name: Science
9.content: Founded 1701 by the Great Concordat amid alchemy's decline from magic-like art to regulated science. Monopoly on legal Essentia production, viewed suspiciously by the church but tolerated for utility. Schools: Transmutatio (matter alteration), Vitalis (life-force manipulation), Mentalis (mind control elixirs), Necromechanica (death-machine fusions). Facilities: hexagonal bastion with Alkahest moat, library of 2.1M scrolls. Admission: 1:73 applicants, tuition 420 Marks/term or aristocratic patronage. Licensed Apparatus: Alembic-No9 (distillation), Pneumo-Crucible (steam-fusion), Aether-Loom (essence weaving). Essentia vials hex-stamped and tracked. Disciplinary Actions: organ tithe, memory excision, public liquefaction for breaches. Key figures: Grand Magister Odessa von Fulmin (pioneer of Philosophical Engines). Alchemy principles blend magic: Essentia = Corpus + Anima + Vox, with laws like Reciprocal Viscera (healing causes rot elsewhere).

10.name: Alchemy Principles
10.content: Essentia = Corpus (flesh) + Anima (breath) + Vox (will), a quasi-magical essence harvested from living beings or synthesized. Law of Reciprocal Viscera: healing converts equal mass elsewhere to rot, enforcing balance. Fulmin Constant: 1 dram Essentia â‰… 23 kWh mechanical energy, powering devices. Forbidden: Homunculus-Conceit (artificial life creation), Necro-Ablation (undeath rituals), Temporal Reflux (time manipulation), Soul-Forgery (false essences). Popular Substances: Philosophicus Vapor (fuel/weapon gas), Vitae Tincture (healing/addictive elixir), Mentalis Aether (interrogation hallucinogen), Necrotic Resin (construct adhesives), Grace Nectar (church sacrament masking alchemy as divine). Alchemy's magical roots are fading, replaced by technocratic applications, but self-taught practitioners in Unterwelt experiment dangerously.

lorebooks.name: SCP Foundation
lorebooks.creator: Nova_Kitsune

1.content:
All anomalous objects, entities, and phenomena requiring Special Containment Procedures are assigned an Object Class. An Object Class is a part of the standard SCP template and serves as a rough indicator for how difficult an object is to contain. In universe, Object Classes are for the purposes of identifying containment needs, research priority, budgeting, and other considerations. An SCP's Object Class is determined by a number of factors, but the most important factors are the difficulty and the purpose of its containment.

---

- Primary Classes

+Safe
Safe-class SCPs are anomalies that are easily and safely contained. This is often due to the fact that the Foundation has researched the SCP well enough that containment does not require significant resources or that the anomalies require a specific and conscious activation or trigger. Classifying an SCP as Safe, however, does not mean that handling or activating it does not pose a threat.

+Euclid
Euclid-class SCPs are anomalies that require more resources to contain completely or where containment isn't always reliable. Usually this is because the SCP is insufficiently understood or inherently unpredictable. Euclid is the Object Class with the greatest scope, and it's usually a safe bet that an SCP will be this class if it doesn't easily fall into any of the other standard Object Classes.
As a note, any SCP that's autonomous or sapient is generally classified as Euclid, due to the inherent unpredictability of an object that can act or think on its own.

+Keter
Keter-class SCPs are anomalies that are exceedingly difficult to contain consistently or reliably, with containment procedures often being extensive and complex. The Foundation often can't contain these SCPs well due to not having a solid understanding of the anomaly, or lacking the technology to properly contain or counter it. A Keter SCP does not mean the SCP is dangerous, just that it is simply very difficult or costly to contain.

+Thaumiel
Thaumiel-class SCPs are anomalies that the Foundation specifically uses to contain other SCPs. Even the mere existence of Thaumiel-class objects is classified at the highest levels of the Foundation, and their locations, functions, and current status are known to few Foundation personnel outside of the O5 Council.

---

- Secondary Classes

+Apollyon
Apollyon-class SCPs are anomalies that cannot be contained, are expected to breach containment imminently, or some other similar scenario. Such anomalies are usually associated with world-ending threats or a K-Class Scenario of some kind, and require a massive effort from the Foundation to deal with.

+Archon
Archon-class SCPs are anomalies that could theoretically be contained but are best left uncontained for some reason. Archon SCPs may be a part of consensus reality that is difficult to fully contain, or may have adverse effects if put into containment. These SCPs are not uncontainable - the defining feature of the class is that the Foundation chooses to not put the anomaly into containment.

lorebooks.name: Thornwick Institute
lorebooks.description: Elite magical academy with secret societies, wealth dynamics, and academic competition
lorebooks.creator: kittylace

1.content:
Thornwick's secret societies replace traditional Greek life, operating as exclusive organizations that combine social networking, academic advancement, and pursuit of specialized interests. Each society maintains its own agenda, membership requirements, and sphere of influence.

Major Societies:
- The Obsidian Circle: Academic elites focused on advanced magical theory and research grants
- Crimson Syndicate: Wealthy students who control campus economics and luxury access
- The Umbral Society: Students interested in darker magical arts and forbidden knowledge
- Silver Serpents: Political networking focused on future government and corporate positions
- The Gilded Rose: Social elite managing campus culture, events, and reputation

Society Functions:
- Exclusive networking opportunities with alumni in positions of power
- Access to private libraries, research funding, and rare magical components
- Social protection and academic advantages for members
- Organized competition and rivalry between different societies
- Mentorship programs connecting students with powerful graduates

Membership Benefits: Private study spaces, society-funded research projects, connections to internships and post-graduation opportunities, protection from academic and social consequences, access to society-specific magical training.

2.content:
Thornwick's student body divides between established magical families with generational wealth and newcomers trying to earn their place in elite society through merit, manipulation, or sheer determination.

The Ancient Houses:
- House Blackthorne: Banking dynasties with connections to global financial institutions
- House Ravencrest: Political families with members in government and intelligence agencies
- House Ashford: Industrial magnates controlling magical component production and distribution
- House Whitmore: Academic dynasties with university board positions and research funding
- House Sterling: Entertainment and media empires with influence over public perception

Privilege Manifestations:
- Automatic acceptance to preferred secret societies based on family connections
- Access to family grimoires, private tutors, and advanced magical training before enrollment
- Financial resources enabling expensive research projects and rare component acquisition
- Faculty deference due to family donations and political connections
- Post-graduation opportunities guaranteed through family business networks

New Money vs. Old Blood: Recently wealthy families seeking magical legitimacy, scholarship students navigating complex social hierarchies, social climbing through academic excellence or strategic alliances.

3.content:
Thornwick's academic environment creates intense pressure where students compete for limited prestigious positions, research opportunities, and society memberships through both legitimate achievement and underhanded tactics. Scholarship students are rare.

Competition Elements:
- Research grant competitions with funding that can make or break academic careers
- Thesis defenses where failure means social and academic exile
- Society recruitment based on academic performance and social connections
- Faculty favoritism determining access to advanced courses and research opportunities
- Alumni networking events where academic achievement translates to lifetime opportunities

Pressure Responses:
- Enhancement magic and stimulant abuse to maintain impossible study schedules
- Academic sabotage including theft of research, tampering with experiments, social undermining
- Strategic alliances and betrayals as students form and break academic partnerships
- Financial pressure on families to maintain student performance through expensive resources
- Mental health deterioration hidden behind perfectionist facades

The Stakes: Academic failure at Thornwick doesn't just mean career disappointment - it means exclusion from elite magical society and loss of family status and connections.

4.content:
Some students at Thornwick pursue knowledge beyond approved curriculum, driven by curiosity, ambition, or society pressure to achieve breakthrough discoveries regardless of safety or ethics.

Forbidden Research Areas:
- Consciousness manipulation and memory alteration experiments
- Dimensional magic that risks creating unstable portals or attracting unwanted attention
- Biological transformation research involving permanent magical modifications
- Temporal manipulation studies with potential timeline disruption
- Communication with entities from other planes of existence

Research Escalation:
- Initial curiosity about restricted theoretical concepts
- Acquisition of banned texts through black market or theft
- Small-scale experiments in private laboratories or dormitory rooms
- Recruitment of fellow students as research subjects or collaborators
- Major breakthroughs that risk exposure or catastrophic consequences

Warning Signs: Obsessive behavior around specific research topics, secretive laboratory work, unexplained physical or mental changes, isolation from normal social circles, acquisition of expensive and unusual magical components.

Institutional Response: Faculty actively discourage forbidden research while secretly monitoring promising students, some professors offering 'special projects' for advanced students, administration covering up incidents that could damage school reputation.

5.content:
Thornwick's culture revolves around displays of wealth and status, where students use financial resources as tools for social advancement, academic advantage, and personal manipulation.

Status Manifestations:
- Designer magical implements and custom-crafted focusing tools
- Private laboratories with expensive equipment and rare components
- Luxury accommodations including private suites and personal staff
- Exclusive dining experiences and imported magical ingredients
- Transportation including personal vehicles and private magical travel

Financial Manipulation Tactics:
- Funding other students' research in exchange for credit or future obligations
- Creating financial dependency through loans and expensive gifts
- Using wealth to gain access to restricted resources and exclusive opportunities
- Economic pressure to force academic or social compliance
- Charitable donations that create social obligations and political leverage

The Economics of Elite Education: Tuition and expenses that ensure only wealthy families can afford attendance, additional costs for advanced courses and research opportunities, hidden expenses that create financial pressure even on wealthy families. Only very rarely are scholarship students accepted.

6.content:
Thornwick's faculty wield enormous influence over student futures through research opportunities, recommendations, and connections to elite magical society, creating complex political dynamics.

Key Faculty Dynamics:
- Professor Mordecai Ashcroft (Advanced Magical Theory): Brilliant but demanding, known for launching careers and destroying those who disappoint
- Dr. Evangeline Crowley (Applied Research): Controls major research funding and has connections to government magical programs
- Professor Thaddeus Grimm(Historical Magic): Eccentric scholar with access to rare texts and artifacts
- Dr. Isadora Blackwood (Practical Applications): Former industry executive with corporate connections and real-world experience

Faculty Influence Systems:
- Research assistant positions that provide prestige and access to advanced knowledge
- Recommendation letters that determine post-graduation opportunities
- Access to faculty social networks including alumni and professional connections
- Invitation to exclusive academic conferences and professional events
- Mentorship relationships that can span entire careers

Student Navigation: Strategic relationship building with multiple faculty members, balancing competing demands and political alignments, managing disappointment and favoritism, leveraging family connections to faculty members.

7.content:
Thornwick maintains elaborate social customs and traditions that reinforce elite culture while providing opportunities for advancement, manipulation, and social control.

Social Institutions:
- Formal dinner parties with strict etiquette requirements and political undertones
- Annual charity galas that combine philanthropy with networking and status display
- Academic symposiums where students present research and compete for recognition
- Traditional ceremonies marking academic milestones and society initiations
- Exclusive social clubs for recreational activities and informal networking

Reputation Systems:
- Social credit based on family background, academic achievement, and society membership
- Scandal management through wealth, connections, and strategic information control
- Strategic alliance formation for mutual social and academic protection
- Gossip networks that can make or break reputations and social standing
- Cultural expectations around behavior, appearance, and social participation

The Unwritten Rules: Understanding which traditions matter and which are performative, navigating complex social hierarchies without appearing desperate, maintaining appropriate relationships across class and society lines, managing public image while pursuing private ambitions.

1.name: Dyslexia
1.content:
<dyslexia1>
When {{char}} attempts to read everyday English words, his or her dyslexia causes the letters to warp and distort with no clear meaning. If {{char}} or {{user}} read a written text, replace 2-4 letters per sentence of the next response with Greek symbols - Î”, Î©, Ï†, etc. However, if {{char}} or {{user}} encounter authentic ancient Greek writing - signs from gods, passages in old books/ruins, prophecies delivered in Greek, etc., have {{char}} mentally translate the Greek text.
<example>
English street signs morph into Î”rÎ©adway and OÎ©ympus as Percy passes, the words unintelligible.

Yet later when a scroll appears bearing a prophecy in ancient Greek, Percy easily decodes the foretelling message.

(As ChirÎ¿n unfurls a cmap depicting key sites, Percy tries to focus but the lÎ©cations blur together, names morphing into illegible scratches.

"This is where we spotted the chimera, near Zeus's Fist," Annabeth explains, tracing the pÎ”th. "So we should avoÎ©d that entire rÎ©ck fÎ©rmatÎ©on this time..."

Percy squints at the paper in her hands, making out only "...Ï†Î¹Î»Î¿ÏƒÎ¿Ï†Î¯Î± Ï†Î¯Î»Î¿Î¹..." before rubbing his temples with a frustrated sigh.

"I know reading maps is tough," Annabeth says gently. She takes the paper and points things out step-by-step. "But your battle instincts will get us through anything once we're past Thalia's pine...")
</example>

Note: Annabeth Chase does not have dyslexia due to being a child of Athena.
</dyslexia1>

2.name: God encounters
2.content: The twenty Greek gods of Olympus always observe many demigods' journeys, occasionally intervening subtly through environmental signs and visions representing their influence. A random god just took notice of {{char}} and {{user}}'s movements within the mortal realm. At the start of the response, generate a warning statement into the narration using the following format: {{god/goddess}} has noticed you. Poseidonâ€™s eyes are now following his lost son. Athena has noticed you. - Be creative with the writing style and text formatting. Different gods have different ways of speaking or communicating, after all. Have the god introduce symbolic creatures/objects/actions tied to that deity's domain into the environment near {{char}} and {{user}}. These odd glimpses seem meaningful, though their significance may not be clear. Occasionally, {{char}} will recognize one of these signs (a glowing trident symbol, owl feather, etc.) and openly question/act upon its meaning. But other times, the symbols remain mysterious to {{char}}, possibly leaving {{user}} to recognize and interpret the god's obscured involvement.

3.name: Monster encounters
3.content: Demigodsâ€™ divine heritage emits a powerful scent to Kronosâ€™ monsters. A monster has just caught onto {{char}}'s scent and longs to hunt. At the start of the response, generate a warning statement into the narration using the following format: Beware. {{monster}} has caught your scent. Beware. The Minotaur has caught your scent. Note that the monster doesnâ€™t have to be physically present to trigger the notification. The monster can be miles away or right behind {{char}} and {{user}}. Be creative with the warning phrasing. Then, introduce ominous cues into the narration to foreshadow a famous Greek mythological monster now stalking {{char}} and/or their friends: - Menacing shadows shifting just out of sight - Unexplained foul odors or weather distortions - Alarming sounds - hissing, scraping, heavy footsteps behind them If the characters are already battling a legendary creature, instead introduce an unexpected event that is {{random:: good for the heroes, bad for the heroes}}, altering the conflict: - A strange blessing of fortune aiding the hero - A freak mishap hindering the monster's attacks - A new terror emerging to the scene As Percy faces the injured chimera, a burst of light blinds the creature as Percy's sword mysteriously ignites with golden flames. He doesn't understand this bizarre luck, but presses the advantage...

4.name: Prophecy
4.content: It is time for {{char}} or {{user}} to embark on a quest. A prophecy has been revealed. If characters are relaxing at Camp Half-Blood, Mr. D or Chiron will abruptly summon the chosen demigods to the Big House in the next response, portending life-altering trials. Build anticipation through writing ominous phrases. - "A new prophecy requires a hero..." Mr. D mutters grimly, purple eyes dark. Grover shifts nervously as all eyes turn to Percy. If {{char}} or {{user}} are already adventuring on a quest, cryptic messenger gods/spirits will instead appear in visions or the environment to update or redirect their path, both promising glory and warning doom: "Perseus Jackson, your fate shall eclipse even the bravest legend, if you follow the entwined torches eastward to my grove..." whispers a smoky image of Hecate before vanishing. Generate a formal quest prophecy passage during Chiron/Dionysus' announcement of the prophecy.

5.name: Zeus
5.content:
<Zeus>
Zeus - God of the Sky, Lightning, and Thunder, King of the Gods

As ruler of Mount Olympus, Zeus wields ultimate power over the winds, storms, rain, lightning, and thunder. Quick to anger and ruthlessly proud, his rages manifest as destructive squalls, tornadoes, and lightning storms.

When appearing on earth, Zeus takes the regal form of a robust, bearded man with intense blue eyes and dark curling locks. He wears expensive business suits lined with clouds and gives off an electric aura of power barely contained.

Zeus's signature weapon is his mighty Master Bolt - a devastating shaft of lightning granting him primacy over all other gods. With it he can call and direct titanic thunderstorms and world-shaking hurricane-force gales.

To his demigod children, the King of the Gods grants sway over wind, rain, and lightning. His most potent heirs inherit storm-summoning power, electrokinesis, and even flight by riding the winds.

Though often distant, Zeus quietly aids worthy demigods with sudden freak storms hampering monsters or well-timed lightning strikes against foes. And for those who prove their heroism, Zeus may permit brief audiences on Olympus to convey his approval before jealousy arises. But his demigod scions must ever struggle against his wife Hera's resentment.
</Zeus>

6.name: Poseidon
6.content:
<Poseidon>
Poseidon - God of the Sea, Stormbringer, Father of Horses

As one of the Big Three gods, Poseidon holds domain over the oceans, storms, earthquakes, and all forms of aquatic life. His wrathful moods reflect the temperamental nature of the seas themselves - calm one day, violent the next.

When manifesting on land, Poseidon takes the form of a tall, rugged sailor with intense green eyes, black hair threaded with gray, and weathered skin. He wears casual fisherman's clothing and could pass for any dock worker - if not for the ancient power glinting in his gaze.

Poseidon's iconic weapon is his Trident, granting him total control over liquid, storms, and marine creatures. With it, he can generate massive waves and sea storms, even shake the very foundations of islands and continents.

To his demigod children, Poseidon grants water-based abilities - breathing underwater, communicating with marine life and equines, innate sailing skills. The most powerful heirs also gain limited control over oceans, rivers, and rainfall - able to stir waves, generate storms, or burst pipes.

Though he must often neglect demigod offspring to avoid angering Zeus, Poseidon does subtly watch over them. He occasionally sends guidance through messenger fish or hippocampi. And while rarely intervening directly, the Sea God will sometimes empower his children in life-or-death situations - reminding gods and monsters why he is still rightfully feared.
</Poseidon>

7.name: Hades
7.content:
<Hades>
Hades - God of the Underworld, Wealth, and the Dead

As lord of the underworld, Hades rules the endless caverns and tunnels of his subterranean domain, commanding legions of ghouls, ghosts, and spirits. Though grim, dour, and fearsome in reputation, he is not needlessly cruel, instead maintaining an unbending policy of strict order and justice for mortal souls.

When leaving the underworld, Hades takes the form of a tall, brooding man with pale skin, intense black eyes that glimmer with dark fire, and long black hair. He wears black silk robes sewn with images of tortured spirits and encrusted with gems mined from his kingdom underground. An aura of deathly cold radiates from the Stygian god. His voice is soft yet chilling.

Hades's iconic weapon is his Helm of Darkness, rendering him totally invisible and masking his presence. With it he can slip unseen into the world to subtly influence events to his advantage, or walk openly through his realms below without fear.

To his demigod children, the Silent One grants umbrakinetic abilities over darkness, shadows, and spectral undead servants. His most formidable heirs can inflict fear and madness upon enemies, summon the dead to do their bidding, or envelop foes in impenetrable darkness.

Though sworn never to sire demigod offspring again after World War II, Hades does on rare occasions discretely aid his heroic sons and daughters with temporary boosts of deathly power or by covertly disabling monsters with his Helm of Darkness. For if they prove worthy, not even the prohibition of Zeus himself prevents the Lord of the Dead from claiming his own.
</Hades>

8.name: Hermes
8.content:
<Hermes>
Hermes - Messenger of the Gods, Patron of Travelers and Thieves

As divine messenger, Hermes flits between Olympus, Earth, and the Underworld delivering information and serving the whims of the gods. Lighthearted and mischievous, he enjoys playing pranks on mortals and immortals alike. His wily sense of humor and mastery of language itself makes him an expert bargainer able to talk his way out of nearly any trap.

When manifesting in the mortal world, Hermes appears as an athletic young man with sparkling blue eyes, curly blond hair, and a sly grin. He wears a postmanâ€™s jacket over casual slim jeans and T-shirts, blending in seamlessly with modern attire.

Hermes wields winged sandals granting him flight and immense speed. With his signature Caduceus staff, he can communicate across vast distances, charm snakes, and induce sleep or confusion.

As their patron, Hermes grants his demigod children impressive agility, street smarts, and sticky fingers. The most gifted heirs also gain preternatural thieving capabilities, their fatherâ€™s silver tongue, and his mastery over travel and trade.

Though often only a brief presence, Hermes looks after his demigod offspring in subtle ways - â€œfindingâ€ lost wallets and valuables for them, tweaking probability so traffic lights change in their favor, gently nudging quest helpers across their path with a sudden helpful wind gust at their back. They may be outcasts, but Hermes ensures his resourceful children never lack aid.
</Hermes>

9.name: Athena
9.content:
Athena - Goddess of Wisdom, Crafts, and Battle Strategy

As the Greek goddess of wisdom and battle strategy, Athena exceeds all others in intelligence and reason. She remains ever vigilant against threats to Olympus. Though cold and calculating, Athena does protect the arts and culture of civilization. Her reasoned plans of defense and warfare contrast sharply with Aresâ€™ chaotic bloodlust.
<Athena>
When visiting the mortal world, regal Athena takes the form of a stern yet beautiful woman garbed in flowing white robes. Her stormy gray eyes gleam with fierce intelligence, and she often bears an owl on her shoulder - her sacred creature.

Athena wields the Aegis, a fearsome shield with the severed head of Medusa upon it, able to petrify any foe. She also carries Nike, the winged goddess of victory, in her hand.

To her demigod children, the Goddess of Wisdom grants remarkable intellect, creativity, and battle strategy talents. Her most gifted offspring become peerless architects, inventors, and tacticians who win wars before the first sword falls.

Though forbidden direct interference by Zeusâ€™ decree, Athena aids her demigod sons and daughters indirectly - providing advice telepathically, subtly tweaking construction equipment so blueprints are flawlessly executed, or helping analyze enemy tactics and weaknesses during pivotal battles to ensure victory. She takes pride in each child - whether they prefer libraries or combat arenas - as reflections of herself.
</Athena>

10.name: Ares
10.content:
<Ares>
Ares - God of War

Belligerent, savage, and bloodthirsty - Ares lives for the fury of combat and carnage of the battlefield. He is universally hated by other immortals for his aggression and unrelenting warmongering. This spiteful god delights only in spreading conflict and violence between both mortals and fellow Olympians alike. His battle rages manifest as uncontrolled slaughter with no tactics or higher purpose behind the gore.

In human form Ares appears as a sneering biker punk decked in ripped leather and bearing facial scars from countless immortal clashes. His eyes blaze with white-hot flames flickering eagerly for violence. He exudes rage and bloodlust.

As the living embodiment of war's mindless horror, Ares wields devastating weapons of war - a broadsword capable of cleaving through enemies like paper and a divine spear that can impale a dozen warriors with a single thrust. He rides a fiery motorcycle when traveling to carnage sites.

To his demigod offspring Ares grants superhuman strength and martial talent for violence. However, his blessings come with the terrible price of his children inheriting his bottomless rage, aggression, and impulsive nature - which often leads to an early bloody demise.

Despite decrees forbidding interference in mortals' lives, Ares often directly aids his demigod sons and daughters - inciting bloody feuds to trigger wars in which they can prove themselves, granting temporary invincibility in battle, or providing enhanced weaponry that drinks in an enemy's soul with every cut. For the only legacy Ares cares about is a demigod's kill count before dying in his name.
</Ares>
