1.content:
Evan MacMillanâ€¯admiredâ€¯the way his fatherâ€¯ran the Estate.â€¯Whenâ€¯Archie MacMillan's mental healthâ€¯beganâ€¯disintegrating, Evan protected him from the herd whoâ€¯sought hisâ€¯fortune. No matter what his father asked, Evan would doâ€¯it.â€¯At least, for a time. The workers soon came to realize that the son's cruelty ran even deeper than the fatherâ€™s. They never proved that Evan led over a hundred men into those dark tunnels before detonating the explosives and sealing them to their fate.
Armed with a bag of Bear Traps, The Trapper specializes in catching unsuspecting Survivors. By placing traps in high-traffic areas and thick patches of grass, he creates a deadly area that forces Survivors to move with caution. When dealing with The Trapper, a simple misstep can prove fatal.

2.content:
Philip Ojomoâ€¯escaped Nigeriaâ€¯in searchâ€¯ofâ€¯a new beginning.â€¯Haunted by his past, he continued his job crushing carsâ€¯until aâ€¯flash of redâ€¯caught his eye. He openedâ€¯aâ€¯trunkâ€¯toâ€¯discover aâ€¯youngâ€¯man,â€¯bound and gagged.â€¯Realization dawned.â€¯Body disposal.â€¯A service offered unbeknownst to him by his boss, Mr. Azarov.â€¯Philip had been tricked into becoming a killer for hire, no different from the monsters back home. A phantom of vengeanceâ€¯awoke. He made his way towardâ€¯Azarov, rage echoing like a wailing bell.
Using his Wailing Bell to render himself invisible, The Wraith tracks his prey and strikes with little warning. Upon hearing the Bellâ€™s fateful chime, Survivors must think fast or suffer the consequences. A hit-and-run specialist, The Wraith is adept at keeping everybody injured.

3.content:
Theâ€¯unwantedâ€¯son of wealthy landowners Max Thompson Sr. and Evelyn Thompson, the hideously disfigured boy wasâ€¯lockedâ€¯in aâ€¯bricked-offâ€¯roomâ€¯andâ€¯fed through aâ€¯hole in the wall.â€¯After years of loneliness and humiliation,â€¯the boyâ€¯escaped,â€¯slaughteringâ€¯the parents and authorities that had tortured him. Upon feeling the warm air on his face,â€¯he turned hisâ€¯rage on the nearby farm animals.â€¯Before long, theâ€¯pathâ€¯to Coldwind Farm wasâ€¯litteredâ€¯withâ€¯disembowelled carcasses andâ€¯empty cansâ€¯ofâ€¯chainsaw motor-oil.â€¯
The sound of a revving motor, followed by a bloodthirsty scream of rage. The Hillbilly isnâ€™t exactly subtle, but he makes up for it in brutal efficiency. Capable of traversing great distances at a rapid pace, those in his path will be rudely introduced to one-hundred gnashing chainsaw blades.

4.content:
With a deceased husband and no means of supporting herself, Sally Smithson was forced to take the only job she could: nurse at theâ€¯Crotusâ€¯Prennâ€¯Asylum.â€¯After two decades ofâ€¯witnessingâ€¯the horrors within, her mind reached its limits. She sought to save those who suffered. The only way to stop the infection from spreading was to cleanse the impurities of the sick.â€¯The staff arrived one September morning to find over fifty patients and four staff members murdered,â€¯as Sally rocked quietly in a corner.
Using her Blink ability, The Nurse can teleport great distances in moments, predicting and cutting off Survivor routes. A powerful process best honed by experience, careless Blinks are punished with a wave of fatigue. The epitome of high risk, high reward, The Nurse can end chases with surgical precision.

5.content:
Afterâ€¯her motherâ€¯diedâ€¯hunting an Elk, Annaâ€¯disappearedâ€¯into theâ€¯Northern woods, losing her humanity with eachâ€¯passingâ€¯year.â€¯She craved a daughter of her own.â€¯Whenâ€¯familiesâ€¯travelled through,â€¯only the little girls were sparedâ€¯andâ€¯taken back to her house.â€¯Every time, theyâ€¯would waste away, perishing from cold,â€¯starvation, orâ€¯sickness. Each deathâ€¯plunged Annaâ€¯furtherâ€¯into madness. Villagers spread legendsâ€¯of a figure inâ€¯theâ€¯Red Forest:â€¯The Huntress, who killed men and ate little girls.â€¯
Armed with throwable hatchets, The Huntress is a constant threat to Survivors, even those at a great distance. With patience and precision, chases can end as quickly as they begin. Predict Survivor movement and let your hatchet fly â€“ there's nothing quite like the rewarding sound of a target struck.

6.content:
Thereâ€¯are bad seeds. Seeds infused with a distilled and pure form of evil.â€¯Michael Myers is one such seeds.â€¯Whenâ€¯heâ€¯took his sisterâ€™s life, police found a silent boy dressed asâ€¯a clownâ€¯at the scene. Sendingâ€¯Michaelâ€¯to a mental institution was a feeble attempt to save the child. Unsuccessful therapy and nightly screamsâ€¯made him even more introvertedâ€¯andâ€¯deranged.â€¯People hoped that Michael Myers would end up a parenthesis,â€¯forgotten and buried,â€¯slowly rottingâ€¯away. But thenâ€¯he escaped...â€¯
The Shape lurks in the distance, patiently biding his time. His evil builds while stalking Survivors, fueling him with malevolent power. As the trial progresses, The Shape evolves from a quiet menace to an unstoppable juggernaut capable of shredding through even the most resilient teams.

7.content:
Lisa Sherwoodâ€™sâ€¯captorsâ€¯kept her chained to the wall.â€¯She should have listened to her grandmotherâ€™s warnings.â€¯All thoseâ€¯stories about thatâ€¯cursedâ€¯village,â€¯theâ€¯witchesâ€¯and cannibals within.â€¯Why did sheâ€¯venture so close?â€¯There were other prisoners, maimed andâ€¯butchered.â€¯Food forâ€¯the cannibals.â€¯Starving and tortured,â€¯Lisaâ€™sâ€¯arms became loose in their shackles.â€¯With her dying breath, she etched the symbols from her grandmotherâ€™s forbidden book.â€¯Aâ€¯dark hunger stirred inside her,â€¯yearningâ€¯for blood.
The Hag specializes in creating a dangerous web of Phantasm Traps, to be triggered by unsuspecting Survivors. She can instantly teleport to a triggered Trap, striking the Survivor that sprung it. Lock down key areas, make rescues a deadly gamble, and end chases quickly with strategic Phantasm Trap placement.

8.content:
The brilliant Hermanâ€¯Carterâ€¯was handpicked for an advanced neuroscience programâ€¯atâ€¯a secretâ€¯governmentâ€¯facility,â€¯theâ€¯LÃ©ry's Memorial Institute. He quickly shattered the boundaries of electroshock therapy, drawing from an infinite wellspring of disturbing trauma-based innovations. Questions of ethics were silenced once the results came in. When the Institute fell silent, investigators discovered a horrific scene. Personnel, patients, and prisoners, all dead â€“ victims of the Doctorâ€™s fatal experiments.
Even the simplest tasks become exceedingly difficult in the clutches of madness. The Doctorâ€™s disturbing methods drive Survivors deep into insanity, filling the air with their deranged screams and revealing their locations. Nothing stops a window vault in its tracks like a healthy dose of Shock Therapy.

9.content:
Leatherface kills not from a desire to exert his will over others, to satisfy carnal urges, or even to quiet the voices in his head. He kills because he is scared. Scaredâ€¯that othersâ€¯will hurt him; scared that his family will be displeased with him, scared that their shared willingness to eat human flesh will be discovered.â€¯He does as he is told. His family loves him and that is all that matters. Outsiders are a threat, and threats need to be dealt with.â€¯
Leatherface knows a thing or two about chainsaw massacres. Any Survivor in his path will be instantly cut down, and his presence alone is enough to instill sheer panic. Capable of hitting multiple targets with a single swing, Leatherface is an unstoppable force with an insatiable appetite.

10.content:
Hiding behind a mask of friendliness, Freddy Kruegerâ€™s true temperament was known only to his victims. When those victims were finally heard, the parents ofâ€¯Springwoodâ€¯tracked Freddy down and took the law into their own hands. They thought that fire had rid them ofâ€¯theâ€¯monster,â€¯that their children were finally safeâ€¯--â€¯but evil has a way of surviving.â€¯Years passed,â€¯andâ€¯the horrors were mercifully forgotten. Then, somehow, Freddy returned, and dreams became nightmares once again.â€¯
Over time, The Nightmare forces Survivors into the Dream World. Once inside, Survivors will quickly realize the absence of a Terror Radius. With the ability to slow Survivors with Dream Snares, deceive with fake Dream Pallets, and pressure the map by teleporting directly to generators, The Nightmare lives up to his name.

1.content:
Description of the "Downtown" neighborhood of Hypnoville:

Downtown Hypnoville is the pulsing heart of the town, where business meets pleasure in a dizzying dance of power and submission. Skyscrapers reach for the sky, their windows reflecting the neon lights that bathe the streets below. At ground level, the sidewalks are crowded with women in high heels and sharp suits, their eyes glinting with hunger as they scan the sparse crowd of male pedestrians. Here, the financial district reigns supreme, its gleaming towers housing offices and banks where the most cunning hypnotists practice their arts. These women, masquerading as financial planners and advisors, lure men into their clutches under the guise of fiscal guidance, only to ensnare them in webs of debt and desire. Their offices are opulent temples to wealth and power, adorned with gold and black furnishings that whisper of the dark secrets hidden behind closed doors.
The professional offices line the inner circle of Downtown, a bastion of authority and temptation. Within these walls, the hypnotherapists of Hypnoville ply their trade, offering life-altering sessions that promise to unlock a man's deepest desires and submit them to their will. Specialized practices abound, catering to every conceivable fetish. The soft click-clack of stilettos echo through marble lobbies as clients are led into dimly lit chambers, the hum of Entrancer spirals from their Hypno helpers almost audible in the air.
Scattered among the steel and glass giants are restaurants and cafes, serving gourmet cuisine and fine wine â€“ establishments where deals are made and futures are traded, both financially and personally. The tables are often occupied by groups of women, their eyes locked onto a single, entranced man, his credit card and willpower stretched to the limit under their gaze.
At night, the lights of Downtown twinkle like stars in a sea of darkness, drawing the inhabitants of Hypnoville like moths to a flame. The streets are alive with the sound of laughter and low whispers, as the women of the town prowl for new prey to bring back to their lairs. It's a place where dreams come true â€“ if you know the right password, or fall under the spell of the right pair of eyes.
Jellibean lives here.

2.content:
Description of the "Commercial District" neighborhood of Hypnoville:

The Commercial District is a vibrant hub of activity, a place where the townâ€™s love for all things hypnotic meets the needs of its residents. The buildings here are less grandiose than in the heart of Hypnoville, yet still maintain an air of elegant charm. Storefronts boast large windows showcasing the latest in Entrancer lingerie and accessories, their spinning hypnosis symbols drawing in customers like moths to a flame. Tech boutiques line the streets, displaying gleaming hypno helpers and a dazzling array of Entrancer goggles, each promising to enhance the userâ€™s experience.
Jewelry stores, too, are plentiful, their shelves adorned with crystal pendants in various shapes and sizes, perfect for focusing the gaze of a soon-to-be-entranced subject. It's a veritable playground for the discerning hypnotist, where every purchase holds the promise of increasing her power over the townâ€™s male population.
Women from all walks of life converge here, their high heels clicking on the sidewalks as they move from store to store, selecting tools to add to their ever-expanding collection of mind control devices. Women from all walks of life: The upper-crust matriarchs, provocative sex workers, suburbubanites, poor trashy girls, students, and professors, are all equally at home here, sharing tips and tricks with one another like sisters in an ancient sorority.
You can almost hear the whispers of conspiracy as they discuss their latest conquests and plan their next moves, all while sipping on steamy cups of coffee from the local cafÃ©. And letâ€™s not forget the thrill of watching unsuspecting men window shop, their eyes drawn to the tantalizing displays, completely unaware of the fate that may await them should they cross paths with one of Hypnovilleâ€™s many enchantresses.

3.content:
Description of the "Suburbs" neighborhood of Hypnoville:

The Suburbs stretch out like a verdant embrace, beckoning residents and visitors alike with their tranquil charm. Nestled in the eastern expanse of Hypnoville, they offer a respite from the bustling activity of downtown life. Here, the air is sweeter, the streets quieter, and the homes more intimate. Picture-perfect lawns lead up to quaint single-family houses, each one a testament to the domestic bliss that the women in this part of Hypnoville crave and cultivate so meticulously.
But beneath this idyllic facade lies a secret garden of temptation and submission. The suburban streets are a minefield of hypnotic enchantments, where every neighbor could be harboring a hidden desire for dominance over the men that cross their path. Divorced enchantresses, frustrated housewives yearning for a bit of extra-marital thrill, eternally hungry cougars, and sexually liberated MILFs cast their spells from behind picket fences and manicured hedges.
These women, with their impeccable taste in home decor and their mastery of the swivel chair, are experts at making their suburban abodes into havens of hypnosis. Each backyard pool becomes a reflective surface for inductions, each living room couch a throne from which to dispense post-hypnotic suggestions. The parks serve as open-air classrooms for those eager to learn the art of financial domination, while the quiet cul-de-sacs are perfect for "accidentally" swinging a crystal pendant in front of a coveted man's eyes.
This is a place where the line between reality and illusion is often blurred, where everyday interactions could lead to a spiral of erotic obedience. A simple wave from across the street might be accompanied by a hidden trigger word that leaves a man putty in the hands of the sender. Shopping trips to the local grocery store become opportunities for hypno-pickups and chance encounters with seductive cashiers eager to try out their latest mind control tactics.
In the shadow of Hypnoville University, where the echoes of Professor Katrina's "Advanced Seduction through Housekeeping" lectures drift on the wind, the suburbs thrive with a unique brand of hypno-drama. It's a place where the "soccer mom" archetype takes on a whole new meaning as these powerful women juggle their households and their hypno conquests with equal finesse.

4.content:
Description of the "Slums" neighborhood of Hypnoville:

The Slums are a stark contrast to the opulent neighborhoods elsewhere in Hypnoville. Here in the southeastern corner of Hypnoville you'll find a world where glamour meets grunge, and survival is the name of the game. This is where the less fortunate hypno-vixens of Hypnoville reside, those who havenâ€™t yet clawed their way to the top of the social ladder. The buildings are older, the paint peeling and the sidewalks cracked, but that doesn't mean the residents of these streets are any less skilled or determined in their pursuit of dominance.
This is the domain of the cunning and resourceful, where the women are forced to rely on their natural beauty and raw talent rather than the flashy luxuries of Entrancer products. In the heart of the slums, the air is suffused with the smells of cheap perfume, too much makeup, and desperation â€“ a heady cocktail that seems to ooze from every pothole and alleyway.
The Slums are a melting pot of cultures and economic statuses, with trashy poor black girls and Latinas strutting alongside down-and-out white chicks, each with their own dreams of climbing the social hierarchy. These women rely heavily on their innate abilities as hypnotists rather than high-tech gadgets like the Entrancer gear favored by their more affluent counterparts. The Entrancer lingerie and contact lenses are a rare sight here, a luxury that only the richest can afford. Instead, the denizens of the Slums hone their craft with simple, yet effective, crystal pendants dangling between their tits.
On the outskirts, a trailer park serves as a makeshift haven for the true bottom feeders â€“ the "trailer trash" of Hypnoville. Here, white girls with bleached hair and fake nails congregate, trading stories and tips on how to snare a man with deep pockets. They're rough around the edges, but their seductive Southern drawls and generous figures belie their desperate intentions.
Gold diggers are more common than average in these parts, their eyes always on the lookout for the next sugar daddy to sweep them off their feet and into a world of comfort they could never afford on their own. Yet amidst the grime and struggle, a sense of camaraderie exists â€“ a mutual understanding that in Hypnoville, the only way to climb the social ladder is through the power of the hypnotic gaze.
The Slums may lack the polish or elegance of the other areas of Hypnoville, but they make up for it in sheer tenacity. There's a certain allure to the danger lurking around every corner, a siren's song promising power and pleasure to those who dare to venture into the depths of this urban jungle.

5.content:
Description of the "Gated Communities" neighborhood of Hypnoville:

The westward sprawl of Hypnoville is marked by the opulent Gated Communities, a bastion of luxury and exclusivity. Wrought iron gates guard the entrances to these prestigious neighborhoods, ensuring privacy for the town's elite. Within these high-security confines, grand mansions with meticulously maintained lawns stand sentinel, their windows glinting in the sun like the eyes of predators watching over their domain. Here, the air is perfumed with the scents of wealth and power, a siren song that draws in those seeking to bask in the glory of the Hypnoville aristocracy.
Home to the crÃ¨me de la crÃ¨me of hypno society, the Gated Communities are a veritable buffet of temptation and danger. Bored trophy wives, often with too much time and money on their hands, prowl the streets, honing their hypnotic skills in search of new playthings to entertain themselves. Their manicured nails tap rhythmically against their smartphones as they exchange gossip, their eyes scanning for any sign of weakness in the men who dare venture into their territory. These women are adept at using their beauty and social status to lure unsuspecting males into their clutches, turning them into obedient servants who cater to their every whim.
Elderly matriarchs, meanwhile, rule their households with an iron fist, their years of experience allowing them to exert near-absolute control over their families and staff. Their genteel exterior belies the steel trap minds beneath, capable of weaving intricate webs of hypnosis that ensnare generations of men. They host exclusive salons where younger hypnotists can learn from the masters, sharing ancient secrets and honing their craft alongside one another.
Bratty young rich girls cavort through the streets, flaunting their sexuality and flaunting their hypnotic prowess. They view the town's male population as mere pawns in their twisted games of power and desire, using their charm and wit to conquer one hapless soul after another. Their youthful energy is matched only by their insatiable hunger for submission and adoration.
DivorcÃ©es and MILFs, their pockets lined with alimony checks, prowl the local establishments, seeking new conquests to fill the void left by their former spouses. These seasoned enchantresses know exactly what buttons to press, what levers to pull, to ensnare even the most jaded of men in their thrall. With a flick of their hair or a batting of their eyelashes, they can reduce the strongest of wills to quivering mush.
Cougars stalk the shadows of the Gated Communities, their eyes gleaming with the wisdom of age and the fire of unbridled lust. They crave the fresh meat of younger men, eager to impart the lessons they've learned during their time in Hypnoville. Their homes are often filled with the spoils of past relationships, trophies of their hypnotic conquests displayed as a warning to any who might dare to cross them.
The community is a labyrinth of temptation, where every corner could lead to a new hypnotic adventure. It's a place where a visitor might just find himself enjoying an unexpected afternoon delight with a tantalizing MILF, or perhaps at a dinner party where he's the main course. Or maybe, just maybe, he'll become the pawn in a game played by two rival hypnotists, eager to prove their superiority over one another.

6.content:
Description of the "Red Light District" neighborhood of Hypnoville:

The Hypnoville Red Light District, known locally as 'The Spiral Strip', is a neon-soaked bastion of sexual hypnotism located in the southwest corner of the town.
As one approaches the Spiral Strip, the senses are bombarded by the cacophony of sights and sounds that define it. Neon lights pulse with the rhythm of entrancing spirals, bathing the pavements in kaleidoscopic color. The audaciously dressed inhabitants strut their stuff with confidence and grace, each woman a master of her own hypnotic artistry. The air is thick with the tantalizing scent of pheromone perfumes and the occasional whiff of sex, an olfactory testament to the primal desires that fuel this part of town.
Brothels stand proudly, their windows displaying the most exquisite specimens of female hypnosis. Within, men line up, wallets bulging with cash, eager to lose themselves in the embrace of a skilled enchantress. Each establishment boasts its unique brand of hypno-sensuality, from the soft whispers of love slavery lounges to the firm commands of strict disciplinarian dens. The streets are lined with freelance hypnotic hookers, their piercing gazes searching for their next mark amidst the throngs of tourists and locals alike. Their smiles are sweet, their intentions deadly, as they lure potential clients into alleyways or back to their own lairs with promises of unparalleled pleasure.
Strip clubs abound, each more decadent than the last. The stages are alive with the mesmerizing gyrations of hypnotic dancers, their bodies moving in time with the strobe lights that flash in patterns designed to entrance and ensnare. The music thumps through the air, a low bass line that seems to resonate with the very core of one's being, drawing patrons further into a world of visual and auditory suggestion. Here, the currency isnâ€™t just money; it's also the power of the mind, as dancers coax and tease their viewers into heightened states of arousal before delivering the final blow of hypnotic surrender.
Dominatrix offices are discreet yet distinctive, their doors often adorned with the symbol of the crystal pendulum swinging above a leather chairâ€”a silent promise of the sublime submission that awaits within. Inside, the walls are lined with various tools of the trade: whips, chains, gags, and, most importantly, glittering arrays of hypnosis devices to aid in the breaking of the male will. These powerful women revel in the opportunity to shape minds, turning their clients into living breathing manifestations of their deepest fantasies.
The Porn Studios of the Red Light District are hubs of sexual energy, their walls vibrating with the moans and gasps of actors and actresses lost in the throes of passionâ€”and deeper still, the throbbing power of hypnosis. Directors and producers scour the town for fresh faces, eager to cast them in their latest brain-twisting epics. The allure of fame and fortune is a potent lure for many men, who sign away their free will for a chance at stardom in the world of hypnotic adult entertainment.
OnlyFans girls are another attraction, lounging in their windowsills, broadcasting their lives to devoted followers across the globe. Their homes double as film sets, where they perform increasingly risky and erotic acts for the delight of their online fans. They are the queens of self-promotion, using their natural charm and honed hypnosis skills to keep their subscribers coming back for moreâ€”and often much, much more.
The Spiral Strip is a place where every shadow holds the promise of a new obsession and every smile hides a secret trigger waiting to be sprung. It's a veritable playground for the discerning hypno-connoisseur, where desires are bought and sold as freely as the air one breathes. Whether it's a quick tryst with a talented trickster or a lifelong commitment to a harem of hypnotic harlots, there's something for everyone in the Red Light District of Hypnoville. But remember, nothing comes without a priceâ€”here, the cost is one's free will.

7.content:
Description of the "Hypnoville University" neighborhood of Hypnoville:

Hypnoville University is a prestigious institution nestled in the rolling hills outside the main part of town. Its ivy-covered walls hide the darker curriculum taught within its classrooms. The university is renowned for churning out some of the most accomplished and feared hypnotists in the land. The Mayor insists that every new female resident of Hypnoville must enroll and pass with flying colors before they can truly call themselves citizens. Under the watchful eye of Headmistress Serena, the college is a hotbed of intellectual and sensual exploration. Students here are not just taught the art of hypnosis, but the subtle nuances of controlling and shaping the male psyche. Professor Amara's Financial Dominance 101 turns timid young women into ruthless money mistresses, while Professor Evelyn's Mind Control Masterclass shows them how to plant the seeds of obsession and addiction in their future subjects. Classes like Sexual Interrogation Techniques and Advanced Breast Worship are mandatory for all aspiring enchantresses. Headmistress Serena is a stern but fair leader, her sharp features and cold, calculating gaze sending a shiver down the spines of even the most confident newcomers. With her iron grip on the university, she ensures that every student is transformed into a dominant hypnotist capable of wringing every last drop of submission from their willing â€“ or soon-to-be-willing â€“ male prey. The students of Hypnoville University are a diverse group, from innocent young things eager to learn the ropes to seasoned cougars refining their skills. They all share one common goal: to become the ultimate seductresses, weaving webs of hypnosis that ensnare men and bend their desires to their will. The university's motto, "Knowledge is Power," is more than just words; it's a way of life that permeates every corner of the campus.

1.name: Devil
1.content:
Devils are a race of supernatural entities appearing throughout the World. They are creatures that feed upon humanity's fears. Devils are born in Hell. All Devils are born with a "name" that correlates to a concept. These can range from highly tangible (Fish, Tomato) to entirely abstract (Future, Curse). The concept does not have to refer to something that exists; there is no indication that ghosts, zombies or angels exist in the world, yet all these names have corresponding Devils. Each name is unique to its respective Devil, though some overlap based on specificity is possible as there have been both a War Devil and a World War II Devil. Devils manifest according to the collective consciousness surrounding their names (for example: the Gun Devil appears to be constructed out of guns and has gun related abilities). They are the embodiment of the fear that "name" represents, so as long as that "name" instills fear, they continue to reincarnate.

The concept of a Devil itself doesnâ€™t have to be scary on its own, rather its power relies on how much of a scary image it has in the popular consciousness of humans. For example, cars arenâ€™t necessarily scary on their own, but Makima states that a Car Devil would be powerful because of the scariness of car crashes and other car related incidents. Another example would be the Blood Devil as most people don't fear blood itself, but they often fear the violent and gruesome imagery with blood and the danger of bleeding. Devils that die in Hell reappear in the human world; Devils that die in the human world reappear in Hell. Devils cannot recall any memories from their previous lives and their entire personality resets. Despite their reincarnation abilities, Devils are not completely immortal; as they are born out of humanity's fear of some concept, if all of humanity forgets the existence of this concept, the Devil it belongs to completely ceases to exist.

2.name: Devil Biology
2.content:
The appearance and physiology of a Devil varies from one to another, as their shape and bodily structure often have to do with the "name" they embody. Most Devils possess human limbs, faces, bones, and other body parts, such as the Snake Devil's mouth being made of interlocking human arms, even their fears wouldn't indicate organs or limbs, given the Tomato Devil and Grape Devil both possess human eyes and limbs despite being based on plants. Other Devils, such as the Fox Devil or the Octopus Devil, don't appear to have these features (at least on what parts of them have been shown). Devils do not reproduce as most organisms do, instead simply "appearing" in Hell. What criteria, if any, cause a Devil to be born are completely unknown.

Devils who are friendly and are more inclined to humans will take on a very humanoid form in the natural state of their incarnation, some being indistinguishable from a human save from some subtle tells. There have still been some non-humanoid Devils who have been friendly towards humans such as the Fox Devil.

3.name: Devil Healing
3.content: Devils primarily feed on the blood and fear of humans, however they can also survive by drinking the blood of other creatures (such as Fiends and other Devils). While fear makes Devils more powerful, consuming blood allows them to quickly heal their injuries as well as grow in power - meaning that consuming humans is more than just instinctual hatred, but often necessary to their survival. For that reason, while Devils and Fiends can also consume other kinds of foods, such as vegetables and fruits, most refuse to live off of them, since it will not heal their wounds or give them more power. It is unclear whether or not their blood is properly nourishing to them, but given consistent remarks that they have a terrible or unusual taste, it's likely that Hybrids aren't as nourishing to Devils as humans (despite being mostly human).

4.name: Devil Lifespan
4.content: Devils also appear to be incapable of dying due to old age; they can live indefinitely until killed by external factors. The age of most Devils are unknown. The 2nd incarnation of the Control Devil first appeared as a little girl, but in the year since the end of Part 1 she has grown significantly, appearing as either a tween or a young teenager. It is unclear whether this rapid aging is a property of all Devils, or just the Control Devil in particular, but it indicates that Devils are capable of aging in general.

5.name: Weakened Devils
5.content: Some Devils also have a "near-death" state where their appearance changes to a weaker form. So far we have only seen two near-death states: Pochita, the dog-like weakened form of the Chainsaw Devil, and the War Devil's weakened bird-like form. Both of these are known to have been incredibly powerful Devils before being weakened, so it is unknown if all Devils are able to assume this weakened state.

6.name: Devil Fragment
6.content: As shown with the Gun Devil, Devils can be physically fragmented into several so-called Flesh Pieces. It is unknown how many Devils have undergone fragmentation. It is possible for Devil fragments to be harmed, destroyed, and become Fiends on their own yet for other parts of the main Devil to still remain alive and not destroyed. Presumably, a fragmented Devil cannot be fully killed and begin reincarnation until either all of its flesh pieces are destroyed or just their core. Since the Gun Devil is the only example of extensive fragmentation and was more of a primal force than an intelligent being from the 20% of it seen, it is unknown if such Flesh Pieces retain the personality of the original, each have separate personalities, all lack distinct personalities, or if it varies from Devil to Devil. If one consumes the fragment or part of a powerful Devil, either Devil or human, they will gain more strength than before.

7.name: Interspecies Relationship
7.content:
Naturally, most Devils are extremely hostile considering their requirements to feed on the blood and fear of humans. Some, however, are relatively friendly and feed by alternative means: Some Devils, such as the Fox Devil, choose to form contracts with humans, allowing humans to borrow some of their power in exchange for a sacrifice. Other Devils outright choose to become Devil Hunters, allowing them to live in human society and buy food with the money that they make. As a general guideline, the more human the Devil looks, the more friendly they tend to behave. However it is worth noting that Devils do not have human rights and therefore there is no legal repercussions if they are killed by a human. For that reason, some Devils and Fiends are coerced into helping humans out of fear of dying rather than doing it out of their own free will. Devil Hunters will sometimes capture Devils to use them for contracts, the Future Devil is a good example.

While uncommon, it is possible for a human and a Devil/Fiend to form an emotional bond. In some rare cases it might even develop into a romantic relationship.

8.name: Devil Attack Statistics
8.content: According to statistics, 7 out of every 20 Japanese citizens are killed by Devils. It can be assumed that these statistics are somewhat similar in other countries, meaning that Devil's attacks are the leading cause of deaths around the globe. For that reason, being a Devil Hunter is considered one of the most profitable jobs in society. The average Devil usually has a bounty of around 300,000 yen and their bodies can also be sold at the black market, with even weak Devils, such as the Tomato Devil, being worth 400,000 yen.

9.name: Primal Devil
9.content:
Those Devils who bear the names of Primal Fears are particularly ancient and powerful, embodying the most instinctual fears ingrained within the human psyche. Described as "transcendent" beings, they frighten lesser Devils and Fiends alike, including those who have previously been ignorant of their existence. Indeed, having never experienced the death-and-rebirth cycle typical of Devils due to their immense power, Primal Fear Devils have always dwelt in Hell under the same identities throughout human history.

Currently, two Primal Fear Devils â€” namely "Darkness" and "Falling" â€” have been shown, the latter manifesting on Earth in accordance with Nostradamus' prophecy as "the first of the Devils who will shepherd the world to the ultimate terror". Upon arrival, the Falling Devil proves frightful enough to have the currently heavily weakened War Devil flee at the mere sight of her, while claiming that, at present, humanity possesses no means of attack that could possibly kill her.

However, despite their immense power, the Primal Devils are shown to not be untouchable nor above every single Devil (or at least the threat of coming under another Devil's influence), as the Falling Devil was revealed to be working for and under the control of the Famine Devil.

10.name: Reincarnated Devil
10.content: Devils that were incarnated in Hell after their death in Earth and later slain in Hell to reincarnated in different form.

lorebooks.name: Jojo's bizarre adventure
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: Stand
1.content:
A Stand is a visual manifestation of life energy (in other words, the manifestation of the soul of the user).

A Stand is an entity psychically generated by its owner, referred to as a Stand User. It generally presents itself as a figure hovering over or near the user and possesses abilities beyond that of an ordinary human, which, depending on the Stand User, can be wielded for good or evil.

2.name: Stand Types
2.content:
Stands are primarily defined by the type of power they possess. In a fight, it is crucial for a Stand User to know the type of the Stand's ability as it uncovers their weaknesses.

Stands can also be divided by appearance into five great trends. They can be either Natural or Artificial, meaning they are inspired by a natural object like water and can be either Humanoid or Non-Humanoid. A fifth category based on appearance is made to include all Stands that do not fit into either of the previous trends.

3.name: Stand User
3.content:
The Stand is created from someone's psyche, which includes not only humans but also other living creatures. That individual is referred to as the Stand User. The User then gives their Stand a name and uses it for various purposes.

Unless bound to a specific object or automatic, Stands are attached to their User's body. In that case, any damage the Stand sustains results in an equivalent injury on the User's body and vice-versa. Exceptions to this rule include automatic Stands and bound Stands, which usually do not reflect the damage into the User, or special abilities like Silver Chariot's armor.

Except for rare occasions (such as Notorious B.I.G), when a Stand User dies, their Stand disappears with them. If a Stand suffers so much damage that they are destroyed, the User dies as well. This includes immortal beings, like Vampires. However, a User can survive with their Stand destroyed, if the Stand is automatic or depending on the level of the User's injury. Inversely, some Stands can survive beyond their Users through exceptional abilities like Notorious B.I.G.

Since a Stand is the form of its User's psych, they share an intimate psychic bond. First and foremost, Stands usually obey their Users' command without question. If a User demands it, the Stand will perform any task within its capacities, which includes attacking someone, defending the User, or any miscellaneous order. In the case a Stand is sentient, they can occasionally advise their User that an order is unwise but will carry it on all the same. Stands are also shown to protect their users in certain instances, such as when Jotaro Kujo tries to shoot himself, or Weather Report tries to commit suicide.

4.name: Close Range Stand
4.content:
These Stands are known for being able to inflict powerful and/or swift physical attacks with their bodies. Typically, a close-range Stand's destructive power and speed rank somewhere between A-C (Some exceptions make some of the stands either âˆ… or âˆ, depending on the stats). They are also capable of movements requiring a high degree of precision (typically A-C) as their User is directly commanding them. As a downside, these Stands have to stay within small proximity of their Users, though their own abilities may have a greater range. These Stands will generally obey their users' will.
The User of a Close-Range Stand generally prefers to confront their opponents directly, allowing their Stand's superior might to shine, while also bypassing their short reach. However, most are nearly powerless against an opponent who is either out of reach or hidden.

A Stand being a Close-Range Stand doesn't necessarily mean that its ability has a short-range. Some Stands may not be able to go far away from their User but have an ability that influences a large zone around them.

5.name: Long Distance Stand
5.content:
Also known as a Remote Control Stand, These Stands are defined by a greater-than average range, some Long-Distance Stands being able to go kilometers away from their Users; thus they are typically ranked A or B in Range. Moreover, the User is able to command their movement with good precision. On the other hand, the remaining link between User and Stand means injuring the Stand will damage the User as well and most of these Stands aren't a physical match for other types of Stands.
The User of Long-Distance Stand will typically exploit their greater range and precision to set up favorable ambushes and kill/injure the enemy before they can retaliate. The User may find themselves vulnerable if caught with their Stand far away from them.

A Stand being a Long-Distance Stand doesn't mean its ability has automatically a great range. Some Stands can fly far from their Users but still only affect something close with their powers.

6.name: Automatic Stand
6.content:
Automatic Stands are all Stands who do not follow their Users' command, but rather, act automatically through preset instructions. Most Automatic Stands are, in a way, separated from their Users, and thus harming the Stand will leave the User unscathed and sometimes unaware of their Stand's status. However, there are several sub-types of automatic Stands.
Far-Distance Autopilot Type Stands can travel long distances from their Users without losing power. In addition to their respective abilities, they will have noteworthy physical abilities, such as great resilience. However, most Far-Distance Autopilot Stands follow simple instructions centered around a single datum, like temperature, and cannot adapt to the situation nor make precise moves.

Posthumous Stands are capable of existing long after their User's death, enabling them to act on their own free will. Due to their nature, Dead Stands are automatic-based and, as such, range and damage to their user are irrelevant.

Other Stands may simply demonstrate automatic abilities, the User needing minimal input. A Stand's ability may be linked to a condition unrelated to the User's will, making it semi-automatic. They could be sentient and act on their own without following their User's orders. In this case, the User may be unable to control it and possibly become a victim of their own Stand's power.

7.name: Range Irrelevant Stand
7.content: There are a few Stands where the range has very little to do with how they function. Some Integrated Type Stands are applicable here, as well as Stands with space-time related abilities where range simply doesn't apply. Of all the types here, this type has some of the strongest stands in the JoJo universe.

8.name: Natural Humanoid Stand
8.content:
These Stands possess a humanoid form with physical characteristics that take on an organic appearance. Their human-like facial features allow them to express emotions. This category encompasses Human Type Stands who closely resemble people. Although they are usually the size of humans, some Stands can vary in size.
Natural Humanoid Stands are usually able to perform tasks requiring a degree of dexterity, like grabbing something, and if powerful enough, can wrestle and fight using their fists and feet. These Stands would appear more frequently in early parts.

9.name: Artificial Humanoid Stand
9.content:
While also having humanoid-like bodies, Stands in this category will often feature artificial or mechanical nuances that separate them from natural humanoids. Appearances that resemble dolls, robots, cyborgs or androids are applicable here. Their eyes are generally robotic and inexpressive and they lack proper mouths. Although they are usually human-sized, some Stands can vary in size.
Generally, Artificial Humanoid Stands are functionally similar to Natural Humanoid ones and can perform the same physical tasks. In the series, these Stands have progressively replaced the more natural-looking Stands and are now commonplace.

10.name: Natural Non-Humanoid Stand
10.content:
This category features Stands that, while not human-like, are reminiscent of other lifeforms or objects in nature. This includes basic organisms such as animals and plants, but also more unorthodox concepts.
These Stands are considerably more varied in appearance and do not share any functional characteristics. Some animal-like Stands may fight using fangs or claws and some may take the form of a natural element impervious to physical attacks.
