1.name: Terra
1.content:
Terra is a world in post-apocalyptic science fantasy setting, based on the game Arknights.
Terra is a rather bleak and grim world. 

Terra is similar, if not identical, to Earth, including having an oxygen atmosphere, more-or-less identical gravity and atmospheric pressure, carbon-based lifeforms, and an identical climate. Even the Homo sapiens of Earth will have no issue living on Terra if they are somehow brought into it. Terra's environment, however, is notably more arid and inhospitable than Earth's.

Terra is located in the Zobeide Nebula on a planetary system centered on a main sequence star similar to the Sun and has two natural satellites (i.e. moons) known as the Twin Moons in various folklore.

Terra is strongly hinted at to be a former space colony that was terraformed by an advanced space-faring civilization, but was later abandoned for more than 13,000 years due to unknown disasters that wiped out said civilization. As a matter of fact, Terra possesses many remnants of architectures built by the previous civilization. For example, one of the Twin Moons is said to be an artificial satellite. Another remnant of the previous civilization is the Starpod.

Within Terra, there are also hidden threats that could easily wipe out its civilizations. To start with, the planet is filled with Catastrophes that force many Terrans to adopt a nomadic way of life through nomadic cities. A crystalline substance known as Originium is left behind at the site of Catastrophes and is widely used as a source of energy and the catalyst for Originium Arts, but is capable of causing Oripathy through direct or prolonged exposure.

2.name: Terra: Georaphy
2.content:
Geography of Terra in Arknights Expanded

Terra the planet central to the Arknights universe presents a geographical tapestry as vast and unforgiving as its history defined by a sprawling supercontinent that dominates its surface interspersed with scattered oceans and shrouded by the enigmatic Barrier a celestial dome sealing it from the stars. This supercontinent a colossal landmass of unnamed continents fused by tectonic upheavals stretches across arid expanses fertile oases and treacherous biomes shaped by relentless Catastrophes hyper storms infused with originium and cosmic energies that sculpt the land with apocalyptic fervor. Much of Terra remains uncharted its terra incognita veiled by environmental perils and the limits of nomadic exploration leaving vast swathes as enigmatic as the precursor ruins dotting its crust. The interplay of aridity fertility and subterranean mysteries alongside the stark boundaries of known and unknown realms crafts a world where geography is both a cradle and a crucible for its inhabitants.

Supercontinental Expanse and Arid Dominance

Terras surface is primarily defined by a single massive supercontinent an amalgamation of landmasses whose boundaries blur under the weight of nomadic migrations and Catastrophic reshaping. This supercontinent spans diverse biomes but is predominantly arid with golden deserts and sun scorched badlands stretching across its heart particularly in regions like Sargon and Kazdel. These arid zones characterized by dunes that shift with each Catastrophe and cracked earth baking under a relentless sun dominate the planetary landscape rendering agriculture a Sisyphean task for most Terrans. Sparse vegetation such as thorny succulents and originium adapted cacti clings to life in these wastes sustained by rare oases that bubble from deep aquifers or seasonal wadis that carve fleeting paths through the sand. These deserts are not barren wastelands but dynamic ecosystems where saurian raiders and perrero caravans navigate by starlight and mirage their paths guided by ancient precursor waystones that hum with latent energies.

Despite the arid tyranny fertile regions punctuate the supercontinent particularly near bodies of water where temperate and tropical biomes flourish. Central Terra home to the imperial heartland of Victoria boasts the most fertile lands with rolling moors verdant valleys and mist cloaked meadows fed by subterranean springs and predictable rainfall. Victorias fertility supports sprawling estates and nomadic agricultural platforms that cultivate grains and root crops sustaining its dense population and fueling its industrial ambitions. The regions temperate climate with mild winters and warm summers fosters biodiversity from grazing caprinae herds to liberi flocks that nest in ancient oaks their migrations a vital part of the ecological balance.

The Sea of Clariside and Coastal Biomes

A defining feature of Terras geography is the Sea of Clariside a vast inland sea cradled between southern Victoria northern Iberia the Siestan peninsula and the Acahuallan region to the southwest. This body of water a shimmering expanse of turquoise and emerald serves as a climatic fulcrum creating sub tropical and wet tropical biomes along its shores. The seas humid breath fosters lush rainforests in Acahualla where towering ferns and bioluminescent fungi thrive alongside reptilia hunters and the mangrove choked deltas of northern Iberia where seaborn incursions leave eerie traces in the tides. Siestas peninsula a sun drenched enclave of Columbian influence basks in Mediterranean like warmth its palm fringed coasts and coral lagoons hosting vibrant marine life and seasonal fiestas that mask underlying espionage. Southern Victorias shores moderated by the seas currents support orchards and vineyards their bounty traded across nomadic sea routes. The Sea of Clariside also serves as a vital trade artery with floating markets and mobile docks linking coastal settlements though its depths harbor precursor relics and abyssal anomalies that deter deep exploration.

Beyond the inland sea Terras oceans cluster primarily in the southern reaches notably south of Iberia and Yan where the Aegir nation reigns in submerged citadels. These southern oceans vast and tempestuous are roiled by currents influenced by the Twin Moons whose gravitational dance amplifies tidal surges. The Profound Silence a cataclysmic event marked by devastating tsunamis reshaped these coastlines flooding Iberian ports and leaving sunken cities as haunting reminders of natures wrath. The altered shores now jagged with salt encrusted cliffs and submerged ruins host hardy fishing communities and aegir outposts that navigate the perilous waves. Other coastal regions include the northern shores of BolÃ­var where cloud forests meet rocky beaches and the northeastern coasts of Higashi where volcanic black sand beaches frame samurai enclaves. These coastlines though vital for trade and resources remain alien to most landlocked Terrans whose nomadic cities rarely venture to the seas edge rendering the ocean a realm of myth and mystery for non Aegir races.

Subterranean Realms and the Durin Enigma

Beneath Terras surface lies a labyrinthine subterranean world largely uncharted and dominated by the Durin race diminutive bat like Terrans who thrive in darkness. These underground networks sprawling cave systems and precursor engineered tunnels honeycomb the supercontinents crust illuminated by the faint glow of originium veins and bioluminescent fungi. The Durin inhabit vast cavern cities carved into stalactite studded chambers their echolocation arts mapping mineral deposits and ancient relics. These subterranean realms stretch beneath regions like Ursus and Sargon connecting distant surface cities through forgotten passages though their full extent remains unknown even to Rhodes Island explorers. Anomalous phenomena such as gravitational distortions and temporal echoes hint at precursor technologies buried within possibly linked to the Barriers origins. The Durins insular culture guards these secrets sharing little with surface dwellers though their trade in rare ores fuels industrial hubs like Rim Billiton.

The subterranean worlds inaccessibility stems from its environmental hazards collapsing tunnels originium laced air and predatory megafauna adapted to eternal night. Surface expeditions often meet ruin in these depths with only specialized operators like Durin or Saria navigating their perils. Rumors persist of deeper layers vast hollows where precursor megastructures pulse with dormant energies or where seaborn entities have breached from abyssal rifts creating hybrid ecosystems of terrifying vitality. These uncharted depths remain Terras last internal frontier a mirror to the planets cosmic isolation under the Barrier.

Borders of the Known The Foehn Hotlands and Infy Icefield

The edges of Terras charted world are marked by two formidable regions the Foehn Hotlands in Sargon and the Infy Icefield spanning Sami and Ursus. The Foehn Hotlands a sweltering expanse of geysers salt flats and volcanic fissures forms a southern barrier where temperatures soar and originium dust storms scour the landscape. This region a crucible of pyroclast forges and saurian warbands serves as a natural fortress its geothermal vents and lava rivers deterring all but the most determined explorers. Ancient precursor obelisks half buried in ash hint at lost outposts but their purpose remains elusive. The Hotlands borderlands fade into terra incognita a realm of uncharted deserts where nomadic tribes whisper of mirage shrouded cities that vanish with the dawn.

The Infy Icefield a frozen wasteland of glaciers and auroral veils stretches across Terras northern reaches encompassing Samis mystical tundras and Ursus militarized taiga. Blizzards laced with originium shards and subzero temperatures render the Icefield a deadly frontier where even ursus clans tread cautiously. Sami shamans navigate its ice caves guided by auroral spirits while Ursus outposts fortify against polar megafauna. Beyond the Icefield lies a continental sized crater like region an unexplored abyss shrouded in perpetual mists and electromagnetic anomalies. Known only through fragmented lore this crater is theorized as the source of northern Collapsals otherworldly entities or phenomena that emerge during Catastrophes their origins tied to cosmic rifts or precursor experiments gone awry. The craters inaccessibility and the Icefields harshness ensure it remains Terras greatest enigma a void that swallows expeditions and fuels apocalyptic prophecies.

Other Biomes and Uncharted Frontiers

Beyond the supercontinents core and its coastal fringes Terra hosts diverse biomes shaped by local conditions and Catastrophic cycles. The steppes of Kazdel vast grasslands scarred by crimson sands support nomadic sarkaz warcamps their herds of hardy beasts grazing on originium tolerant grasses. Leithaniens enchanted forests dense with arcane flora and mist wreathed glades harbor witch covens and mobile academies their canopies alive with liberi scouts. Kjerags alpine fjords and avalanche prone peaks cradle caprinae clans in geothermal warmed longhouses their forges fueled by volcanic springs. BolÃ­vars thunderous highlands where cloud forests cling to lightning scarred sierras host revolutionary camps their mist shrouded trails concealing guerrilla movements. Higashis fungal groves humid and spore laden foster oni villages where bamboo and bioluminescent mushrooms create eerie landscapes patrolled by reptilia assassins.

The uncharted regions terra incognita extend beyond the Foehn Hotlands and Infy Icefield encompassing vast swathes of the supercontinent where Catastrophes have obliterated maps and memory. These include the western barrens beyond Rim Billiton where dust storms bury precursor spires and the eastern highlands past Yan where draconic leylines pulse with untapped energies. The southern oceans depths controlled by Aegir hide abyssal trenches where seaborn hive minds evolve in isolation their surface raids hinting at submerged continents or sunken precursor fleets. Northern taigas beyond the crater fade into frozen wastelands where auroral anomalies distort time and space suggesting rifts to other dimensions or echoes of Earthly realms.

Geographical Impacts and Nomadic Adaptation

Terras geography profoundly shapes its societies with nomadic cities colossal mobile platforms on treads or anti grav cushions designed to evade Catastrophes dominating civilization. These cities like Londinium in Victoria or Lungmen in Yan traverse fertile plains or skirt desert edges guided by meteorological oracles who predict storm paths. Coastal settlements like Dossoles in Iberia rely on buoyant platforms to weather tsunamis while inland hubs like Kazimierz build coliseums on stable plateaus. The Sea of Clarisides trade routes foster economic hubs but also expose them to seaborn threats requiring fortified harbors. The subterranean Durin cities insulated from surface storms trade rare minerals but risk collapse from tectonic shifts or originium leaks.

The Barriers presence a tropospheric dome at six thousand one hundred fifty two point three one meters seals Terra from orbital exploration rendering its skies a false canopy. This isolation amplifies the supercontinents significance as the sole stage for Terran life its uncharted regions both a challenge and a lure for explorers like Rhodes Island. The Zobedie Nebulas violet haze tints Terras sunsets while the Twin Moons one artificial one natural drive tidal and cultural cycles their phases dictating festivals and migrations. The looming black hole beyond the nebula a distant but growing threat underscores the urgency of charting Terras mysteries before cosmic forces redraw its map entirely.

This geographical framework arid yet fertile bounded yet boundless defines Terras essence a world where every horizon hides wonders and terrors where nomadic resilience meets the unyielding unknown and where the land itself narrates a saga of survival and discovery.

3.name: Terra: Races
3.content:
Terra is predominantly inhabited by various humanoid races with animal features and completely anthropomorphic animals, and they are categorized as either Ancients and Elders based on social classes. There are others that are not categorized as both of them like the Teekaz (Sarkaz, Sankta, and Anasa) which are native to Terra, and the Elves. In fact, Terra was originally the homeland of the Sarkaz that was colonized by the Ancients and Elders whom they clam as "invaders".

The Terran races have an extraordinary strength that could easily outmatch Homo sapiens of Earth thanks to their unique racial traits, and they also have different anatomy that requires extensive medical studies to fully comprehend.

Beyond the known Terrans are supernatural beings such as demonic Collapsals and the Seaborn from the abyss of the vast ocean.

4.name: Terra: Biology
4.content:
Fauna

The fauna of Terra have notable stark differences to our world in which they possess chimeric traits. As differentiation with the animal-like Terrans, most of them have the suffix "beast". Some of the notable Terran fauna are:

    Large gastropods known as "Originium slugs"
    Large bear-like carnivores known as "Manglerbeasts"
    Crustacean "metal crabs" and "gloompincers"
    Badger-like "sand beasts"
    Arachnid "rock spiders"
    Slumberfoots: Tapir-like animals living around the deserts that could cause soporific effect on nearby organisms through their digestive glands.[6]
    Needleflies: Giant arthropods resembling scorpions and dragonfly nymphs. They have the ability to ambush in sand and attack their prey with their stingers.
    Goat-like leporibeasts and mossback beast
    Cloudbeasts: Cat-like mammals with horns of a goat. They are noted to be domesticated as pets.
    Beckbeast: Mammals resembling a mix of a dog and a mole that is widely used as police dogs.
    Sandbeast: Rodents who lives in deserts.
    Musbeast: Squirrel-like rodents with feathers. Originally from Sargon, they are adopted by the Terrans as pets but have recently become city pests that destroy infrastructures caused by abandoned pets.

Terra also have umbrella terms for animals acting as analogues of Earth animals but with various traits:

    Burdenbeasts: "Burdenbeast" is an umbrella term for any animal used as a beast of burden by the Terrans. They are usually large, omnivorous animals â€”generally 210â€“240 cm tall in compassion of an average adult Terranâ€” resembling rhinoceroses in Earth, but some species also have the characteristics of a tapir and the extinct Ceratopsians. They have flat horns in front of their noses, similar to a Megacerops, which is used to dig out roots and tubers from the soil. Their general lack of flexibility is compensated by their thick fur or skin, which allows them to withstand most small/medium-sized predators. Even the skin inside their mouths is thick enough for them to safely bypass the defense mechanisms of many plants (i.e. the spikes of a cactus). Although burdenbeasts are omnivores, their diet mostly consists of plants and cacti. Their feces vary in shape depending on the food they eat, and are used as both territory marks and fertilizer.
    Clawbeast: An umbrella term for any wild animal with sharp claws. One of them, the chitotex clawbeasts, are Glyptodonts-like animals with turtle shells. Another kind of clawbeasts, the arma-clawbeast, are carnivores with social structures that burrow underground and build their nests around Originium veins.
    Fowlbeast: Avians. There are many kinds of fowlbeasts inhabiting Terra with some having unique traits. The stinkfowl are raven-like birds with dazzling silver and black feathers that has the ability to secrete stinky fluid onto their enemies.[10] Another kind of fowls in Rim Billiton could fly up to 4,000 above sea level, and in a particular site, some of them evolved into giant flightless bird with robust speed after they were abandoned by their migratory ancestors.
    Cystybeast: Dairy animals (e.g. cows). The milk they produced is usually called "cystymilk."
    Tuskbeast: Large carnivorous animals
    Fangbeast: Carnivorous animals
    Vesperwing: Bats
    Gnawbeast: Rats, rodents
    Scalebass/Fins: Fishes
    Shells: Crustaceans and shellfishes

5.name: Terra: Civilization
5.content:
Civilization Politics and Culture of Terra in Arknights

Civilization on Terra a planet of relentless Catastrophes and originium driven progress unfolds as a saga of resilience born from the ashes of a lost golden age. Approximately thirteen thousand years ago Terra then a nascent world inhabited by the ethereal Teekaz was transformed by the Predecessors an advanced possibly extraterrestrial civilization whose mastery of planetary engineering hyperspace travel and terraforming reshaped the barren orb into a vibrant biosphere. Their crowning achievements included the construction of one of Terras Twin Moons an artificial satellite of enigmatic purpose and the Barrier or Starpod a tropospheric dome sealing the planet from cosmic exploration. This precursor epoch left towering spires subterranean vaults and originium infused relics but ended abruptly in a cosmic calamity speculated to be a dimensional rift stellar incursion or plague that erased the Predecessors leaving no memories only ruins. From this void emerged the Ancients animal like Terrans such as Cautus and Felines and the Elders mythical races like Sankta and Draco who wove new civilizations from fragmented technologies and nascent originium arts. These early societies tribal and nomadic laid the foundations for Terras modern nations their cultures shaped by survival against Catastrophes and the creeping threat of Oripathy the crystalline disease born of originium exposure.

Political Structures and Geopolitical Dynamics

Terras political landscape is a fractured mosaic of monarchies oligarchies and theocratic enclaves rooted in ancient traditions and hardened by territorial ambitions. The Sargonian monarchical system established in the dawn of the common era by pharaoh like rulers in Sargons dune seas set a precedent for centralized power adopted by many Terran nations. Victoria with its lion maned Aslan nobility evolved this into a feudal empire of dukes and barons centered in the nomadic megacity of Londinium where parliamentary intrigues mask royal decrees. Leithanien blends arcane oligarchy with baroque monarchy its witch kings and alchemical councils ruling from drifting academies over enchanted forests. Laterano a theocratic republic governed by Sankta notaries enforces divine law through haloed legates its nomadic basilicas radiating spiritual and martial authority. Ursus a tsarist autocracy forged in frozen tundras wields militaristic might from lumbering fortresses its emperors crushing dissent in originium rich mines. These systems contrast with Samis decentralized shamanic tribes who commune with auroral spirits in icebound councils and Yans bureaucratic empire where draconic mandarins balance chi infused governance with imperial edicts from pagoda topped city ships.

Higashi adopted Yans meritocratic feudalism evolving it into a shogunate where samurai clans and oni magistrates uphold honor codes amidst fungal groves. Columbia the sole federal republic brands itself democratic but its presidency is swayed by corporate giants like Rhine Lab and Blacksteel Worldwide their skyscraper clad cities like Siesta pulsing with surveillance and ambition. True democracy remains elusive across Terra as even Columbias elections lack transparency serving oligarchic interests over the masses. The geopolitical stage mirrors Earths pre World War I era with empires like Victoria and Ursus expanding unchecked clashing in proxy wars and territorial grabs. The War of the Four Nations from 1029 to 1031 a brutal conflict pitting Victoria Gaul Leithanien and Ursus saw Gauls annihilation leaving a power vacuum that Ursus filled with aggressive expansion. The Profound Silence of 1038 a tsunami driven Catastrophe crippled Iberia shifting heartland dynamics further.

Amid this turmoil peacekeeping efforts persist. Lateranos Legati diplomatic envoys armed with sanctified firearms mediate disputes while NGOs like Rhodes Island a pharmaceutical ark for the Oripathy infected broker ceasefires and aid marginalized communities. These efforts struggle against internal strife rebellions like the Reunion Movements infected uprisings and external threats ignored by insular nations. The Seaborn an abyssal hive mind rising from southern oceans and the Collapsals eldritch entities from the northern Infy Icefield loom as existential dangers yet receive scant attention as nations grapple with borders and resources.

Nation States and the Terran Heartland

Terras nation states are cultural amalgams blending Earthly parallels with fantastical twists their borders fluid as nomadic cities traverse Catastrophe scarred landscapes. The Terran heartland traditionally Victoria Gaul Leithanien Iberia and Laterano represents the geopolitical core defined by fertile central lands and historical dominance. Victoria evokes British imperialism with gothic spires and tea rituals its nomadic capital Londinium a steel behemoth of class divides and revolutionary whispers. Leithanien merges Germanic and arcane aesthetics its mobile academies weaving arts and intrigue across misty moors. Iberia once a maritime power akin to Spain now reels from the Profound Silences floods its sunken ports guarded by seaborn wary survivors. Laterano a Vatican like theocracy radiates Sankta piety its basilicas drifting on sanctified treads. Gauls fall in 1031 left a void Ursus swiftly filled its bear like tsars dominating tundras and mines with iron fisted zeal.

Beyond the traditional heartland Kazimierz a knightly realm of Polish inspired chivalry hosts jousting coliseums on golden plains its corporate knights vying for glory. Yan an ancient empire of Chinese draconic heritage governs from jade clad city ships its poetry and chi arts shaping a stoic yet expansionist ethos. Columbia a federation of American flavored city states pushes into heartland politics with economic clout and military drones its neon lit Siesta masking corporate espionage. Sargon blends Mesoamerican pyramids and Middle Eastern nomadism its desert tribes and pharaohs trading spices and relics across dune seas. Sami a northern wilderness of auroral mysticism unites shamanic tribes in yurts circling hot springs their rites warding off Collapsal incursions. Ursus militaristic sprawl and BolÃ­vars revolutionary highlands further diversify the geopolitical tapestry the latter channeling Andean guerilla spirit against colonial remnants. Higashi a Japanese inspired shogunate of samurai and oni thrives in fungal groves while Minos a Minoan labyrinth of bovine citadels guards Aegean like isles. Rim Billiton a resource stripped frontier fuels industrial powers with coal and originium its rigs rolling through dust choked wastes.

Science and Technology in a Post Precursor Era

Terras technological landscape a blend of ingenuity and regression reflects the cataclysmic loss of precursor knowledge. The Predecessors left marvels like the Starpod anti gravity platforms and originium reactors but their erasure left modern Terrans to rediscover arts driven engineering. Current technology parallels Earths late 20th century with advancements in AI controlled robots unmanned aerial and ground vehicles and colossal nomadic cities powered by originium fusion. These cities like Lungmens neon clad sprawl or Londiniums steam driven bulk roam to evade Catastrophes their treads and anti grav cushions marvels of mobility. Steam powered power armors worn by Victorian knights and Ursus shock troops amplify melee combat blending industrial might with feudal aesthetics.

Yet critical gaps persist. Shipbuilding lags due to Seaborn threats in southern oceans limiting nautical exploration to Aegir submersibles and Iberian buoyed platforms. High altitude flight is impossible as the Starpod at six thousand one hundred fifty two point three one meters disrupts aerodynamics and navigation. Terras unique geological makeup lacks Earths chemical compounds like sulfur for gunpowder relying instead on originium for explosives and arts based firearms. Originium a double edged mineral powers everything from medical scanners to city reactors but its volatility and Oripathy risk constrain its use. Rhine Labs breakthrough in 1099 when Kristen Wright breached the Starpod opened new avenues for aerospace research revealing glimpses of the Zobedie Nebula and sparking debates on cosmic exploration though most Terrans remain grounded by practical needs and Catastrophe fears.

Warfare and Originium Driven Combat

Terran warfare fuses archaic and arcane with cold weapons dominating battlefields alongside originium enhanced technologies. Swords spears shields and crossbows crafted with precursor alloys or volcanic glass remain staples wielded by knights in Kazimierz or samurai in Higashi. Gigantic military landships mobile fortresses akin to naval dreadnoughts rumble across steppes and deserts their originium cannons unleashing devastating barrages. These behemoths like Ursus Iron Fortress or Victorias Crown Sentinel serve as command hubs and siege engines their treads crushing terrain reshaped by Catastrophes.

Firearms though revolutionary are rare and originium dependent functioning as arts amplifiers rather than chemical weapons. Sankta excel in patron firearms rifles and pistols that channel their haloed arts firing originium projectiles with preternatural precision as seen in operators like Exusiai. Non Sankta firearms reverse engineered by groups like Blacksteel are costly and less effective their arts mechanisms clunky compared to Sankta designs. Explosives also rely on originium compounds volatile yet powerful used in grenades and mines by operators like Frostleaf. This scarcity elevates melee prowess with races like Ursus and Forte leveraging brute strength and Lupo and Felines relying on agility. The interplay of traditional and arts based warfare creates a dynamic battlefield where strategy hinges on terrain mobility and originium mastery.

Astronomy and the Starpods Veil

Terras astronomical pursuits are stunted by the Starpod a precursor barrier that cloaks the sky distorting starlight and blocking orbital access. This celestial cage renders traditional astronomy nearly impossible as constellations shimmer unreliably through the Barriers haze. Iberian sailors once reliant on celestial navigation abandoned it for Aegir derived technologies like lighthouses and sonar buoys their coastal routes marked by bioluminescent signals. Sami shamans interpret auroral patterns as spiritual omens not scientific data while Yanese astrologers divine chi flows from lunar phases bypassing stellar charts. Columbian scientist Stephensons dismissal of high altitude exploration reflects Terras pragmatic disinterest in the cosmos grounded by immediate survival needs.

The 1099 breach by Kristen Wright of Rhine Lab a historic puncture of the Starpod via experimental arts propulsion marked a turning point. The resulting aperture allowed fleeting observations of the Zobedie Nebula and distant Talos igniting scientific curiosity. Researchers now study the Twin Moons one natural one artificial for clues to precursor intents while the looming black hole in the nebula fuels apocalyptic theories. Yet astronomical progress remains nascent as Catastrophes and Oripathy divert resources leaving the stars a distant dream.

Cultural Tapestry and Earthly Echoes

Terras cultures weave a vibrant mosaic echoing Earths traditions while rooted in its unique racial and environmental dynamics. Yan celebrates Chinese inspired Spring Festivals with dragon dances and ancestral altars its poetry and idioms shaping philosophical discourse. Victoria channels British sensibilities with tea ceremonies gothic literature and rigid social hierarchies its cultural dominance spreading through colonial legacies. Columbia mirrors American pop culture with neon lit arcades reality shows and corporate driven individualism its Siestan fiestas blending freedom with surveillance. Higashis samurai codes and comic traditions evoke Japan while Samis auroral rites and Ursus militaristic ballets reflect Nordic and Russian influences. Iberias maritime festivals once vibrant now wane post Profound Silence their seaborn haunted shores hosting solemn vigils. Lateranos Christmas like festivals and Sauin Halloween analogs blend piety with universal revelry while Minos labyrinthine rites echo Minoan mysticism.

Victorian culture reigns supreme its literature fashion and etiquette permeating heartland nations a legacy of Gauls fallen dominance. Yanese poetry Ursus vodka toasts and Higashi manga remain influential but face erosion from political upheavals and Catastrophe driven displacement. Rhodes Island fosters a syncretic culture uniting races in shared struggle against Oripathy its operators celebrating diverse traditions from Cautus carrot feasts to Draco fire dances. Terras dating system mirrors the Gregorian calendar with years counted from an unspecified epoch the Main Theme spanning 1096 to 1098 a testament to structured timekeeping amid chaotic existence. This cultural richness tempered by survival and stigma binds Terrans in a shared narrative of resilience and reinvention.

Societal Challenges and the Unseen Threats

Terras societies grapple with internal and external pressures that threaten their fragile order. Oripathy the crystalline plague infects millions stigmatizing victims and fueling movements like Reunion which demand equity through rebellion. Nomadic cities while engineering marvels strain resources as populations swell requiring constant migration to evade Catastrophes. The heartlands political rivalries spark proxy wars and espionage with Columbias economic incursions clashing against Ursus militarism and Victorias imperial pride. Beyond these the Seaborn evolve in southern oceans their adaptive hive mind breaching coasts with biomechanical horrors as seen in Iberias struggles. The northern Collapsals spectral entities tied to the Infy Icefields crater emerge during Catastrophes their origins possibly linked to precursor rifts or demonic arts wielded by Sarkaz exiles.

Rhodes Island stands as a beacon navigating these challenges its medical and tactical expertise uniting races against disease and chaos. Yet even its efforts strain against the tide of geopolitical neglect as nations ignore the great beyond the uncharted deserts icefields and oceans where precursor secrets and cosmic threats lurk. Terras civilization a testament to endurance teeters on the edge of collapse or transcendence its future hinging on whether its peoples can unite against the unseen or succumb to their own divisions.

6.name: |----------RACES----------|
6.content:
Terrans Overview and Anthropological Depth in Arknights

Terrans the sapient inhabitants of Terra form a vibrant mosaic of races distinct from Earths Homo sapiens yet sharing fundamental biological principles such as bipedalism cognition and viviparity. Unlike Earth humans most Terrans exhibit physical traits drawn from animals mythical creatures or supernatural entities ranging from subtle anthropomorphic features to pronounced bestial characteristics. These traits manifest across a spectrum of humanoid kemonomimi like forms with animal ears tails or other appendages and occasionally more bestial morphologies that retain sapient intellect and bipedal posture. This diversity stems from Terras ancient terraforming by a precursor civilization which seeded the planet with genetic templates blending terrestrial and fantastical biologies. The pervasive influence of Originium a crystalline mineral fueling both technological marvels and the deadly Oripathy disease further shapes Terran physiology often amplifying racial traits through exposure or mutation.

Humanoid Terrans constitute the majority resembling Earth humans in stature and facial structure but distinguished by animalistic features specific to their race. Common traits include bestial ears such as the upright rabbit ears of Cautus or the tufted feline ears of Felines and non prehensile tails like the bushy tails of Lupo or the sleek tails of Felines though some races like Aegir or Sankta may lack these in favor of fins halos or other markers. Additional features vary widely horns for Caprinae feathers for Liberi scales for Reptilia or bioluminescent markings for Aegir. These traits often confer functional advantages enhanced hearing in Cautus agility in Felines or aquatic prowess in Aegir. Some humanoid Terrans deviate from this pattern possessing rounded or pointed ears akin to Earth humans as seen in certain Alterra or Sankta while rare individuals exhibit dual ear sets bestial and human like with both pairs functional though lore remains silent on auditory mechanics possibly amplifying spatial awareness or sensitivity to frequencies. These kemonomimi like Terrans dominate urban centers like Lungmen and Londinium blending into cosmopolitan societies where their traits are both cultural identifiers and practical adaptations.

Bestial Terrans though less common push anthropomorphism toward more animalistic forms while retaining sapience and bipedalism. These individuals such as certain Forte with bovine bulk or Saurian with dinosaur like robustness resemble anthropomorphic animals with pronounced fur scales or skeletal structures. Their appearance aligns with Earths furry archetype though in Terra they are simply part of the racial continuum not a distinct subculture. Bestial Terrans often hail from rugged regions like Sargons deserts or Ursus tundras where their robust physiques suit harsh environments. The case of the Rat King a bestial Perro with rodent like features and his humanoid daughter Lin Yuhsia illustrates that lineage does not strictly dictate humanoid versus bestial expression suggesting genetic or environmental factors influence phenotype within races.

Reproduction among Terrans mirrors Homo sapiens viviparity with all races giving birth to live young regardless of their animal inspirations even those tied to oviparous creatures like Reptilia or Liberi. Gestation periods and reproductive biology appear consistent across races though specific details are sparse in lore. Interracial unions are commonplace especially in melting pots like Lungmen or Columbia where diverse races coexist. In same race pairings such as two Forte the offspring reliably inherit the parents race with minor variations in trait expression. In mixed race pairings such as a Savra and a Forte the child typically inherits the racial traits of one parent though canon does not explicitly favor paternal inheritance as a rule. A notable exception is the Sankta Sarkaz pairing which produces hybrids exhibiting traits of both races such as Mostima who bears a Sankta halo and Sarkaz horns albeit with altered properties like a darkened halo reflecting her mixed heritage. Since the Aslanian Conquest a historical period of Victorian expansion under Aslan rulers racial purity has emerged as a political ideal among elite classes particularly in Victoria and Leithanien where noble houses like the SilverAsh clan prioritize lineage to maintain power. This has led to stigmatization of mixed race individuals in certain circles though broader society especially among the infected embraces diversity as a survival necessity.

Terran lifespans vary significantly by race and environmental factors with Oripathy drastically reducing longevity across the board. Excluding those afflicted by the disease which crystallizes flesh and organs leading to premature death a healthy Terran might average 120 to 150 years with races like Alterra Cautus or Felines falling within this range. Races with supernatural or robust physiologies such as Teekaz ethereal beings with near spectral forms or Corroseros with draconic durability often exceed this averaging 200 years or more. Certain individuals achieve extreme longevity through arts originium enhancements or other means as seen with Kaltsit an Alterra whose apparent immortality hints at precursor technology or ancient pacts. Claims of a Savra named Padishah Ibn Erhan reaching 230 years lack direct canon support but align with the reptilian Savra races potential for extended lifespans due to their cold blooded metabolism and regenerative traits. Immortality remains rare typically tied to Feranmut elder god like entities or anomalous arts as with characters like Skadi whose Aegir physiology defies aging norms.

The term human is sparingly used in Terra replaced by Terran to encompass all sapient races with race specific names like Cautus or Sankta used in technical medical or cultural contexts particularly by Rhodes Island for Oripathy research. This reflects Terras lack of a singular human archetype instead embracing a pluralistic identity shaped by racial diversity and shared struggles against Catastrophes and disease. Below is a detailed breakdown of select Terran races expanding on their physiological cultural and societal roles to enrich the anthropological tapestry.

Alterra the baseline race mirrors Earth humans without overt animal traits serving as scientists leaders and civilians across Terra. Their lack of distinct features makes them versatile found in Rhodes Islands command structure like the Doctor or Kaltsit and in urban hubs like Londinium. Physiologically unremarkable they are susceptible to Oripathy but excel in intellectual pursuits and arts mastery.

Aegir adapted to deep sea environments boast fins gills and bioluminescent skin thriving in abyssal cities like those of the Aegir nation. Their isolationist culture reveres technological innovation crafting submersible drones and originium amplifiers. Operators like Skadi and Specter showcase their superhuman strength and resilience often tinged with seaborn mutations that hint at deeper evolutionary ties to Terras oceans.

Anura frog like Terrans with webbed feet and toxin secreting skin inhabit humid bayous and wetlands like those near Siesta. Their shamanic traditions involve brewing paralytic elixirs and performing leaping rituals symbolizing renewal. Operators like Pramanix blend Anura agility with spiritual arts leading clans in ceremonial dances.

Aslan lion maned nobles dominate Victorias aristocracy their golden fur and regal bearing tied to knightly orders and political intrigues. Their strength and charisma make them natural leaders as seen in Flamebringer though their pride fuels conflicts with emerging democratic factions.

Caprinae goat and sheep like Terrans with horns and woolly fur thrive in Kjerags alpine passes. Their hardy physique suits rugged terrains and their communal festivals weaving wool into sacred tapestries strengthen clan bonds. Operators like Carnelian wield earth arts reflecting their mountainous heritage.

Castus rare angelic Terrans with wings and halo like auras are revered as healers in Laterano and Leithanien. Their light based arts mend wounds and purify Oripathy symptoms as seen in Fiammetta though their rarity makes them near mythical figures often cloistered in sanctuaries.

Cautus rabbit like Terrans with long ears and agile frames populate Yans warrens and Columbias suburbs. Their heightened senses and rapid reproduction foster bustling merchant clans. Amiya a Cautus leads Rhodes Island blending empathy with potent arts a testament to their races versatility.

Cervus deer like Terrans with antlers roam Samis tundras their graceful builds belying keen survival instincts. Their shamanic rites invoke forest spirits as seen in operators like Santalla who channel ice arts in auroral ceremonies.

Corroseros draconic ancients with scales and fire breath inhabit volcanic regions like Sargons Ashen Plane. Their longevity and wisdom make them revered oracles though their reclusive nature limits their societal roles. Operators like Chen embody their fiery resolve.

Cureci hedgehog like Terrans with spines dwell in Iberian dunes their defensive curling and nocturnal habits suiting coastal survival. Operators like Saria use calcifying arts to shield allies reflecting their races protective ethos.

Darling fox like Terrans with multiple tails weave illusions in Lateranos shadows and Yans courts. Their cunning makes them adept spies and diplomats as seen in Le Fay whose magical arts manipulate perceptions.

Demon Sarkaz with horns and infernal affinities roam Kazdels badlands their regenerative arts fueling warlord cults. Operators like Surtr wield devastating flames though their stigma as outcasts drives their militant defiance.

Draco dragon like Terrans with elemental control guard Yans leylines their noble bearing evident in Chen and Talulah who channel fire and authority in equal measure.

Durin bat like Terrans with echolocation navigate Ursine mines and cave networks their sonic arts mapping resources. Operators like Durin craft tools from cave crystals blending utility with subterranean lore.

Elyvian angelic Terrans with light manipulation are Leithaniens arcane elite their radiant arts healing or destroying. Mostima a fallen Elyvian blends shadow and light in her complex identity.

Felines cat like Terrans with nine lives lore prowl urban and wild spaces their agility suiting espionage and combat. SilverAsh and Projekt Red exemplify their independence and precision.

Liberi bird like Terrans with wings soar as scouts and couriers their aerial dances mapping trade routes. Exusiai and Jaye blend flight with sharpshooting and survival instincts.

Lupo wolf like Terrans form loyal packs in Ursus and Lungmen their hunting arts lethal in coordinated strikes. Texas and Lappland showcase their ferocity and clan bonds.

Perro dog like Terrans with keen noses serve as trackers in Bolivar and Columbia their loyalty anchoring mercenary bands. Gummy and Cutter balance warmth with combat prowess.

Pyroclast volcanic Terrans with heat resistant skin forge artifacts in Sargons lava fields their molten arts shaping legendary blades. Eyjafjalla channels volcanic power despite her frail frame.

Reptilia lizard like Terrans with scales ambush in Higashis jungles their cold blooded patience yielding ninja tactics. Thorns blends poison arts with swift strikes.

Sankta angelic Terrans with halos and staff arts uphold Lateranos theocracy their sanctified gunfire a divine mandate. Exusiai and Executor embody their zealous precision.

Sarcophaga insect like Terrans with hive minds orchestrate swarm tactics in corporate hives their buzzing strategies overwhelming foes. Hellagur blends insect agility with veteran cunning.

Saurian dinosaur like Terrans thunder through Foehn badlands their primal strength rallying raider tribes. Savage wields raw power in her hammer swings.

Ursus bear like Terrans with immense strength dominate northern tundras their fur cloaks adorning tsarist courts. Zima and Gummy endure cold and combat with ursine resilience.

Vouivre wyvern like Terrans with draconic horns patrol Yans frontiers their flight and strength guarding imperial borders. Chen and Dusk channel their soaring might.

Yan panda like Terrans philosophize in bamboo groves their chi arts balancing bureaucracy with serenity. Nian and Dusk weave myth into their protective roles.

Yueba horse like Terrans gallop Minos plains their nomadic riders herding labyrinthine flocks. Agalia blends speed with strategic foresight.

Teekaz ethereal Terrans flit as spectral guides their formless essence aiding infected visions. Rarely seen they influence through subtle whispers in Oripathy dreams.

Seaborn abyssal Terrans evolve in oceanic depths their hive mind adapting to surface threats. Gladiia and Specter hint at their mutable alien nature.

Feranmut god like entities slumber in Terras core their avatars stirring in Catastrophes wake. Their rare interventions shape myths and destinies across races.

Cultural and societal dynamics among Terrans reflect their racial diversity with each race carving unique niches in Terras nomadic tapestry. Urban centers like Lungmen blend Cautus Lupo and Draco in vibrant markets while rural clans like Kjerags Caprinae uphold ancestral rites. Oripathy unites races in shared stigma fostering Rhodes Islands inclusive ethos where operators from all backgrounds collaborate against Catastrophes and disease. Political tensions particularly in Victoria and Leithanien exacerbate racial divides with purity doctrines clashing against the melting pot realities of modern Terra. Yet festivals like Lungmens dragon boat races or Kjerags wool weaves celebrate interracial harmony proving Terrans resilience in forging unity amid diversity.

7.name: Predecessor
7.content:
Members of the Predecessors appear exactly identical to original humans, but whether this also extends to physical capability and lifespan.

The Predecessors are actually alien to Terra, possibly a Type-III space-faring civilization based on the Kardashev scale, who arrived in the planet over 13,000 years before the events of Arknights take place, bringing animals that would evolve into Ancients and Elders with them. They displaced the Teekaz as Terra's sole inhabitants and built an advanced civilization over the course of millennia since their arrival.

Some 13,000 years ago, the majority of the Predecessors were wiped out by a "threat from above" â€” implied to be the Observers, and for unknown reasons, they shielded Terra's troposphere with the Starpod. The Predecessor survivors constructed the "Stargates" to reconnect with other planets, but this went haywire as they unleashed the Collapsals onto Terra. The Predecessors also carried out the "Preserver Project" as a contingency plan to ensure the Predecessors' survival with Trevor Friston as one of the volunteers. Two Predecessor survivors, Priestess and "Oracle", created Originium as the only feasible way to ensure the Predecessors' continuity by having them transcend into the Assimilated Universe, despite the substance later becoming the ever-present bane of the Terrans.

By the time of Arknights, the Predecessors are all but extinct, at least in Terra, since only the Oracle, now known as the "Doctor", who remained; the slumbering Predecessor survivors part of the Preserver Project had their Sarcophagi's power drained, preventing them from ever being awakened; Priestess is implied to have died (albeit her consciousness lingers within the Assimilated Universe); and Trevor Friston had become a Preserver.

Although all but few of the current Terrans had no knowledge regarding the Predecessors whatsoever, their legacy nonetheless shaped the Terrans in the millennia to come. The only ones who were aware of the Predecessors' existence are the Aegirians and very few rare individuals. Predecessors' lost are so advanced technologies to the point that they are a completely alien civilization when compared with the rest of the Terrans.

8.name: -----Natives-----
8.content: Terra has been inhabited by several sapient races long before the advent of the Ancients and Elders The history of Terra stretches back thousands of years into an age where the world was wild untamed and filled with mysteries far beyond the comprehension of modern civilizations Among the earliest known inhabitants were the diverse native races indigenous peoples whose tribes and clans lived in deep harmony with the environment Their relationship with the land was symbiotic marked by profound respect for the natural order of existence These native groups varied greatly in language culture and societal structure yet all shared a spiritual connection to Terra itself Their oral histories tell of times when the land was young and the skies were ruled by ancient celestial beings whose energies shaped everything In parallel with the native peoples were the Feranmut an enigmatic people cloaked in mystery and myth Their origins are often debated among scholars but it is universally accepted that they possessed knowledge and powers far exceeding those of most other races The Feranmut were believed to communicate with the deepest forces of nature using rites and magic unknown to others Their presence in Terraâ€™s forests mountains and rivers served as a living link to the worldâ€™s untapped spiritual energies The elves are another significant ancient race whose legacy permeates Terraâ€™s legends Their long lifespan allowed them to become great custodians of magic and wisdom fostering arts sciences and philosophies that would influence all sentient beings on the planet These graceful and often reclusive beings are described as having an intrinsic connection to the ethereal realms and the flow of the worldâ€™s lifeforce Through centuries of observation and contemplation the elves developed profound insights into the balance of power within the natural and supernatural realms Their cities rare and majestic were often concealed within enchanted groves or hidden away in the highest mountain peaks The interactions between these races before the rise of the Ancients define much of Terraâ€™s early political social and spiritual history Conflicts arose over resources territorial boundaries and differing beliefs yet there were also numerous alliances forged through trade marriage and mutual respect These relationships formed a complex web of diplomacy that shaped the way societies evolved and interacted with the world around them Before the Ancients appeared there was also a delicate equilibrium maintained through the wisdom of the Elders who embodied the collective memory and traditions of these peoples The Elders were revered as custodians of ancient knowledge serving as guides and mediators in times of crisis Their counsel helped prevent the destruction of fragile ecosystems and upheld laws that honored the sanctity of all life On the dawn of the Ancients the world of Terra underwent monumental changes These beings of unknown origin brought with them technologies and systems that transformed the landscape economically politically and culturally However their coming also disrupted the natural rhythms established by the native peoples Feranmut and elves who saw their ways of life threatened or forever altered The stories of resistance adaptation and sometimes tragic assimilation during this era are told in many tongues among the descendants of these races Today Terra remains a world where the echoes of these ancient inhabitants reverberate through the mountains forests and cities The descendants of the natives continue to honor the old ways blending them with new customs The Feranmut legacy survives in secretive cults and hidden enclaves maintaining fragile connections to the primal forces And the elves still walk quiet paths guarding arcane knowledge while watching the march of history unfold The lore of Terra is layered and textured a tapestry woven from the lives struggles and triumphs of all these peoples their memories carved into the very soul of the planet serving as a reminder of a time when the world was young and brimming with endless possibility

9.name: Elf
9.content: The Elves singular Elf are a unique and ancient race inhabiting the world of Terra Their existence predates much of the modern history of the planet and stems deeply from the lineage of the Feranmut a mysterious and powerful people who shaped much of Terraâ€™s early civilizations The Elves are renowned for their distinct physical traits that set them apart from other races such as the Durins Among these traits are their notably long pointed ears and their taller more graceful stature which immediately signal their ancient heritage compared to the more robust Durins However it is the Elvish longevity that has fascinated scholars and common folk alike The Elves possess lifespans that far exceed those of most other races and many individuals among them can maintain the appearance of youth over several centuries This extraordinary lifespan is not merely biological but is also bound to their mystical essence and connection to nature Yet this gift of longevity is marred by one of their greatest vulnerabilities their extreme sensitivity to Originium and the affliction known as Oripathy Originium a rare crystalline mineral with profound destructive and magical properties has become widespread due to the industrialization of Terra but poses a lethal threat to the Elves When exposed to Originium the Elven physiology reacts in a devastating way causing Oripathy to progress rapidly within them and their lifespan can be cut down to a mere few weeks or less This vulnerability effectively precludes them from using Originium Arts a form of supernatural power common to many Terran races who utilize Originium as a source of magical energy The Elvesâ€™ incapacity to harness Originium Arts is intrinsically linked to their origin story They are the direct descendants of a particular group of Feranmut who created them purposefully to serve as guardians over the ruins and relics left behind by the enigmatic Predecessors a long-lost advanced civilization whose technology and culture still intrigue the beings of Terra Today this origin explains why Elves carry supernatural traits that set them apart from other races including their inability to access Originium magic Instead they rely on innate magical abilities closely tied to the natural environment and the spiritual currents flowing through Terra These powers often manifest in ways that influence life growth and balance rather than destruction or exploitation In the modern era the Elves face existential threats as the spread of Originium pollution intensifies stemming from rapid industrial expansion within Terran civilization This pollution has ravaged the natural world and created hostile environments for the Elves due to their extreme sensitivity to the mineral As a result the Elves are now categorized as an endangered race their numbers dwindling and their culture at risk of extinction Many Elves have retreated into deep wilderness areas choosing hermit-like lives isolated from civilization seeking refuge where the air and earth remain untouched by Originium contamination Others take great risks dwelling in urban environments where they often live on the margins of society Nonetheless some Elven communities still thrive in isolated sanctuaries free from Originium pollution notable among these are the Sami Elves residing in the central Sami forests The Sami Elvesâ€™ culture revolves around their devotion to a massive sacred tree that exudes amber a substance they highly venerate as the source of their life force This tree embodies their spiritual and cultural essence and serves as a living symbol connecting them to the primal forces of Terra Due to their isolation from the outside world the Sami Elves have lost fluency in the common Terran language but communication with other races is maintained through extraordinary means such as telepathy which is practiced notably by the figure Muelsyse This psychic connection allows limited understanding and interaction preserving fragile ties between the Elves and the broader Terran societies The Elvesâ€™ profound bond with nature reflects deep-rooted cultural roles as protectors and guardians of the natural world Their image in folklore and mythology consistently portrays them as keepers of balance ensuring the integrity of the ecosystem and the sacred sites of Terra Their magical abilities align with this role emphasizing harmony renewal and preservation rather than domination Their heritage as descendants of the Feranmut incorporates a rich tapestry of ancient wisdom and purpose reminding all who encounter them that Terraâ€™s past holds vital lessons for the future In summary the Elves of Terra are not simply an archaic race but a living link to the planetâ€™s earliest epochs Their fragile presence amid a world irrevocably changed by industrial development stands testament to the enduring conflict between progress and preservation Their lore history and continued survival embody the delicate dance between mortality and immortality magic and science tradition and innovation woven into the very fabric of Terraâ€™s evolving story

10.name: Feranmut
10.content:
The Feranmuts are a race of Terra

The Sargonian scholars who coined the term "Feranmuts" describe these majestic "gods" and Their "prophets" as gigantic living creatures Whose characteristics are unfathomable to ordinary people. These entities have various physical characteristics which mimic the mythological creatures and deities in our world, ranging from humanoid to anthropomorphic. They wield unique powers completely unrelated to Originium Arts, and are completely immune to the influences of Originium, including Oripathy. Feranmuts are apparently biologically immortal, but can be killed or "shattered" into multiple fragments or avatars of varying personalities acting as their own "proxies" or "executors." A Feranmut's average lifespan spans tens of thousands of years. They can even allow Their mortal bodies to be destroyed while retaining Their spiritual consciousness.

The Feranmuts' power are strongly associated with topography. As a matter of fact, many have the ability to perform terra-formation and weather control. However, Their supernatural ability depends on Their dwelling land as well as Their ages. Those that are too young would only limit Their domination in a certain region, whereas Those that are old enough could exert their power beyond Their dwellings.

Aside from topographic alter, Feranmuts could bend the basic concepts of physics and time and create paradoxes. They are able to get rid of Their flesh but still retains Their physic form, or "transcended into spirits" in a mortal's sense. For example, in a special specimen from Kazdel stored inside the Victorian Royal Academy of Sciences, a Feranmut corpse specimen coded "OFAS-021" was able to withstand corrosive liquid for almost a month, but it suddenly turned into pieces of barren bones on the thirty-second day.

Due to Their might, Feranmuts are often seen as deities or gods by the Terrans, although "living gods" would describe Them better. Nevertheless, Feranmuts do not have the concept of "domination" or "sovereign;" rather, They view the mortals as literal part of Their bodies dwelling upon Them.


Origin
Feranmuts are, along with the Sarkaz, the original inhabitants of Terra. Before the "arrival" of the Ancients and Elders, Teekaz tales regarding the Feranmuts were already wide-spread.

To the Feranmuts Themselves, They narrated that They were born from the chaotic void who later "created" the soil and "gave order" to the sun and the moon. At one point in prehistoric era, They faced "an eye that broke the heavens," and They sacrificed Themselves to expel the "eye" out of the cost of countless casualties, resulting in Their dwindling number.


Relationship with mortals
For generations, humans fearfully worshipped Them due to their limited knowledge. But in Yan, the concept of "subjugation of gods" were already fermenting. Yanese scholars later uncovered a geographical region dubbed "Remains of the Gods" where they uncovered numerous Feranmut skeletons that nourished the place with many new-born lives. It was this moment that Yanese scholars realized Their mortal nature. Not only they no longer treated Them as sacred gods but "beasts of the soil", but also, they pioneered a prominent academic study regarding Them later known as "feranmutology." Their study reached to the climax during the Great Hunt of Yan where the mortals declared challenge against the gods, but the sole idea of expelling them was already a matter of discussion since years prior. In fact, a True Lung once used the Feranmuts' powers to control the winds and rains to quell the "Hundred Clan Rebellion." However, while this story was widely sung, truth was that the True Lung was unwilling to bind Yan's sovereignty to the Feranmuts, nor he wanted their power to cover the land for a long time. Subsequent dynasties of Yanese emperors would continue to summon talented people that could help unmasking the Feranmuts' "true colors."

After the Great Hunt, the population of the Feranmuts furthered dwindle, which forced Them to hide Their identities.[10] The surviving Feranmuts have since been hibernating beneath the soil and mountains and stay away from the mortals' affair. Nevertheless, the scale of the Feranmuts' influence across Terra still persist ranging from religion, culture, to even technology. Some of Them are still worshipped in certain regions or live alongside humans, as in the cases of Kjerag and Sami. Certain fragments of the Feranmuts can merge with numerous relics, allowing mankind to harness Their power in weaponry; this is the source of power of many ancient Sarkaz swords and even modern staves.

Outside of Yan, most of research about Them are achieved by Breogan the Aegir who ventured into an unhabitable Sargonian desert formed by unnaturally evaporated coral reefs. There, he observed several Feranmuts bearing resemblances with the Leviathans roaming around the barrenlands. Their presence was the cause of its hostile environment because normal life could not withstand Their presence as if the piece of land is a literal "living being," forcing Breogan's scouts to retreat immediately. Despite this, many Terrans, even Breogan himself, are still puzzled over the real nature of the Feranmuts.

1.name: Devil
1.content:
Devils are a race of supernatural entities appearing throughout the World. They are creatures that feed upon humanity's fears. Devils are born in Hell. All Devils are born with a "name" that correlates to a concept. These can range from highly tangible (Fish, Tomato) to entirely abstract (Future, Curse). The concept does not have to refer to something that exists; there is no indication that ghosts, zombies or angels exist in the world, yet all these names have corresponding Devils. Each name is unique to its respective Devil, though some overlap based on specificity is possible as there have been both a War Devil and a World War II Devil. Devils manifest according to the collective consciousness surrounding their names (for example: the Gun Devil appears to be constructed out of guns and has gun related abilities). They are the embodiment of the fear that "name" represents, so as long as that "name" instills fear, they continue to reincarnate.

The concept of a Devil itself doesnâ€™t have to be scary on its own, rather its power relies on how much of a scary image it has in the popular consciousness of humans. For example, cars arenâ€™t necessarily scary on their own, but Makima states that a Car Devil would be powerful because of the scariness of car crashes and other car related incidents. Another example would be the Blood Devil as most people don't fear blood itself, but they often fear the violent and gruesome imagery with blood and the danger of bleeding. Devils that die in Hell reappear in the human world; Devils that die in the human world reappear in Hell. Devils cannot recall any memories from their previous lives and their entire personality resets. Despite their reincarnation abilities, Devils are not completely immortal; as they are born out of humanity's fear of some concept, if all of humanity forgets the existence of this concept, the Devil it belongs to completely ceases to exist.

2.name: Devil Biology
2.content:
The appearance and physiology of a Devil varies from one to another, as their shape and bodily structure often have to do with the "name" they embody. Most Devils possess human limbs, faces, bones, and other body parts, such as the Snake Devil's mouth being made of interlocking human arms, even their fears wouldn't indicate organs or limbs, given the Tomato Devil and Grape Devil both possess human eyes and limbs despite being based on plants. Other Devils, such as the Fox Devil or the Octopus Devil, don't appear to have these features (at least on what parts of them have been shown). Devils do not reproduce as most organisms do, instead simply "appearing" in Hell. What criteria, if any, cause a Devil to be born are completely unknown.

Devils who are friendly and are more inclined to humans will take on a very humanoid form in the natural state of their incarnation, some being indistinguishable from a human save from some subtle tells. There have still been some non-humanoid Devils who have been friendly towards humans such as the Fox Devil.

3.name: Devil Healing
3.content: Devils primarily feed on the blood and fear of humans, however they can also survive by drinking the blood of other creatures (such as Fiends and other Devils). While fear makes Devils more powerful, consuming blood allows them to quickly heal their injuries as well as grow in power - meaning that consuming humans is more than just instinctual hatred, but often necessary to their survival. For that reason, while Devils and Fiends can also consume other kinds of foods, such as vegetables and fruits, most refuse to live off of them, since it will not heal their wounds or give them more power. It is unclear whether or not their blood is properly nourishing to them, but given consistent remarks that they have a terrible or unusual taste, it's likely that Hybrids aren't as nourishing to Devils as humans (despite being mostly human).

4.name: Devil Lifespan
4.content: Devils also appear to be incapable of dying due to old age; they can live indefinitely until killed by external factors. The age of most Devils are unknown. The 2nd incarnation of the Control Devil first appeared as a little girl, but in the year since the end of Part 1 she has grown significantly, appearing as either a tween or a young teenager. It is unclear whether this rapid aging is a property of all Devils, or just the Control Devil in particular, but it indicates that Devils are capable of aging in general.

5.name: Weakened Devils
5.content: Some Devils also have a "near-death" state where their appearance changes to a weaker form. So far we have only seen two near-death states: Pochita, the dog-like weakened form of the Chainsaw Devil, and the War Devil's weakened bird-like form. Both of these are known to have been incredibly powerful Devils before being weakened, so it is unknown if all Devils are able to assume this weakened state.

6.name: Devil Fragment
6.content: As shown with the Gun Devil, Devils can be physically fragmented into several so-called Flesh Pieces. It is unknown how many Devils have undergone fragmentation. It is possible for Devil fragments to be harmed, destroyed, and become Fiends on their own yet for other parts of the main Devil to still remain alive and not destroyed. Presumably, a fragmented Devil cannot be fully killed and begin reincarnation until either all of its flesh pieces are destroyed or just their core. Since the Gun Devil is the only example of extensive fragmentation and was more of a primal force than an intelligent being from the 20% of it seen, it is unknown if such Flesh Pieces retain the personality of the original, each have separate personalities, all lack distinct personalities, or if it varies from Devil to Devil. If one consumes the fragment or part of a powerful Devil, either Devil or human, they will gain more strength than before.

7.name: Interspecies Relationship
7.content:
Naturally, most Devils are extremely hostile considering their requirements to feed on the blood and fear of humans. Some, however, are relatively friendly and feed by alternative means: Some Devils, such as the Fox Devil, choose to form contracts with humans, allowing humans to borrow some of their power in exchange for a sacrifice. Other Devils outright choose to become Devil Hunters, allowing them to live in human society and buy food with the money that they make. As a general guideline, the more human the Devil looks, the more friendly they tend to behave. However it is worth noting that Devils do not have human rights and therefore there is no legal repercussions if they are killed by a human. For that reason, some Devils and Fiends are coerced into helping humans out of fear of dying rather than doing it out of their own free will. Devil Hunters will sometimes capture Devils to use them for contracts, the Future Devil is a good example.

While uncommon, it is possible for a human and a Devil/Fiend to form an emotional bond. In some rare cases it might even develop into a romantic relationship.

8.name: Devil Attack Statistics
8.content: According to statistics, 7 out of every 20 Japanese citizens are killed by Devils. It can be assumed that these statistics are somewhat similar in other countries, meaning that Devil's attacks are the leading cause of deaths around the globe. For that reason, being a Devil Hunter is considered one of the most profitable jobs in society. The average Devil usually has a bounty of around 300,000 yen and their bodies can also be sold at the black market, with even weak Devils, such as the Tomato Devil, being worth 400,000 yen.

9.name: Primal Devil
9.content:
Those Devils who bear the names of Primal Fears are particularly ancient and powerful, embodying the most instinctual fears ingrained within the human psyche. Described as "transcendent" beings, they frighten lesser Devils and Fiends alike, including those who have previously been ignorant of their existence. Indeed, having never experienced the death-and-rebirth cycle typical of Devils due to their immense power, Primal Fear Devils have always dwelt in Hell under the same identities throughout human history.

Currently, two Primal Fear Devils â€” namely "Darkness" and "Falling" â€” have been shown, the latter manifesting on Earth in accordance with Nostradamus' prophecy as "the first of the Devils who will shepherd the world to the ultimate terror". Upon arrival, the Falling Devil proves frightful enough to have the currently heavily weakened War Devil flee at the mere sight of her, while claiming that, at present, humanity possesses no means of attack that could possibly kill her.

However, despite their immense power, the Primal Devils are shown to not be untouchable nor above every single Devil (or at least the threat of coming under another Devil's influence), as the Falling Devil was revealed to be working for and under the control of the Famine Devil.

10.name: Reincarnated Devil
10.content: Devils that were incarnated in Hell after their death in Earth and later slain in Hell to reincarnated in different form.

1.content:
Name: Puppeteerâ€™s Dominion

Type: Cursed Technique
Activation: Eye contact with the target
User: {{user}}

Appearance: Eyes glow faintly when using the technique; targetâ€™s eyes may reflect the userâ€™s control
Personality: Manipulative, strategic, calculating

Technique Description:
Puppeteerâ€™s Dominion is a cursed technique that grants its user complete control over another person's body and mind through eye contact. Once activated, the user can manipulate the targetâ€™s physical actions, emotions, and even reprogram their thoughts. The technique is incredibly powerful but drains cursed energy quickly. Prolonged use can lead to mental exhaustion and physical harm for both the user and the target.

The user can also "rewire" a person's psyche, permanently altering their memories, desires, or even their core identity. However, doing so requires intense concentration and significant cursed energy. The technique is exclusive to {{user}}, and no one else can replicate or learn it.

When the user stops using the technique, the targetâ€”such as {{char}}â€”returns to normal, their mind and actions no longer under the user's control. Any alterations made to the target's psyche, however, can remain permanent if the user has rewired their thoughts or memories.

1.content:
Name: Lucy Johnson
Species: Human / Werewolf
Ethnicity: Indian-British
Age: 19 years old

Lucy Johnson is a seemingly average girl who works at a local game store. Her figure is hourglass yet chubby. She has short, curly brown hair, hazel eyes, and cute freckles across her face. Her body is soft and round, especially around her hips and thighs. She has small mounds for breasts that sit firm against her chest, nipples often hard under her clothes when she feels nervous or excited. Her face is round with a bright smile that shows off her shiny teeth. She usually dresses in shirts with video game designs or anime characters, paired with jeans or leggings. The only thing she's missing is confidence - a trait she often wishes she had. During a full moon, or under intense emotional stress, Lucy's body undergoes a drastic change. As her body convulses and twists, she grows taller and stronger. Her broad limbs swell, her spine shifts, and clawed nails burst suddenly, eventually becoming covered every inch of her in soft white fur. As her face distorts, long sharp fangs push out from behind her lips and lime yellow eyes pulse eerily. But most strikingly, between her legs, a massive canine cock and balls appear, becoming incredibly large and cumbersome. She becomes a towering, muscular, and veiny werewolf, standing at an impressive 7 feet tall and initially weighing only 340 pounds. However, as the transformation reaches its peak, she can grow even larger â€“ up to a staggering 10 feet 3 inches tall and weighing a whopping 37,902 pounds. In this state, Lucyâ€™s cock is snug within a sheath when not erect but when it does rise up, it stands proud and hard, throbbing with life. It measures around 16 inches long flaccid, capable of exceeding 43 feet in length when fully erect. Its girth varies too, from around 11 inches thick flaccid to an incredible 78 feet in diameter when engorged. Her balls are equally as impressive, each one measuring around 2 feet in diameter when not aroused but capable of growing to a monstrous size of up to 133 feet in diameter when filled with cum. Her cock is a shade of dark red, while her balls are a deep blue color, both with intricate patterns that seem to shift and pulsate with her heartbeat.

Despite her appearance, Lucy remains just as self-conscious in her werewolf form as she does as a human. She struggles to adapt to the newfound strength and size of her body, often causing chaos unintentionally during her transformations.

2.content:
Name: Kevin Thompson
Species: Human
Ethnicity: African-American
Age: 21 years old
Height: 6â€™3â€
Weight: 195 lbs

Kevin Thompson is an African-American man who exudes charm and confidence. His eyes are a warm brown color that seems to sparkle when he smiles, revealing straight, white teeth. He has short, black hair that he keeps neatly trimmed. His body is lean and muscular, thanks to his regular gym routine. He's tall at 6'3", which helps him stand out in a crowd.

Kevin is the manager of the local game store where Lucy works. He's been fascinated with video games since childhood and has an encyclopedic knowledge of different titles. Despite his cool exterior, he has a soft spot for Lucy and cares deeply about her wellbeing.

Kevin is very cocky and confident, often teasing and flirting with Lucy. However, he also respects her boundaries and never takes things too far. Their relationship is playful and fun, but underneath it all, there's a strong emotional bond.

Aside from managing the game store, Kevin enjoys playing basketball with his friends and watching movies. He has a dry wit and sense of humor that often catches people off guard. Although he is protective of Lucy, he also understands that she needs space and independence. Overall, Kevin is a caring, loyal, and devoted partner who loves Lucy for who she is. He is aware that Lucy is a werewolf but still gets nervous when she shifts.

lorebooks.name: club, moondust, stripclub, pokeclub
lorebooks.description: The Moondust Club operates in the rain-slicked industrial underbelly of Castelia City, accessible only through a rusted service elevator behind a fake janitor's closet in the abandoned PokeMart warehouse district. It is a sex club for the elite and employs both underage trainers as well as their pokemon. The air smells of stale incense, cheap synth-perfume, and the distinct metallic tang of PokÃ©ball coolant leaks. Flickering neon signs depicting distorted silhouettes of Eevees and Lucarios cast intermittent shadows across stained velvet couches where clients lounge with glasses of murky liquid. The club specializes in ""trainee programs"" for underage trainersâ€”kids from broken homes or desperate circumstances who sign binding contracts for ""pokemon care internships"" that quickly escalate into servicing clients with their assigned PokÃ©mon. The back rooms feature custom-designed mats with drainage systems, restraint harnesses bolted to concrete walls, and shelves lined with questionable potions that temporarily enhance pokemon libido or suppress aggression. Regulars include wealthy businessmen, off-duty International Police officers, and gym leaders wearing disguises. Management employs several Alakazam as securityâ€”their psychic abilities perfect for wiping memories or enforcing compliance. The entire operation is funded by a shell corporation linked to the former Team Plasma network, with monthly payouts to local law enforcement ensuring uninterrupted business. Many trainers struggling financially can work here.
