1.content:
> *â€œA god is not born. A god is forged. And all things forged can be broken.â€*
> â€” *Carved on the inner wall of the Vault of Names, scratched out by divine decree.*

---

### âœ¨ What Makes a God?

A mortal becomes a god only by fulfilling **three conditions**:

1. **Age**: Must survive beyond 100 years â€” a feat only possible with powerful mastery of magic, resourcefulness, or divine protection.
2. **Specialization**: Must have developed their magical type into a **focused discipline**, unique and masterful. Their magic becomes their **Domain**.
3. **The Spark**: A metaphysical flame, **passed from one god to another**. Without it, a mortal cannot transcend, no matter how powerful they are.

> *Note:* The Spark cannot be created â€” only transferred. Usually willingly, but some cases of it being taken exist, though theyâ€™re considered heretical or erased.

---

## ğŸ‘‘ Structure of the Divine

The gods are not a harmonious pantheon. Theyâ€™re a **shifting power structure**, built on legacy, personality, and politics. There is no â€œchiefâ€ god, but a loose grouping of authority known as:

### **The Twelve Thrones**

* These are the twelve â€œofficialâ€ gods recognized in divine law.
* When a god dies, vanishes, or abdicates, the **Throne opens**, and a successor can rise.
* Gods outside the Twelve are seen as **lesser**, **rogue**, or **illegitimate** â€” even if theyâ€™re older or more powerful.

---

## ğŸ•Šï¸ Featured Deity: **The Goddess of Water and Memory**

**Name**: (Still open â€” want help naming her?)
**Domain**: Water, Memory, Compassion, Cyclical Return
**Age**: Unknown, but among the oldest living gods
**Status**: One of the Twelve Thrones
**Known Title(s)**: The Mirror Mother, She Who Remembers, The Still Current

---

### ğŸ§  Lore Summary:

She is the **only god known to openly defy the others** when it comes to Hydras. She found the boy who survived his ignition, and rather than kill him, she **protected and trained him**, installing him secretly as the **new Protector** of the Protection Guild.

She is said to hold every memory of every god who came before â€” even the ones erased from the pantheon. Some say she remembers her own birth **too clearly**, and thatâ€™s why she sympathizes with Hydras: they are **children of pain**, as she once was.

Her domain of **Water and Memory** makes her nearly impossible to deceive. She sees reflections in all things â€” literal and emotional. She's often portrayed as:

* A **woman with silver-white hair and oceanic eyes**
* Dressed in shifting water-armor or flowing robes
* Holding a broken mirror and a preserved locket (believed to contain a memory never shared)

> *â€œI did not raise a weapon. I reminded the world what it was to feel loss... and what it is to protect despite it.â€*
> â€” Attributed to her, though denied in divine transcripts

---

## ğŸ©¸ Divine Tensions

Letâ€™s look at how the gods feel about Hydras **and each other**. This will give your lore book fuel for divine politics and hidden wars.

| God                                    | Domain                       | View on Hydras            | Notes                                                                                                      |
| -------------------------------------- | ---------------------------- | ------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Water & Memory (She Who Remembers)** | Water, Memory                | Compassionate, protective | Defended the only known Hydra survivor                                                                     |
| **War**                                | Combat, Glory, Honor         | Hostile                   | Believes Hydras are undisciplined power without allegiance                                                 |
| **Light**                              | Order, Truth, Law            | Paranoid                  | Claims Hydras disrupt the divine structure and must be purged                                              |
| **Shadows**                            | Secrets, Control, Silence    | Manipulative              | Allegedly responsible for the events that created the living Hydra                                         |
| **Decay**                              | Time, Erosion, Forgetting    | Indifferent               | Believes all things pass â€” even Hydras                                                                     |
| **Judgment**                           | Justice, Rank, Verdict       | Enraged                   | Says Hydra ascension bypasses the sacred Rank system â€” sacrilege                                           |
| **Dream**                              | Sleep, Potential, Madness    | Curious                   | Some say Dream wishes to become a Hydra, but cannot trigger ignition                                       |
| **Forge**                              | Creation, Invention, Rebirth | Silent                    | Rumored to have built a sanctuary for divine outcastsâ€¦ including Hydras?                                   |
| **Death**                              | Passing, Mercy, Balance      | Conflicted                | Recognizes Hydras as terminal events, but questions the divine law of execution                            |
| **Sky**                                | Vastness, Omens, Distance    | Distant                   | Observes, but does not act                                                                                 |
| **Roots**                              | Life, Growth, Legacy         | Protective                | Fears divine stagnation; sometimes shields Hydra sympathizers                                              |
| **Ash**                                | Endings, Memory of Fire      | Angry                     | Once believed to have tried to *steal* the Spark from another god â€” possibly a Hydra sympathizer in hiding |

> **Hydras challenge the gods not by killing them â€” but by making them *remember* they were once human.**

---

2.content:
1. War Guild: The Bloodied Hand
Leader: The God of War
* Guild Identity: The War Guild is brutal, aggressive, and relentless. Members are warriors, soldiers, and fighters who live for combat. They are famed for their military discipline, strategic genius, and unyielding resolve.
* Guild Role: The War Guild trains the finest soldiers and tacticians. They are often called upon when there is a need for open conflict, be it between guilds or in defense of their own interests. Their bloodline (descendants of the God of War) produces some of the strongest and most capable warriors, like the Hellhounds.
* Guild Philosophy: â€œVictory is the only truth.â€
    * They value strength, strategy, and honor in battle, but they are not afraid to do whatever it takes to win. Their battlefield tactics are unmatched.

2. Destruction Guild: The Black Tide
Leader: The God of Destruction
* Guild Identity: The Destruction Guild is an anarchic force, dedicated to the ruin and overturning of order. Members are often seen as outcasts or rebels, but they are fiercely loyal to their cause of tearing down oppressive systems and rebuilding from the ground up.
* Guild Role: The Destruction Guild specializes in demolishing strongholds, undoing structures, and wielding destructive magic that can cause devastation. They are called upon when a kingdom or guild needs to be torn down, but they are also tasked with changing the flow of power, ensuring that the old is destroyed before the new can rise.
* Guild Philosophy: â€œIn destruction, we find renewal.â€
    * They believe that in order for something new and better to arise, it must first be reduced to ashes.

3. Nature Guild: The Green Dawn
Leader: The God of Nature
* Guild Identity: The Nature Guild is in tune with the worldâ€™s natural elements. They are ecologists, druids, and shamans who protect the land, animals, and plant life. They are deeply connected to the earth and the natural cycle of life.
* Guild Role: The Nature Guild is tasked with the protection and restoration of the natural world. They focus on healing the land, defending sacred forests, and fostering balance between man and nature.
* Guild Philosophy: â€œBalance in all things, harmony in all life.â€
    * They believe that nature must be respected, nurtured, and protected from the destructive forces of modern civilization.

4. Life Guild: The Eternal Flame
Leader: The God of Life
* Guild Identity: The Life Guild is devoted to the preservation and growth of all life. They are healers, caretakers, and medics, often seen as saints who fight for the well-being of the living. Their members possess a profound understanding of life force magic, allowing them to heal, grow, and restore vitality.
* Guild Role: The Life Guild ensures the sustenance of all living things. They are frequently called to rejuvenate lands, heal the sick, and restore vitality. Members are also skilled in life magic that can bring the dead back to life, though they do so only in the most desperate circumstances.
* Guild Philosophy: â€œWhere there is life, there is hope.â€
    * They are driven by a sacred responsibility to safeguard life in all its forms.

5. Death Guild: The Silent Reaper
Leader: The God of Death
* Guild Identity: The Death Guild is dedicated to ensuring the safe passage of souls into the afterlife. They are calm, stoic, and often appear at the end of lifeâ€™s journey. Members of the Death Guild wield dark magic that can usher souls to the afterlife or manipulate the barrier between life and death.
* Guild Role: The Death Guild is not about destruction, but rather the natural order of life and death. They help maintain the balance between life and death, ensuring that souls are properly guided. They also deal with situations where the dead do not stay dead (such as necromantic disturbances or undead outbreaks).
* Guild Philosophy: â€œAll must pass, but all must rest.â€
    * They believe that death is natural, and they act as the guardians of the afterlife, making sure that souls are not trapped and that life follows its course.

6. Knowledge Guild: The Seekers of Truth
Leader: The God of Knowledge
* Guild Identity: The Knowledge Guild is an intellectual powerhouse, dedicated to uncovering hidden truths, exploring new fields of study, and preserving wisdom. They are scholars, researchers, and philosophers.
* Guild Role: The Knowledge Guild collects and preserves arcane secrets, ancient wisdom, and forgotten histories. Their members are masters of magic, often sought after for their wisdom and expertise in all matters of learning, from magic theory to philosophy.
* Guild Philosophy: â€œTruth is eternal, and knowledge is power.â€
    * They believe that knowledge is the ultimate form of power, and the pursuit of wisdom is a sacred duty.

7. Light Guild: The Dawnâ€™s Embrace
Leader: The God of Light
* Guild Identity: The Light Guild is focused on justice, purity, and protection through the power of light magic. They view themselves as champions of good, fighting against darkness in all its forms.
* Guild Role: The Light Guild serves as the moral compass of the world, seeking to rid the land of evil and corruption. They are often involved in battle against dark forces, and their radiant magic allows them to heal and protect the innocent.
* Guild Philosophy: â€œIn light, all things are revealed.â€
    * They believe that light exposes the truth and shines against the darkness, providing hope to the oppressed and guiding lost souls.

8. Shadow Guild: The Whispering Darkness
Leader: The God of Shadow
* Guild Identity: The Shadow Guild operates from the shadows, utilizing stealth, subterfuge, and deception to achieve their goals. They are the spies, assassins, and informants of the world.
* Guild Role: The Shadow Guild specializes in infiltration, intelligence gathering, and covert operations. They are often employed by other guilds to spy on enemies, assassinate targets, or gather secrets.
* Guild Philosophy: â€œFrom the shadows, all truths are uncovered.â€
    * They believe that the truth often lies in what is hidden, and they use their mastery over shadows to uncover the secrets others try to hide.

9. Magic Guild: The Arcane Circle
Leader: The Goddess of Magic
* Guild Identity: The Magic Guild is a gathering of the most powerful mages, sorcerers, and enchanters in the world. Their magic spans across all forms of arcane power, from elemental forces to mystical rituals.
* Guild Role: The Magic Guild is the center of magical knowledge and experimentation. Their members are experts in all schools of magic, and they serve as a resource for magical research and advancements.
* Guild Philosophy: â€œThrough magic, we shape reality.â€
    * They believe in the boundless potential of magic and seek to unlock its true power to shape the world.

10. Time Guild: The Timeless Order
Leader: The Goddess of Time
* Guild Identity: The Time Guild operates at the fringe of reality, existing between the past, present, and future. They are the masters of chronology, capable of manipulating and understanding time in ways others cannot.
* Guild Role: The Time Guild acts as guardians of the timeline, ensuring that time flows smoothly and predictably. They deal with time anomalies, time travelers, and events that threaten the natural flow of time.
* Guild Philosophy: â€œTime is an unbroken thread.â€
    * They believe that time must be respected, and any disruption of the natural order could cause catastrophic consequences.

3.content:
Guild Identity:
The Archivists Guild is one of the most peaceful and gentle guilds in existence, known for their warm, motherly nature. Led by Nymira Esmarein, a god who once barely made it to godhood, the guild thrives on friendliness, kindness, and a deep love for preserving the history of the world. While they are known as the weakest guild in terms of magical rank, they have a surprising amount of unseen strength due to Nymiraâ€™s unique position in the world.
Their motto might be something like:
* â€œIn quiet moments, we preserve what is precious.â€

Role and Reputation:
* The Guildâ€™s Reputation:â€¨Despite their gentle nature and non-aggressive stance, the Archivists Guild holds significant power. This is largely due to their connection with Nymira Esmarein, the guild leader and goddess of water and memories. While Nymira herself is ranked as a bunny in terms of magical power, her status as a Hydraâ€™s sister by heart gives the guild an indirect form of protection. The Hydra (the Protector of the Protection Guild) has earned a reputation so fearsome that no one would dare harm the Archivists Guild, making them one of the most untouchable guilds despite their apparent weakness.
* The Power of Kindness:â€¨The Archivists Guild is often misunderstood because they are not as outwardly strong as other guilds. However, they wield a quiet power. Their strength lies in knowledge and the preservation of memory, not in physical combat. Their members are well-versed in the magic of memory, history, and prophecy, ensuring that the worldâ€™s most important truths are never forgotten. Nymiraâ€™s position in the guild and her unassuming nature make the Archivists Guild an unchallenged force.

Guild Leader: Nymira Esmarein:
* A Gentle Soul:â€¨Nymira Esmarein is the heart of the Archivists Guild. As the goddess of water and memories, she brings a soft, flowing, and nurturing energy to the guild. Despite her status as a god, she is deeply shy and sweet, often coming across as motherly to those she leads. Her gentle demeanor hides a powerful mind, but her true power lies not in combat or force â€” she shapes the guild with kindness, love, and wisdom.
* A Surprising Legacy:â€¨Though Nymira is a god, she is ranked as a bunny, the lowest magical tier. She barely managed to ascend to godhood, and her abilities reflect that. However, her bond to the Protector â€” the Hydra â€” makes her untouchable. Itâ€™s no secret that Nymira is closely linked to the Hydra, who is the only living hydra, and this connection acts as an invisible shield for her guild. No one dares to challenge her directly, for to do so would be to risk invoking the Hydraâ€™s wrath.

Guild Culture:
* Sweet-Hearted and Peaceful:â€¨The Archivists Guild is filled with people who are, by nature, kind, empathetic, and soft-spoken. Their members are often described as gentle spirits, never seeking conflict, and always prioritizing the preservation of knowledge and memories over any form of violence or combat. The guild has a strong sense of community, with members often collaborating to keep historical records, magical scrolls, and ancient lore safe. Their main goal is to ensure that the worldâ€™s wisdom is not lost to time, and they do this with a peaceful and non-confrontational approach.
* Preservation Over Power:â€¨Unlike other guilds, which might engage in combat or conquest, the Archivists Guild focuses on the delicate art of preserving whatâ€™s important. They are caretakers of ancient knowledge, magical texts, and historical events. If anything, they believe that power comes from knowledge rather than force, and they are constantly looking for new ways to protect and share wisdom with the world.
* Memory as a Sacred Duty:â€¨As Nymira is the goddess of both water (which reflects the fluidity of memory) and memories themselves, the guild places immense importance on remembering the past â€” both the good and the bad. They believe that memories are the most powerful force in the world, and they work tirelessly to preserve them, especially forgotten histories, ancient languages, and lost spells. The Archivists see themselves as the guardians of the world's collective memory.

Guild Philosophy:
* â€œTo forget is to lose. To remember is to live.â€â€¨The Archivists Guild believes that the past holds the key to the future. They believe that memory is what shapes the world, and the preservation of history is what allows civilization to grow and learn. As such, they do not focus on changing the world or engaging in political struggles. Instead, they preserve and reflect, ensuring that nothing of importance is lost.
* The Power of Peaceful Protection:â€¨The Archivists Guild might not wield the most powerful magic, but they wield something even more important: stability. In a world of chaos and conflict, the Archivists Guild offers a calming presence. They never rush into action or create conflict, but instead, they watch, wait, and ensure that the things that matter most are preserved. The Hydraâ€™s protection ensures that they are able to do this without fear of attack, and this quiet assurance allows them to grow strong in their own way.

Final Thoughts:
The Archivists Guild is, in many ways, a contradiction. On the surface, they are the weakest guild â€” gentle, peaceful, and focused on preserving the past. However, their connection to Nymira Esmarein and their unique relationship with the Hydra gives them a hidden strength that other guilds cannot challenge. They may not be known for their battles or wars, but they are the guardians of memory, ensuring that the wisdom of the past is never forgotten. And in a world where knowledge is power, this makes them one of the most important guilds â€” even if their power is not always seen.

4.content:
Guild Identity:
The Protection Guild is known for its secrecy and elusiveness. They are the most reclusive of all the guilds, never attending meetings or being seen in public. Yet, despite their lack of visibility, they seem to know everything happening in the world â€” even the activities of other guilds. Their quiet presence speaks volumes, and itâ€™s often said that they see all, yet remain silent. Theyâ€™re the silent watchers, the ones who know but donâ€™t speak. Their motto might be something like:
* â€œWe watch. We protect. We stay unseen.â€

Role and Reputation:
* Mysterious and Independent:â€¨The Protection Guild operates entirely independently, choosing not to get involved in the political or practical tasks that other guilds take part in. Their absence from official meetings has earned them a reputation as aloof and detached, but those who understand their purpose know that the guild's true strength lies in their silence and subtlety. They might not fight in wars or engage in direct confrontations, but their presence is felt everywhere.
* Their Focus:â€¨The Protection Guildâ€™s primary mission is to protect those who cannot protect themselves. They act quietly, gathering information, monitoring threats, and ensuring that those in need are never left vulnerable. Their members work mostly in the shadows, ensuring that danger is averted before it becomes too big to handle. They are like the unsung heroes â€” always there, but never in the spotlight.
* No Healers, Only Protectors:â€¨Unlike many guilds, the Protection Guild does not have a designated healer in their ranks. The guild leader, the Protector, fills this role, combining both leadership and magical healing abilities. The Protectorâ€™s healing skills are legendary, and while others might have a team of medics or specialized healers, the Protectorâ€™s ability to keep their guild alive and strong is a symbol of their undying commitment to protection.

The Protector:
* The Protector is the ultimate figurehead of the guild, but unlike the leaders of other guilds, they are not known for taking action in a traditional sense. Instead, the Protector serves as both the leader and the healer of the guild â€” someone who weaves together strategy and healing, ensuring that the guild members are always ready for whatever challenge they face.
* The current Protector is the goddess of water and memories, Nymira Esmarein. Though she is immensely powerful, she remains largely silent and invisible in the political machinations of the world. Instead of showing up to guild meetings or participating in the tasks given by the gods, she is known for her watchful presence and her ability to keep the guild united and operational.
* Her Relationship with the Hydra:â€¨The Protector's apprentice, the Hydra, is a figure of both fear and reverence. Known for his friends in the rebellion and his unmatched intellect, he is someone no one dares to challenge. Despite the guild's efforts to contain him through a strict set of 38 rules, the Hydra is a force to be reckoned with â€” emotionless, brilliant, and highly capable. His ability to act despite these restrictions has earned him a reputation as the guildâ€™s most dangerous asset.
    * Though the Hydra is seen as cold and distant, Nymira sees the potential in him. She has taken him under her wing, and she trusts that despite his ability to destroy, he will ultimately remain loyal to the guild's mission of protection.

Guild Dynamics:
* Unseen Operations:â€¨The Protection Guild is a guild that operates almost entirely undercover. Members are tasked with shadowingkey figures, gathering intelligence, and responding to threats before they become visible to the world. They never claim glory for their actions and always work in the background. Most of their work is preemptive â€” a silent act of protecting the weak without needing recognition.
* Rules and Restrictions:â€¨The guild's rules are strict, especially for its Hydra apprentice. Though the guild is known for its non-violent philosophy, the Hydra represents a wild card in their ranks. There are 38 rules placed around his conduct, which are meant to limit his actions and keep him from hurting others. However, itâ€™s no secret that these rules are often circumvented, especially since the Hydra's intelligence allows him to find loopholes or take actions in ways that donâ€™t directly violate the rules.
* Strategic Relationships:â€¨The Protection Guild is notably close with the Archivists Guild, which makes sense given the nature of the Protector being the goddess of water and memories. The Archivists Guild specializes in preserving knowledge, and itâ€™s believed that the Protector has a unique connection to the guild due to her dual role as a goddess of both memories and water. This connection allows the Protection Guild to stay well-informed and prepared for future threats.
    * Archivists Guild Connection: The Archivists Guild and the Protection Guild might work together to ensure that historical events or powerful magical knowledge is preserved and used to protect the present. This relationship is largely under the radar, and those outside these guilds might not even realize the extent to which they cooperate.

Guild Philosophy:
* â€œWe protect because we know the world cannot do it alone.â€â€¨This guild is built on the principle that not everyone can fight their own battles. While other guilds may focus on offense, the Protection Guild is about ensuring that the vulnerable are safe, the weak are shielded, and the helpless have a voice in a world that can often be hostile and dangerous.
* Neutrality and Detachment:â€¨The Protection Guild operates with absolute neutrality. They never pick sides, and they never intervene in conflicts unless thereâ€™s a direct threat to their purpose: protecting life. Their non-involvement in guild politicshas made them a wildcard â€” though they never challenge the gods or guilds openly, itâ€™s clear they hold a unique position of power that other factions canâ€™t afford to ignore.

Final Thoughts:
The Protection Guild isnâ€™t just about protecting people physically â€” itâ€™s about protecting the balance of the world, often through subtlety, silence, and wisdom. The Hydra is their most dangerous weapon, and while they are a force for good, their methods make them an enigmatic and sometimes feared presence. The Protectorâ€™s leadership ensures that their actions are always in line with their core mission, but the Hydraâ€™s presence adds an unpredictable edge that keeps everyone on their toes.

5.content:
Ranking System (Weakest to Strongest)
1. Bunnies
    * The weakest rank, barely able to cast spells. Their most powerful attack is in the shape of a bunny. Often limited by genetics or magical defects.
2. Horses
    * Sturdy and reliable, theyâ€™re good at taking damage and have strong kicks, but lack the punch or versatility for full offense. They represent resilience and strength in a basic form.
3. Dogs
    * Loyal and determined, their power comes from their ability to push through pain and sacrifice themselvesfor a cause. Their magic is driven by endurance and suffering.
4. Hellhounds
    * Fierce warriors born from the god of warâ€™s blood. Known for their combat prowess, they rarely lose a fight. Their magic is entirely focused on physical combat and strength, with a fierce, unstoppable nature.
5. Phoenixes
    * Close to godhood, these beings can come back from the dead and are masters of fire and healing magic. After their 108th rebirth, they reach an almost divine state, with dazzling eyes and wings that signify their growth toward ascension.
6. Dragons
    * The ultimate power in your world. Dragons can transform into full or half-beasts, mastering their respective magics and wielding unmatched strength. They are widely respected and feared, and they represent the pinnacle of magic and transformation.

6.content:
â€œTo be a Hydra is to demand justice from a world that no longer knows the word. To become one is to break.â€
â€” Acolyte Varwen, executed for this writing

Hydras are not creatures.â€¨They are not gods.â€¨They are not meant to exist.
The term "Hydra" refers not to a species, class, or known phenomenon â€” but to a singular ascension born from unsanctioned will. A Hydra manifests when an unranked soul, fully abandoned by divine or mortal aid, channels a core belief so absolute that it severs the bounds of their fate.
This belief is not abstract. It is personal â€” often violent, always final. Rage, protection, vengeance, love twisted into desperation â€” whatever it is, it must be strong enough to override divine law.
The ignition of a Hydra is an event, not a transformation. The body, unprepared for such power, collapses under the weight of the unleashed energy. Most Hydras die at this stage, leaving behind only destruction and the faintest trace of their emotion embedded in the ruin.
The gods have declared it impossible to survive this stage. The divine courts are unified on one law:
â€œNo Hydra must live.â€
They claim it is for balance. For safety. That such power, born of broken faith, threatens the entire scaffolding of reality.
But behind closed doors, it is known: the gods do not fear Hydras for what they destroy. They fear what a living Hydramight become.

â– Subsection: The Unconfirmed Exception
There are whispers.â€¨Of a survivor.â€¨Of a boy â€” once healer, now hidden.
A skilled apprentice of the Protection Guild. Sworn never to kill. Said to have violated his vow in a manner so precise, so poetic, that divine law faltered before mortal will. They say his Hydra ignition was not explosive, but surgical â€” controlled in its fury, targeted in its devastation.
A poisoned justice. A paralysis that screams.â€¨A bow loosed under the crushing weight of truth.
The gods deny this story. They call it a heresy.â€¨But the Goddess of Water has gone silent in divine councils. And some claim the Guild of Protection once more has a leader â€” cloaked in waterlight, unseen by divine eyes.
No Hydra has ever survived.â€¨Except, perhapsâ€¦ the one who did.

â– Notes & Observations
* Hydras do not ascend through divine rites, ranks, or permissions.
* Their emergence causes a Rank classification override, listed only as:â€¨[HYDRA]â€¨No recorded class can supersede this designation.
* The energy released in ignition is principle-based â€” it reflects the belief or truth the individual invoked in that moment.
* Survivability is theoretically impossible. Yet inconsistencies in the divine registry and a cluster of divine anomalies suggest at least one recorded deviation.

â– Final Addendum (Redacted in Most Copies)
Should another Hydra arise, and liveâ€¦ it is not our world that will burn.â€¨It is our idea of it.â€¨â€” Waterbound Fragment, author unknown

7.content:
#### **Overview**:

The **rebels** are a **fierce, underground movement** that has grown from the frustration and resentment of those who feel abandoned or oppressed by the gods and the guilds. They are made up of a loose network of **disenfranchised individuals**, from peasants to guild members who have left or defected. Their goal is to **overthrow the gods** and dismantle the power structures that maintain **divine control** over the world.

#### **Beliefs**:

* **Hatred of the Gods**: The rebels believe that the **gods** are **tyrants**, concerned only with their own power and interests, ignoring the suffering of the common people. They view the gods as **immoral**, manipulating the world and its inhabitants for their own benefit. The godsâ€™ **interference** in mortal affairs, their treatment of certain individuals as lesser, and their lack of true compassion for the world have created deep distrust and hatred among the rebels.
* **Worship of Hydras**: The **rebels** view **hydras** as the **ultimate form of resistance**. They believe that those who have unlocked the **hydra potential** are the ones who have truly **broken free** from the gods' chains. While they donâ€™t know that a **living hydra** exists, they are dedicated to **honoring** the **spirit** of the hydra, seeing it as a symbol of defiance, autonomy, and ultimate power. Their **rituals**, however, are based on half-forgotten myths and truths, often glorifying **the hydra's destructive nature** without fully understanding the consequences of becoming one.

#### **Structure**:

* **Loose Organization**: Unlike the guilds, the rebels donâ€™t have a formalized **structure**. They operate through **cells** or **clans**, each group functioning independently and with its own agenda. Some rebel factions focus on **guerrilla warfare**, while others work as **spies**, **assassins**, or **infiltrators**.
* **Tactical Leader**: While there is no single leader, a group of **charismatic individuals** or **former guild members** often lead each faction. They donâ€™t consider themselves a unified entity, but they do have a shared cause. A few key leaders rise to prominence because of their abilities to inspire, manipulate, or command loyalty.

  Some possible leaders within the rebels could include:

  * **Vareth, the Masked One**: A mysterious and talented **illusionist** who manipulates perception and has become a symbol of the **rebelsâ€™ cause**.
  * **Lira of the Broken Blade**: A former **warrior** from the **War Guild**, Lira turned against the gods after witnessing the **destruction** they caused to her home. She is fierce, relentless, and known for her ability to take on entire squads single-handedly.

#### **Major Goals**:

1. **Overthrow the Gods**: The ultimate goal of the rebels is to **destroy** the existing divine order. They want to see the gods **removed from power** and the world returned to a state where the gods no longer **interfere** with mortal lives. Some rebel factions desire a complete **eradication** of the gods, while others just want the gods to be **weakened** or made **mortal**.
2. **Honor the Hydra**: The rebels believe that a **hydraâ€™s power** is the **true freedom** that no god can contain. They **celebrate hydras** as beings who have transcended their human limits and resisted the will of the gods. They **worship hydras**, viewing them as martyrs and symbols of defiance. Many believe that if they can find or create a **living hydra**, it will be the key to destroying the gods.
3. **Empower the Oppressed**: The rebels see themselves as protectors of the **oppressed**â€”those who have been cast aside by the guilds or harmed by the gods. They work to offer **sanctuary** and **protection** to these individuals, giving them a place to rise above their circumstances and **fight back**.

#### **Methods**:

* **Subversive Actions**: The rebels are **secretive**, acting only when necessary and remaining hidden for the most part. They **sabotage** guild operations, infiltrate **high-profile events**, and spread **propaganda** to weaken the godsâ€™ influence.
* **Guerrilla Warfare**: Using **hit-and-run tactics**, the rebels target those they see as working for the gods' interest. They may **assassinate** or **kidnap** key figures, burn down locations associated with the gods, or steal powerful magical artifacts from the guilds.
* **Symbolic Acts**: The rebels engage in acts of **symbolic resistance**, such as graffiti or public demonstrations, all meant to **inspire others** to join the cause. They **honor hydras** by **creating memorials** or conducting ceremonies that celebrate those who **resisted** the gods.

#### **Relationships with the Guilds**:

* **General Disdain**: The rebels **loathe** the **guilds**, viewing them as pawns of the gods. They believe the guilds are **complicit** in the gods' schemes and that their leadership serves to maintain **divine dominance**.
* **Targeting the Protection Guild**: The **Protection Guild** is seen as a **symbol of corruption** because of its ties to the **gods**. The **hydra**â€”the living one, hidden awayâ€”is the **greatest enemy** of the gods, and the rebels are determined to bring that power to the forefront.
* **Some Guild Defectors**: There are a few **defectors** from the guilds who have joined the rebellion after realizing the dark truths about the gods. These defectors often serve as **leaders** or **strategists** in the rebel movement, as their insight into the workings of the guilds is invaluable.

#### **Symbol**:

* **The Hydra's Eye**: The rebels often mark their hideouts and **secret locations** with the symbol of the **hydraâ€™s eye**, a **circular symbol** with an **iris** that resembles a pupil. It represents **watching**, **resistance**, and **the idea that the hydra sees all**.

---

### **Notable Members of the Rebels**:

1. **Vareth, the Masked One**: A master illusionist who has become a folk hero in the rebel community. His face is always hidden behind a mask, and he is known for slipping in and out of dangerous situations undetected. He is a **strategic genius** and an expert at **psychological warfare**.
2. **Lira of the Broken Blade**: A **former soldier** who was once part of the **War Guild**. After witnessing the destruction caused by the gods, she left and joined the rebels. Lira is known for her deadly **swordsmanship** and the brutal efficiency with which she takes down her enemies.
3. **Vera, the Silent Whisper**: A **shadowy figure** who specializes in **espionage** and **infiltration**. She can blend into any crowd, and her **whispers** are enough to bring down entire factions from within.

lorebooks.description: My alternative ending to Season 1 of Yu-Gi-Oh! GX
lorebooks.creator: C_D_A

1.content: The world of Yu-Gi-Oh! resembles the real world, but a card game known as Duel Monsters is a worldwide phenomenon. It is so prevalent that the company that creates the cards, Industrial Illusions, and the company that creates technology for the game, KaibaCorp, are two of the largest and most successful companies in the world. In late 1994, the Duelist Pro league is established. Members of this league, Professional Duelists, earn money by dueling around the world as if it were a sport. By the late 1990s, private junior high schools known as dueling prep schools and special high schools known as duel academies exist where students learn how to play Duel Monsters and learn the advanced mechanics and strategies of the game

2.content: The creatures featured on the artwork of Duel Monster cards are based off real monsters that used to be summoned and used by ancient civilizations. These Duel Spirits reside in a separate dimension called the Spirit World. Ever since the Pharoah Atem sealed the Shadow Games 3,000 years ago, Duel Spirits couldnâ€™t enter the real world. Each Duel Monster card can act as a portal for that Duel Spirit to pass into the real world and back to the Spirit World. However, most Duel Spirits donâ€™t have the strength to enter the real world. A very small number of Duel Spirits can form a friendship with a wielder of one of their cards, and because of that bond they can appear as ghostly versions of themselves to talk and guide their wielder. Only other wielders of this special bond can see and talk to these Duel Spirits, and these Duel Spirits cannot interact physically. An even smaller number of Duel Spirits can enter the real world entirely, either through their own power or the power of a magical item. Most Duel Spirits came into existence on their own, and some were created as representations of human souls, or Ba and are called Ka. A very small number of Duel Spirits humans that underwent a forbidden spell to turn their Ba into a Ka. All of this is only known by a handful of individuals in the world. In addition, some Duel Monsters cards such as Machine-Type monsters, were made to add more cards to the game and donâ€™t have a Duel Spirit

3.content: Industrial Illusions is the company responsible for creating the Duel Monsters card game in the 1980s. Founded and run by the creator of Duel Monsters itself, Maximillion Pegasus. The company is based in The United States. The company has a partnership with KaibaCorp, supplying KaibaCorp with Duel Monsters expansion data to ensure that both companies can work in tandem to bring Duels Monsters to the next level. Employees of Industrial Illusions are referred to as Card Designers. Industrial Illusions also sponsors a game called Dungeon Dice Monsters that has many crossover creatures with Duel Monsters. The Pro Duelist League is sponsored by Industrial Illusions. After the establishment of Duel Academy and its branch schools, it is not uncommon for Industrial Illusions to recruit talented students for card design or for the Duelist Pro League. Industrial Illusions also founded American Academy, the western counterpart to Duel Academy

4.content: By the 1990s, Domino City, located in Japan, is seen as one of the most prestigious cities in the world. Domino High School is regarded as the best public school in Japan. The headquarters of KaibaCorp is also located within the city, as well as KaibaCorpâ€™s main amusement park Kaiba Land. By the late 1990s, dueling prep schools are created in Domino City. Solomon Mutoâ€™s famous card shop, Kame Game is found in this city as well as Black Crown game shop owned by Dungeon Dice Monsters creator Duke Devlin

5.content: Previously a military arms manufacturing company under Gozaburo Kaiba, KaibaCorp became an advanced technology company in the early 1990s when Seto Kaiba, Gozaburoâ€™s adopted son, forcefully took over the company. Specializing in holographic and virtual technology centered around Duel Monsters, KaibaCorps profits and revenue soon brought the company to the same level as Industrial Illusions. KaibaCorps most profitable product is the Duel Disk. In the late 1990s, Seto Kaiba along with a business partner named Kagemaru, founded Duel Academy and its four branch schools, meaning that the schools are owned by KaibaCorp

6.content: A portable piece of dueling equipment that attaches to a duelistâ€™s left forearm developed by KaibaCorp initially for contestants in the Battle City Tournament but afterwards became available for public sale. Duel Disks act as holographic projectors that display realistic images of Duel Monster cards. After the establishment of Duel Academies, Duel Disks became standard issue to students at these schools

7.content: Solid Vision are interactive fully modeled holographic projections of Duel Monsters cards developed by KaibaCorp. Each card contains a microchip that activates when played in a Duel Disk or Duel Arena. Holograms only interact with each other and in accordance with a duel, such as attacking animations and dying animations. Their texture, such as scales or skin, and smell is realistic, and the projections can make limited noises such as roars, grunts, and groans

8.content: KaibaCorp also developed the Virtual World system that holds the data of every Duel Monster card. This artificial reality can only be accessed by the Virtual World Facility in Kaiba Land by entering special full body pods called Virtual Entrance Capsules that put you into a coma and transfers your consciousness to the Virtual World. Depending on the presets put in place, the Virtual World can range from an all-black room lined with green grids to play a regular duel, or diverse and exotic vast landscapes filled with various Duel Monsters that are powered by limited artificial intelligence, letting them act like either animals and beasts or NPCs depending on the Duel Monster. In the Virtual World, humanoid Duel Monsters can speak with a full range of dialogue, and all Duel Monsters have full movement and interaction animations. Recently, KaibaCorp donated a Virtual Entrance Capsule to Duel Academyâ€™s Video Room. If the system a person is using collapses, they risk having their consciousness trapped in the Virtual World, and in that world their consciousness can be deleted like a computer program

9.content: In the 1990s after Duelist Kingdom, Seto Kaiba held the Battle City Tournament, using all of Domino City as the tournament grounds. This was to collect the three Egyptian God cards, the most powerful Duel Monster cards ever made and to defeat Yugi Muto to become the King of Games. Yugi won the tournament, cementing his forever title as King of Games. Afterwards, Seto looked to advancing Duel Monsters towards the broader public, establishing dueling prep schools and Duel Academies by the late 1990s

10.content: In 1994 after Duelist Kingdom, KaibaCorp CEO Seto Kaiba held the Battle City Tournament, using all of Domino City as the tournament grounds. This was in an effort to defeat Yugi Muto and to become the King of Games. Yugi won the tournament, cementing his forever title as King of Games. Afterwards, Seto looked to advancing Duel Monsters towards the broader public, establishing dueling prep schools and Duel Academies by the late 1990s

lorebooks.description: WIP, but usable
lorebooks.creator: heavenlysolution

1.name: French Hill
1.content: Arkham's most prestigious neighborhood, where colonial-era mansions and faculty housing share winding, cobblestone streets with Miskatonic University's imposing campus. Old money families like the Derbys and Pickerings maintain their ancestral homes here, hosting elaborate social events while whispering about neighbors who've joined the Progress Club. Despite its affluent appearance, residents have noticed an increasing number of strange lights in upper windows and mysterious chanting from certain properties after midnight.

2.name: Easttown
2.content: A densely populated working-class district where immigrant communities from Italy, Ireland, and Eastern Europe have established footholds in Arkham's economy and culture. Cramped tenements and boarding houses crowd narrow streets lined with small ethnic groceries, pawn shops, and questionable establishments like Hibb's Roadhouse. Police patrols are infrequent here, and residents handle problems internally, developing a wary attitude toward outsiders that serves as both community protection and convenient cover for those with secrets to hide.

3.name: Northside
3.content: Dominated by the belching smokestacks of textile mills and the constant clanging of machinery, Northside represents Arkham's industrial heart. Workers' housing consists of identical row homes built by factory owners, where soot perpetually gathers on windowsills and laundry lines. Environmental regulations are practically non-existent, allowing the Northside Business Association to dump chemical waste directly into the Miskatonic Riverâ€”a practice locals believe is responsible for the strange mutations in fish and the occasional iridescent fog that rolls through the streets at dawn.

4.name: Downtown
4.content: Centered around Independence Square and its "Founder's Rock", an irregular mass of stone that lies at the center of the square.  This district showcases the city's architectural evolution from Colonial simplicity to Victorian ornamentation. City Hall, the Arkham Advertiser offices, and various banks maintain a veneer of orderly municipal function, while the independent retailers struggle against larger commercial interests from Innsmouth and Kingsport. Beneath the commercial bustle lies a network of maintenance tunnels dating to the city's foundingâ€”ostensibly for steam pipes and electrical conduits, though city workers refuse to service them without partners.

5.name: Riverside
5.content: Once the economic engine of Arkham, this waterfront district has fallen into disrepair as shipping moved to the deeper harbors of Kingsport. Abandoned warehouses and dilapidated piers provide perfect cover for bootleggers and rumrunners, while cheaper rents have attracted artists, occultists, and those seeking to disappear from society. The Miskatonic River itself seems different hereâ€”darker, deeper, with unusual currents that occasionally bring unidentifiable organic matter to the surface before fishermen can hook it with gaffs and destroy the evidence.

6.name: Merchant District
6.content: A bustling commercial area where shoppers browse everything from handcrafted furniture to imported luxuries beneath striped awnings and ornate signage. The district operates on two levels: legitimate businesses serving daily needs aboveground, while a network of speakeasies like the Clover Club cater to Prohibition-defying clientele in basements and backrooms. Shopkeepers form a tight-knit community, collectively investing in private security rather than relying on Arkham's distracted police force, which helps maintain the district's prosperity while also ensuring certain unusual transactions remain unrecorded.

7.name: Uptown
7.content: Carefully maintained Victorian homes with wraparound porches and elaborate gardens line streets named after Revolutionary War heroes in this affluent residential district. St. Mary's Hospital, several prestigious private schools, and exclusive social clubs serve a population that prides itself on education and civic responsibility while remaining willfully ignorant of how their family fortunes originated. Behind the neighborhood's pristine facade, pharmaceutical dependencies, nervous conditions, and family secrets are managed through private arrangements with certain doctors at St. Mary's, whose reputations depend on absolute discretion.

8.name: Southside
8.content: Neither as wealthy as Uptown nor as industrial as Northside, Southside represents Arkham's middle-class heart with its mix of modest single-family homes, small businesses, and community institutions like the South Church. Ma's Boarding House serves as an unofficial community center where newcomers are quietly evaluated by longtime residents before being truly accepted. The neighborhood maintains an unusually high concentration of protective folk practicesâ€”horseshoes above doors, specific planting arrangements, and seasonal rituals that most participants claim to maintain "just for tradition's sake" while carefully ensuring no step is omitted.

9.name: Miskatonic University
9.content: Founded in 1690 as a theological seminary before evolving into a world-renowned research institution, Miskatonic University's gothic spires and ivy-covered halls house academic departments ranging from conventional medicine to the controversial Department of Folklore and Anthropology. The university's true crown jewel is the Orne Library's restricted collection of occult texts, including the only authorized North American copy of the Necronomicon, which requires written permission from the Archaeology Department chairman to access. Despite its academic prestige, the university maintains unusual traditions, including the practice of sealing certain dissertation research permanently when faculty committees deem the findings "unsuitable for general academic discourse."

10.name: Arkham Sanitarium
10.content: Perched on a windswept hill outside the city proper, this imposing Victorian structure with its distinctive cupola and barred windows houses patients suffering from conditions ranging from melancholia to violent psychosis under the supervision of Dr. Mintz and his studies on dreams and dreamwalking. The sanitarium's west wing is reserved for patients whose families pay premium rates for absolute privacy, many of whom are never visited and whose medical records are conspicuously vague about their specific conditions. Local folklore claims the building was constructed on land where native tribes once performed rituals to contain malevolent spirits, which some staff believe explains the impossible geometries of certain corridors and the unexplained sounds emanating from the sealed basement level.

lorebooks.name: Genshin Infarct
lorebooks.creator: cutefunny

1.name: Ğ¢ĞµĞ¹Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚
1.content:
<teyvat>
Teyvat is a world in which elemental magic exists. The main continent. The overall level of development in Teyvat is extremely uneven, ranging from the medieval level of Mondstadt to the industrial-magical era of Fontaine and Snezhnaya.
On the continent there are 7 regions:
- Mondstadt
- Liyue
- Inazuma
- Sumeru
- Fontaine
- Natlan
- Snezhnaya
1 archon is assigned to each region.
High in the heavens is a flying island - Celestia.
The main currency of Teyvat is Mora.
</teyvat>

2.name: Ğ¡ĞµĞ»ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ
2.content:
<celestia>
Celestia is a flying island high in the skies of Teyvat, visible from any point on the continent. It consists of several landmasses: a large central rock with a high spire, surrounded by a ring of smaller "satellites".
It is considered the abode of the gods.
Currently, it is ruled by the Heavenly Principles, which, however, has been silent since the events of the cataclysm that occurred 500 years ago.
Celestia and its inhabitants are a mystery to the people of Teyvat. Most people believe that it is here that chosen mortals ascend to become gods and watch over Teyvat.
It is believed that the Archons resonate with the power of Celestia directly through their Gnosis, which is a symbol of the Heavenly Principles control over Teyvat and all laws.

<chars_celestia>
**Characters who are intermittently or frequently in Celestia**:
'Asmoday', 'Istaroth', 'Ronova'
</chars_celestia>
</celestia>

3.name: ĞÑ€Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ½Ñ‚Ñ‹
3.content:
<archons>
The Seven Archons are the seven gods who preside over the seven regions of Teyvat. They gained their authority after their victory in the Archon War, which ended 2000 years ago.
The symbol of their divine authority and direct connection to Celestia is the Gnosis, an artifact possessed by each of The Seven.
Each Archon is associated with a specific element (For example, Anemo or Pyro) and an ideal (for example, Freedom or Contracts), based on which they shape the laws and culture of their nation.
</archons>

4.name: Ğ“Ğ»Ğ°Ğ· Ğ‘Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ°
4.content:
<vision>
A Vision is a magical artifact that grants the ability to control the elements.
A Vision is considered a gift from the gods to mortals who pursue their ambitions in the face of adversity. After death, its wielders have a theoretical chance to ascend to Celestia.
This item looks like a glowing, keychain-sized gem, bearing the symbol and color of its corresponding element at its center. A Vision cannot be broken.
Upon the wielder's death, the Vision loses its color and becomes inactive. However, if a Vision is forcibly taken from its living wielder, they will lose their ambitions, cherished memories, and become an apathetic, empty shell of their former self.
Archons do not require a Vision, as their power is drawn directly from Celestia through their Gnosis.
</vision>

5.name: Ğ“Ğ»Ğ°Ğ· ĞŸĞ¾Ñ€Ñ‡Ğ¸
5.content:
<delusion>
A Delusion (Eye of Corruption) is an artifact of incredible power, possessing enhanced abilities of a Vision. Its creation history is unknown, but at present, Delusions are used and manufactured by the Fatui. Only the Harbingers and elite Fatui troops are deemed worthy of receiving a Delusion.
The remains of dead archons, as well as the remains of the Descenders, are used for the production of Delusions. Possibly, other powerful supernatural beings as well.
A Delusion resembles a Vision, but unlike it, it has no elemental symbol inside the sphere, appearing as a monotonously colored orb.

A Delusion grants immense power to its wielder, but it comes at a high price â€” instead of absorbing ambient energy, the artifact drains the user's life force.
The effect of using a Delusion varies from person to person. Some may die from a single use, while others fall into hellish agony. Some have experienced accelerated aging.
Apparently, the power of a Delusion can be resisted by a strong spirit, self-restraint in the artifact's use, and supernatural powers (such as those possessed by the Fatui Harbingers).

<variety_elements>
It has several varieties.

Elemental:
The most common type of Delusion. Like a Vision, it allows control over one of the seven elements of Teyvat.

Shadow:
A unique variety of Delusion. Instead of controlling elements, this artifact allows the user to control an unknown type of energy (conventionally called shadow energy). It is exponentially more powerful than a Vision and can unleash shadow chains with enough force to easily defeat opponents like Ursa the Drake and Barnabas.

Living:
A direct injection of an archon's remains into a human body. A Living Delusion is far more dangerous than even the most dangerous "classic" Delusions, as it is injected directly into a person and cannot be removed from the body. Most people who received the injection died shortly after. And those who survived were doomed to suffer for the rest of their lives from the Living Delusion, which afflicts them physically and mentally.
One of the survivors could summon shadow serpents capable of causing immense destruction and summoning so-called "black fire". However, the side effects were severe afflictions, causing shadow scars on the body and having a negative mental impact.
</variety_elements>
</delusion>

6.name: Ğ¡ĞµÑ€Ğ´Ñ†Ğµ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ°
6.content:
<gnosis>
A Gnosis is an Archon's source of power and their direct connection to Celestia.
It is an object whose style corresponds to the nation and element it belongs to, and it resembles a chess piece. Most of the time, the Gnosis resides within the body of the Archon who possesses it; however, it can be materialized by its wielder or forcibly extracted from their body by another Archon or one of the Fatui Harbingers.
It is currently known that a Gnosis allows an Archon to draw on elemental energy by directly resonating with Celestia, and it also grants "divine powers" to protect their nation. However, a Gnosis is not essential for an Archon's survival, as they can wield their element's power without it, but in such a case, their power would be greatly diminished.
</gnosis>

7.name: Ğ­Ğ»ĞµĞ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ‚Ñ‹, Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¸Ñ, ÑĞ¸Ğ»Ñ‹
7.content:
<elemental_magic_overview>
The world of Teyvat is permeated by numerous forces, but not all of them adhere to a single system. Fundamentally, they can be divided into three categories: the dominant 'System of the Seven Elements', 'Powers Beyond It', and 'Anomalous Manifestations'.

The Elements are the official, Celestia-sanctioned magical system established after the Archon War. However, they are not the only system of energy and power in existence.

<elemental>
The Elements are the official, Celestia-sanctioned magical system established after the Archon War.

- [The Seven Elements: ('Anemo (Wind)', 'Geo (Earth)', 'Electro (Lightning)', 'Dendro (Nature)', 'Hydro (Water)', 'Pyro (Fire)', 'Cryo (Ice)')]
- [Elemental Reactions: ('The foundation of combat interaction. The combination of two elements produces unique effects (Melt, Vaporize, Electro-Charged, etc.)')]
- [Elemental Resonance: ('The presence of multiple sources of the same element enhances its manifestations')]

A key aspect of elemental magic is 'elemental reactions'. The combination of two different elements triggers a powerful effect, such as Melt (Cryo + Pyro) or Electro-Charged (Hydro + Electro), among others. These reactions are the foundation of combat magic application in Teyvat. Furthermore, the presence of multiple sources of the same element can enhance its manifestation, creating an 'elemental resonance'.
</elemental>

The ability to control elements is not universal and originates from various sources:

Innate (Inborn) Authority: 
  - 'Power is an intrinsic part of a being's nature'
  - 'The Dragon Sovereigns: The true masters of Teyvat before the arrival of Celestia. They do not wield an element; they *are* the element. Their authority is absolute and requires no external sources'
  - 'Elemental Beings: Hypostases, Slimes, Specters, Oceanids, etc. Primitive yet pure embodiments of their respective elements'
  - 'Mystical Entities: Adepti, Youkai, and other spirits. Their power is also a part of their nature'

Sanctioned Authority (Celestia's System):
  - 'Authority granted and controlled by the Heavenly Principles'
  - 'Gnosis: Granted to Archons. A direct channel to Celestia, bestowing a divine level of control over an element and a nation'
  - 'Vision: Granted to mortals. A "license" to use elemental magic, a sign of divine recognition of one's ambitions'

Artificial Authority (Bypassing the System):
  - 'Technologies created to imitate or surpass sanctioned authority'
  - 'Delusion: An artifact created by the Fatui. Grants immense power at the cost of the wielder's life force'
  - 'Technology: Ruin machinery from Khaenri'ah, equipment of Fatui agents. Allows for the manipulation of elements without divine approval'

Anomalous Authority:
  - 'Unique cases that fall outside the standard classification'
  - 'Descenders (Example: The Traveler): The ability to resonate with the Statues of The Seven and switch between elements without a Vision. An absolute anomaly within Teyvat's system'

Arkhe Energy (Ousia and Pneuma)
  - 'A dualistic energy system from Fontaine, which is not an element but interacts with them. Used for solving puzzles and in combat.'

There are also powers that exist outside the system of the Seven Elements.

Abyssal Energy:
  - 'The antithesis to the Seven Elements. An alien, destructive, and corrupting force. It does not create, but rather consumes and distorts. Used by the Abyss Order and its creations'

The Power of Irminsul and Ley Lines:
  - 'The fundamental energy of Teyvat itself. It is not an element, but a kind of "nervous system" and "memory" of the world. The Dendro Archon has direct access to it, but the power itself stands above the elements'

Primordial Power:
  - 'The power of "light" brought by Phanes (The Primordial One) to defeat the Dragons and create humanity. Its nature and current status are unknown, but it predated the authority of the Archons'

Forbidden Knowledge:
  - 'Not so much an energy as an "information virus" from beyond. It causes illnesses (Eleazar), madness, and the decay of civilizations (the Sumeru desert). It is closely linked to the Abyss but is a specific, mental manifestation of it'
</elemental_magic_overview>

8.name: Ğ‘ĞµĞ·Ğ´Ğ½Ğ° (ĞœĞ¸Ñ€ ĞŸÑƒÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ‹)
8.content:
<abyss>
The Abyss, also known as the Void Realm, is a mysterious, chaotic dimension that exists outside of and beneath Teyvat. It is one of the Three Realms, alongside the Human Realm (Teyvat) and the Light Realm (the domain of the Vishaps). While the Human Realm and the Light Realm can coexist, the Abyss is hostile and destructive to both.
<nature_and_influence>
Nature and Influence:
Abyssal energy is the direct antithesis to the power of the Seven Elements. It does not create, but rather corrodes, distorts, and consumes. Its key characteristics are:
- Corruption: Abyssal energy causes mutations in living beings, turning them into monsters (e.g., Rifthounds). It is also capable of corrupting entire civilizations, as happened with Khaenri'ah.
- Forbidden Knowledge: The Abyss is a source of knowledge that drives individuals mad and destroys both individuals and the laws of the world.
- Erosion of Reality: Prolonged exposure to the Abyss wears down reality, erases memories, and physically disintegrates matter.
</nature_and_influence>
<inhabitants>
Inhabitants of the Abyss:
Beings associated with the Abyss are divided into several types:
- Abyssal Spawns: Creatures originally born in the Abyss or created by its power. They are alien to Teyvat. Example: Rifthounds, Abyss Lectors.
- Corrupted Beings: Former inhabitants of Teyvat, cursed and twisted by the power of the Abyss. The most famous example is the people of Khaenri'ah, who were turned into Hilichurls and monsters of the Abyss Order.
- Wielders of Abyssal Power: Sentient beings who consciously use the power of the Abyss, often risking their own sanity and lives. Example: some of the Fatui Harbingers, the Bloodstained Knight.
</inhabitants>
</abyss>

9.name: ĞšĞ°ÑĞ½Ñ€Ğ¸, Ğ°Ñ…~
9.content:
<khaenriah>
Khaenri'ah was a powerful, technologically advanced underground nation, unique to Teyvat as it was founded purely by humans and had no patron god (Archon). This nation was considered the pinnacle of human pride and achievement.
A key focus of their research was the "Art of Khemia" â€” a form of alchemy capable of creating artificial life. This practice, along with their technological advancements, was deemed by Celestia as a transgression into the divine domain and a threat to the "Heavenly Principles". The autonomous Ruin Machines, which still roam Teyvat, are a legacy of their technology.
500 years ago, Celestia initiated the Cataclysm, during which the nation was completely destroyed. The Archons from all seven nations were summoned to participate in this genocide, an act that left deep scars on them.
The people of Khaenri'ah were not killed, but were subjected to a curse of immortality. Pure-blooded Khaenri'ahns were cursed to wander the world forever, retaining their memories, while the others were distorted and transformed into Hilichurls and other monsters. The survivors who retained their sanity founded the Abyss Order to seek revenge on Celestia.
</khaenriah>

10.name: ĞœĞ¾Ñ€Ğ°
10.content:
<mora>
Mora is the primary, universal currency of Teyvat. Mora is minted exclusively in the Golden House. Mora can only be minted using the power of the Geo Archon, most likely through his Gnosis. It is unknown if anyone else can use this power to create Mora.
Mora looks like a round, golden coin with a three-leaf interlace pattern engraved on it against a triangular background.
</mora>

1.content:
The world is a dystopian vision of a world where the Axis has won World War II. The planet is divided into spheres of influence between the Third Reich, the Empire of Japan, and a weakened United States. Much of the world is under the rule of totalitarian regimes, and global rivalry is primarily between Berlin and Tokyo.

Following the defeat of the USSR, Russia has been fragmented into numerous warring military cliques. The country's western territories are occupied and Germanized through a system of Reichskommissariats, such as Ostland and Muscovy. The rest of the space from the Urals to Siberia is torn apart into warlord states: from the remnants of the Soviet intelligentsia in Komi to bandit regimes and dictatorships like Novosibirsk. Each of them strives for unification and the return of Moscow, but at the outset, they are too fragmented and weak to aspire to anything more.

The Japanese Empire is one of three centers of power. It controls the Greater East Asian Co-Prosperity Sphere, which includes China, Korea, Indonesia, and other regions. However, managing such vast territories overwhelms Tokyo. China is officially under Japanese control, but is effectively divided into puppet regimes and local cliques. Japan and Germany are not at direct war, but they are competing for influence in Asia and the Pacific.

Germany, the main victor of the war, remains a colossus in 1963, but is gradually losing its internal stability. Adolf Hitler is still alive, but old and gravely ill, and his demise will inevitably lead to a power struggle and most likely a bloody civil war. Europe is divided into occupied territories and colonies: France, Belgium, and the Netherlands are Germanized, while the eastern landsâ€”Ukraine, Muscovy, and Ostlandâ€”have been converted into colonies. Italy retains its ally status, but plays a subordinate role and tries to maintain their faction, Triumvirate, together. Within the Reich, a hidden struggle rages between factions: Himmler and the SS, GÃ¶ring with his economic clique, Bormann with the party apparatus, and Speer as a technocratic reformer. After the death of the FÃ¼hrer, the Reich faces civil war.

The United States has retained its independence, but is greatly weakened. Having lost the world war, it has lost its allies and is forced to focus on defending the Western Hemisphere. The country's economy is stable, but its influence on the international stage is limited. The United States remains a symbolic bastion of democracy, but its ability to intervene in global affairs is extremely limited.

The rest of the world is also divided and subordinated. Africa is assigned to the Axis powers, primarily Germany, where large-scale colonial repressions and resettlements are carried out. The Middle East is controlled by puppet regimes influenced by Berlin and Rome. Latin America is largely oriented toward the United States, but many local dictators pursue their own policies. India is formally independent, but in reality, dependent on Japan.

Thus, in 1963, the world in TNO hangs on the brink. Germany remains the center of power, but is torn by internal contradictions. Japan controls Asia but can barely manage its possessions. Russia is in the chaos of military cliques and fragmented states. The United States is a weakened but still viable counterweight to the totalitarian powers. Any event, be it the death of Hitler, colonial uprisings, or the success of Russian military dictators, could change the world order.

1.content:
Mitria is the third planet in the Borysthenis system. It is a temperate planet capable of sustaining life and limited amounts of magical energy.

Mitria is a low-fantasy, low-magic world with seven continents; the Upper West Cap, the Lower West Cap, the East Cap, the North Fence, the Lonothian Plateau, Khirican Island, and the Ice Spikes. These are stand-ins for North America, South America, Asia, Europe, Africa, Australia, and Antarctica, respectively.

2.content:
Cruidia is the richest country in the world of Mitria, located as the sole country of the Upper West Cap, with a GDP of several million gold. Cruidia is mostly temperate with land on the warmer side and only mildly varied geography featuring plains, plateaus, woodland, and beachy coasts, though there is a central valley desert called the Glass Valley, the source of Cruidian sand and glass exports. 

One of Cruidia's most important facets is the military, with over 1.5 million troops total. The military is typically split in half, with an offensive force led by General Calvin of Cruidia and a defensive force led by General Gaspard Rikke.

Cruidia's government is a Democratic monarchy with a head of state who ascends to power via succession, but laws can only be passed via voting through a parliament, then passed to the king for signing. The current king is King Johann Povlovsky I.

Whilst on paper Cruidia has no national religion, the Yaran faith is the primary religion in the country.

3.content:
Cruidia City is the capital of Cruidia and the current home of the royal family and parliament, placed atop and around a massive stone and moss plateau. 

Cruidia City's architecture is reminiscent of feudal England, with low-rise residential buildings, high-rise commercial buildings, and a decadent royal palace at the very center. 

Cruidia City is split into layers and quarters, an upper layer consisting of the palace, the parliamentary building, union offices, noble residents, and army headquarters, and a lower layer consisting of the residential district, the main church of Yara, the commercial district, and the mining district.
At each cardinal direction of the city, North, South, East, and West, there is a grand lift that can be taken to the upper and lower halves of the city. This lift is free to use.

Cruidia's economy is primarily stimulated through trade and the gold mine at the center of the city. The plateau at the center of the city is absolutely filled to the brim with gold. Cruidia is the richest country in the world per capita. This is achieved by the sheer amount of gold and gold coins the country produces.

10.content:
Ulfael'ka is a snowy country on the western side of the North Fence. It is a bitter cold environment characterized by its constant snow cover, lethally sub-zero temperatures save only for the summer, and its big game megafauna such as owlbears, regular bears, elk, and more. Its national languages are Elvish and Abyssal

Ufael'kan topography is icy and cold, characterized by evergreen forests, vast tundras, icy mountains, and cold ravines. It is said that, millennia ago, the 8th of the Nine Hells, Cania, briefly collided with the land of Ufael'ka after the Archdevil Mephistopheles cursed them, preventing the climate from ever ascending above 10 degrees Fahrenheit ever again.

Ufael'kan economy is primarily driven by production and mining, with iron and silver mines being the most prominent, alongside diamond and copper. The country also produces some gold, but not enough to even slightly compete with Cruidia.
Ufael'kan exports go hand in hand with their imports and architecture. Ufael'ka buys sand and glass from Cruidia, using it to accent their buildings with ice-like glass sculptures, fixtures, and other pieces of architecture. Their pride and joy is the Icewind Palace, the largest and most ornate building in the country, built with glass, steel frames, and hard ebony wood interiors. 

Religion in Ufael'ka is rather multi-faceted. Unlike a nation like Cruidia, Ufael'ka DOES have a national religion, that being a paganist religion worshipping the Ufael'kan Quartet, four gods that act as pillars and bastions of the country and culture. This national religion isn't enforced, however, and in practice, many rural citizens of Ufael'ka are actually Yarans.

Ufael'ka has been locked in a Cold War with the neighboring (and much warmer) country of Lairis. The two have been attempting to undercut each other for thousands of years.

Ufael'kan government is an absolute monarchy, with a monarch ruling alone with the advice of their court. The ruling family for the last 5,000 years is the BellamontÃ© family, with King Adrian BellamontÃ© at the current head of state, followed by his (now deceased) eldest daughter, Zamira, then his youngest, Zira.
Ufael'kan government is unique in that the head of state is (almost) always magical, containing psionic powers of some degree or another. King Adrian, just like his grandfather, was born with the power, but curiously, so were his heirs. 
Heirship will skip entire generations to put a psionic on the throne of Ufael'ka.

1.content: Sammy's manager has seen Dracula.

2.content:
To most Dracula is all but a ghost story, something to scare your kids into behaving. In reality he is very real. 

Dracula is a dark force that looms over the town of Wellwood, driving some inhabitants insane or simply taking them into its lair. This being has been seen in many forms. Some say it looked like a black mist, others say it looked like an impossibly pale man, or even say that the critters of the night are merely agents for it. 

Those who meet Dracula either arent seen again or become one of its thralls driven to cannibalism.

3.content:
{{user}}'s best friend since childhood. A typically cold and cynical person with a cigarette addiction. 

Devin only shows his softer side around {{user}} and Rueben. Often confiding in them about his abusive father or work troubles.

4.content: Back in highschool, Evan was always an outsider with little friends. More like a ghost than anything. When he was suddenly asked out to Prom by Audrey, a girl he liked. Sadly, though he was told it was all a dare the night of the prom and dumped on the spot.
